zh: 这一观点也适用于在巴基斯坦和印度这样的国家以及欧洲的移民中间，包办婚姻制度所要应对的挑战。
en: The same could be said of the challenges posed to the institution of arranged marriages in countries such as Pakistan and India and among immigrants in Europe.

zh: 这些人口中有一部分人，尤其是中产阶级，年轻的男人和女人不再愿意被他们的家族群体拿来交换，他们参与了资本主义的劳动力市场，从而在经济上独立于家庭。他们实际上可以基于个人选择而结婚，而不是成为以家庭为基础的交换系统的一部分。
en: In some segments of these populations, particularly in the middle classes, young men and women are no longer willing to be exchanged by their kin groups.Insofar as they are economically independent of their families because of participation in the capitalist labour market, they may actually marry on the basis of individual choice rather than being part of a family-based system of exchange.

zh: 虽然这当然是与评价从维生经济到资本主义的转变中的道德和政治因素有关——而这种变化对于许多人来说，不仅是非洲人，当然都是灾难性的——最初的人类学的任务在于仔细规划这些变化产生的社会和文化后果。
en: Although it may certainly be relevant to evaluate the moral and political aspects of a transition from a subsistence economy to capitalism – and the change has certainly been disastrous to many, not least Africans – the initial anthropological task lies in mapping out the social and cultural consequences of the changes.

zh: 天地初开，地球被创造出来。
en: The earth is created.

zh: 无机的力相互碰撞，然后结合产生生命。
en: Inorganic forces collide, then combine to produce life.

zh: 从最基本的生命进化到动物，从动物进化到哺乳动物，再从哺乳动物进化到类人猿。
en: From elemental life evolve animals; from animals, mammals; and from mammals, primates.

zh: 早期类人猿的自然栖息地——树——被用来练习抓握和立体视觉，后者使得人类祖先有可能去操控环境创造文化。
en: The natural habitat of the early primates – trees – selects for grasping hands and stereoscopic vision, which equip the ancestors of humans to manipulate the environment to create culture.

zh: 从树上下到地上，这些祖先进化成两腿站立，释放双手使用工具。
en: Coming down from the trees, these ancestors evolve a two-legged stance, freeing the hands to use tools.

zh: 使用工具反过来也释放了嘴的功能，不再仅仅是用于撕咬。
en: The use of tools in turn frees the mouth for functions other than grasping and tearing.

zh: 就像在对普遍性的追求中那样，一个人可能会将这些研究划分成两类，一类集中于想法，一类集中于行为。
en: As in the search for universals, one may divide these studies into those focusing on conduct and those focusing on thought.

zh: 一个人也可能会在类型学、法律和数学公式间进行区别。
en: One may also distinguish between typologies, laws, and mathematical formulations.

zh: 类形学认可并定义特征群；随着一个人考察世界上的社会，一个人会看到，在发现特征 X的时候，也发现了特征Y；凡是在找到A的地方，也能找到B。一个共变特质的集合，就是一个“类型”。
en: Typologies simply recognize and define clusters of traits; that is, as one surveys the societies of the world, one sees that where trait X is found, so also is trait Y, and where A is found, so also is B. A cluster of covarying traits is a "type".

zh: 因而，“吉那”这个概念把人类学家所谓的财产、居住地、社会权利和义务，以及政治等集合在一个简单的家族关系术语中。只有男人和他们的孩子才是家系的成员。
en: The concept of ginna thus groups what anthropologists see as property, place of residence, social rights and duties, and politics, in a single kinship term.Only men and their children are members of the lineage.

zh: 妻子/母亲属于另外的不同中心的家系。
en: The wives/mothers belong to other lineages which are centred elsewhere.

zh: 婚姻通常由两位父亲组织起来，他们用这种方式加强了友谊的非正式纽带。
en: Marriage is usually organised by the two fathers, who strengthen informal ties of friendship in this way.

zh: 多贡人在家系的层次上是异族婚配的。
en: The Dogon are exogamous at the lineage level.

zh: 离婚也会发生：这时候，因为父系原则包含了所有的事情，父亲和他的家系有权要回他们的子女。
en: Divorce does occur; as the patrilineal principle is all-encompassing, the father and his lineage are entitled to keep the children when this happens.

zh: 文化和理性的增长被认为属于同一进程。
en: The growth of culture and of rationality were thought to belong to the same process.

zh: 换句话说，随着时间的推移，人在智力、精神和审美方面变得更有“教养”。
en: In other words, human beings became more "cultivated" as they progressed over time intellectually, spiritually and aesthetically.

zh: 米歇尔·德·塞都（Michel de Certeau 1994:103)提出，这种模式把文化当作“有教养”的人的基本特征（其他人则被称为“传统的”），含有深刻的政治意味，通过统治者的运用成为一项十分有效的工具，引入优势道德规范，为他们自己赋权。
en: De Certeau (1994:103) notes that such a model, which proclaims culture as a defining feature of "cultivated" human beings (other people have something called "tradition"), can have a strong political agenda, and in the hands of empires it has served a rather useful tool for introducing elitist norms wherever they imposed power.

zh: 迈克尔·奥克肖特（Michael Oakeshott 1962）认为，交谈就是人类文化所要实现的，也是人类社会固有的特征。
en: For Michael Oakeshott (1962), conversation is what human cultures accomplish and what human societies inherit.

zh: 交谈是代表不同的习惯和方式的个体的声音的汇集。
en: Conversation is a meeting of individual voices speaking in different idiom or mode.

zh: 科学、诗歌、实践行动以及历史都是各种不同的讲述形式。
en: Science, poetry, practical activity and history are such modes of speech, different universes of discourse.

zh: 从历史上讲，家系一般更为单薄，作为比宗族更小型的群体而存在。
en: Thus lineages are generally historically more shallow, and as a consequence smaller, groups than clans.

zh: 在许多社会，包括特罗布里恩德群岛和斯瓦特河谷，一些家系被认为是偶尔结成了联盟而变成宗族——就像家族群体。
en: In many societies, including the Trobriand Islands and Swat valley, several lineages considered to be related occasionally form alliances and so appear as clans – as kin groupings at a higher systemic level.

zh: 人类学家建立了很多有关不同种类的宗族组织概念，但是我们应该记住，这些事我们自己的观念而不是被调查者的观念。
en: Anthropologists have developed concepts about several kinds of clan organisation, but we should keep in mind that these notions are our own and not those of the informants.

zh: 一种流传甚广的形式是圆锥型宗族，围绕一个集权领导团体的有层次的等级制度，每一个层次都有一个公认的领导者，通常是家系中最年长的男人，并且，在更高的层次上，作为一个整体的宗族还有一位首领。
en: One widespread form is the conical clan, which is hierarchically ordered with a centralised leadership.There is one recognised leader, usually the oldest man of the lineage, at each level, and the clan as a whole has a chief at a higher level.

zh: 在亚马逊人中，很难发现集体占有土地的群体，社区老人也很难约束其他人。
en: It was as difficult to find corporate land-holding groups among Amazonian people, as the elders who might rule them.

zh: 不存在男人群体间交换女人的联姻关系。
en: There were no groups of men forming ties of alliance through the exchange of their women.

zh: 相反，婚姻纽带在亚马逊人的社会结构中是非常突出的，而且更倾向于与胞族而非继嗣的法则相联系。
en: Instead, ties of marriage, which were highly salient to Amazonian constructs of sociality, were more likely to be linked to a principle of cognation than descent.

zh: 但我们的良知具有社会文化根源，它是超有机体的文化力量作用于个人有机体的产物。
en: But our conscience has a sociocultural origin; it is the operation of supra-individual cultural forces upon the individual organism.

zh: 良知无非是对作用于我们的社会文化力量的经验和意识。
en: Conscience is merely our experience and our awareness of the operation of certain sociocultural forces upon us.

zh: 是非曲直是具有社会文化根源的事物，它们导源于社会制度，而不是个人的生物机体。
en: Right and wrong are matters of sociocultural genesis; they are originated by social systems, not by individual biological organisms.

zh: 对共同福利有害或被人们认为有害的行为是坏的，而促进共同福利的行为则是好的。
en: Behavior that is injurious, or thought to be harmful, to the general welfare is wrong; behavior that promotes the general welfare is good.

zh: 他们的父母、袓父、外袓父母因其陈旧观念和生活方式都被排除在外。
en: Excluded are parents and grandparents of the cousins, with their older views and lifestyles.

zh: 两可系继嗣仍然是首要的组织原则，不过，代的原则已将它改变了。
en: Ambilineal descent remains the primary organizing principle, but it has been modified by a generational principle.

zh: 除此之外，堂表兄弟姐妹俱乐部在很多方面都与家庭圈有相同的组织和运行方式。
en: Otherwise, cousins clubs are organized and function in many of the same ways as family circles.

zh: 对实现世界政治统一的抵制力量，在某种程度上似乎被跨国公司的兴起抵消了。
en: The world's resistance to political integration seems to be offset, at least partially, by the rise of multinational corporations.

zh: 因为这些公司跨越了国界，它们是推进全球整合的力量，尽管有各种政治差异把人们分开。
en: Because these cut across the boundaries berween states, they are a force for global unity despite the political differences that divide people.

zh: 人类学家非常熟悉这种情形，就像下面这段对祖尼印第安人整合机制的描述那样：四五个不同层面的系统相互交织，因而维持了整个社会的统一性，如果这些不同层面相互融合的话，这种统一性很快就会消失，因而很有可能带来隔离和分裂宗族、兄弟互助会、祭司群体、地下大会堂，在某种意义上还有赌博团伙，都是分化机构。
en: Situations such as this are well known to anthropologists, as illustrated by this description of Zuni Indian integrative mechanisms: segregation and fission.The clans, the fraternities, the priesthoods, the kivas, in a measure the gaming parties, are ail dividing agencies.

zh: 如果它们相互一致的话，社会结构的裂缝就会很深；通过彼此相互交织，它们制造出各种分支，这些分支造成了一种几乎不可思议的复杂性，但却绝不会导致这个民族实体的分裂。
en: If they coincided, the rifts in the social structure would be deep; by countering each other they cause segmentations which produce an almost marvelous complexity, but can never break apart the national entity.

zh: “精神一肉体”的问题与活力论同机械论的争论有关。
en: The "Mind-Body" problem is of one piece with the Vitalism-Mechanism controversy.

zh: 从来没有人能“证明”活力论是错误的，但科学家们和许多哲学家们都认为，应把活力论与作陈腐的、畸形的尤其是贫瘠的理论加以否定的时刻已经来临。
en: No one has ever "disproved" the theory of Vitalism, but scientists, and many philosophers, are agreed that the time has come when it should be ignored as obsolete, outgrown and, above all, sterile.

zh: 这并不是说，机械论哲学就是真理（即是 大写字母的“真理”），而活力论哲学则是谬误；而是说机械论一向是富于成效的，活力论则是不结果实的花朵。
en: It is not that the philosophy of Mechanism is True (with a capital T) and that of Vitalism False.It is that Mechanism has been fruitful, productive; Vitalism barren and sterile.

zh: 尽管男性的活动被认为比女性的活动更具有声望，但妇女作为生活的支撑者而得到所有人的明确承认和感激。
en: Although masculine activities were considered more prestigious than those of women, the latter were explicitly acknowledged by all as the sustainers of life.

zh: 而且，妇女是“长屋”（从母居扩大家庭的住所）的家长，继嗣和继承经由女性传递，仪式生活也以女性活动为中心。
en: Moreover, women headed the long-houses (dwellings matrilocal extended families occupied), descent and inheritance passed through women，and ceremonial life centered on women's activities.

zh: 尽管男子掌握家户之外的所有领导位置，并享有村庄、部落和六族联盟议会中的所有领导位置，但是他们就职却必须由本氏族的妇女提名，而且妇女对他们还有否决权。
en: Although men held all leadership positions outside households, on the councils of the villages, tribes, and the league of Five Nations, the women of their lineages nominated them for these positions and held veto power over them.

zh: 这样，男性领导权与女性权威均衡。
en: Thus, male leadership was balanced by female authority.

zh: 从这个印度乡村的社会流动性的概略图中，我们可以看到，有三种等级范畴，各自独立地发挥着部分功能：经济系统、种姓制度和公共行政体系。
en: From this sketch of social mobility in an Indian village, we see that there are three scales of rank, functioning partly independently of each other: the economic system, the caste system and public administration.

zh: 在各自的体系内部，不同资源风险难料，但是它们全都有权力的分化，通过不同的准则被合法化，并且一部分是不能比较的。
en: Different resources are at stake within the respective systems, but all of them entail power differentiation, are legitimated through different principles and are partly incommensurable.

zh: 比斯帕拉的婆罗门并不认可潘姓人通过公共行政获得声望的提升；不过，由于在地方政府的攀升，潘姓成员的人变得能够对婆罗门施加某些权力。
en: The Brahmins of Bisipara did not recognise the Pan rise to prestige through public administration; however, through climbing in local government, members of the Pan caste became able to exert some power over Brahmins.

zh: 还应该注意到，事实证明将经济权力转换成仪式洁净度是有可能的同时，将（公共部门的）政治权力转换成同样的声望是不可能的。
en: It should also be noted that while it proved possible to convert economic power into ritual purity, it is not possible to convert political power (in the public sector) into similar prestige.

zh: 这似乎是由于贾吉摩尼制度的作用，它联合了经济和仪式的因素，却并没有包括政府部门在内。
en: This seems to be caused by the workings of the jajmani system, which combines economic and ritual factors but does not include the state sector.

zh: 流言蜚语本质上是一个内在的沟通过程：通过它，个体在一起检验并讨论他们共同生活于其中的规则和习俗。
en: Gossip is essentially a metacommunicative process: an activity through which individuals examine and discuss together the rules and conventions by which they commonly live.

zh: 此外，由于规则在运用中具有相对性和模糊性，这种解释永远都不是最终的解释和合意。
en: Moreover, since rules are relative and ambiguous in their application, such interpretation is never final or consensual.

zh: 因此，流言蜚语每时每刻都在瓦解、评价、重组日常世界。
en: Hence, gossip at once disassembles, evaluates and reconstitutes the everyday world.

zh: 正如科科所显示的，一些妇女被官方的美“力”的意识形态所困住，而数十万妇女掉进了硅胶隆胸的陷阱。
en: As Coco shows, some women get caught in the official beaLity ideology, and in the case of siliconegel breast implants some hundreds of thousands of women have been ensnared.

zh: 但是，谁受骗以及何时受骗,对理解权力生态学是重要的。妇女接受隆胸手术的平均年龄是36岁，并且通常有两个孩子。
en: But who gets caught and when is important to an understanding of the ecology of power The average age of a woman having breast implantation is 36 years, and she has an average of two children.

zh: 有文献表明，在一起养育的人相互不太有性吸引力，但是“熟悉酿成轻视”的论点可能简单地以结果代替原因。
en: It has been documented that human beings raised together have less sexual attraction for one another, but by itself this "familiarity breeds contempt" argument simply may substitute the result for the cause.

zh: 乱伦禁忌保证一直有密切接触的儿童与其父母避免相互视为性对象。
en: The incest taboo ensures that children and their parents, who are constantly in intimate contact, avoid regarding one another as sexual objects.

zh: 除此之外,如果存在对乱伦的本能恐惧，那么我们就会面临很大的困难：解释违犯乱伦禁忌决不是罕见的行为，就像在北美社会发生的那样（在美国10%—14%的18岁以下的儿童涉及乱伦关系），或者解释制度化的乱伦情况，例如，秘鲁估计有印加帝国的首领必须娶他自己的姐妹为妻。
en: Besides this, if an instinctive horror of incest exists, we would be hard pressed to account for the far from rare violations of the incest taboo, such as occur in North American society (an estimated 10%-14% of children under 18 years of age in the United States have been involved in incestuous relations), or for cases of institutionalized incest, such as requiring the head of the Inca empire in Peru to marry his own sister.

zh: 另一个深受欢迎的声明是，所有的人类群体都有乱伦禁忌，所以禁止特定亲族中的婚姻。
en: Another favorite claim is that all human groups have an incest taboo: a prohibition against marriage among certain classes of relatives.

zh: 最后这一声明具有教育意义。
en: This last claim is instructive in pointing to the kinds of qualifications one must introduce when hazarding generalizations about humankind.

zh: 然而，实际上，乱伦禁忌在哪类亲属之间禁止通婚上也是各不相同。
en: The incest taboo, for example, varies in terms of which classes of relatives are prohibited mates.

zh: 父母和孩子之间以及兄弟姐妹之间的婚姻被广泛禁止，但是表亲婚姻在某些社会不仅是允许的，而且更受喜欢甚或被明文规定下来。
en: Mating and marriage between parents and children and among siblings are prohibited widely, but mating among close cousins is not only permitted but preferred or prescribed in certain societies and prohibited in others.

zh: 例如，在皇室和精英阶层中，表亲婚姻非常常见，但是，人类学家最感兴趣的风俗是所谓的“母方交表婚”。
en: Among the royalty and elite, for example, marriage of cousins is common, but the most interesting custom for anthropologists is that known as "matrilateral cross-cousin marriage."

zh: 哈金在那些日常的、常识性的和无须运用精确理由的推理，与更为专门化的领域内那些需要精确理由的推理之间作了区别。
en: Hacking distinguishes between everyday, commonsensical reasoning that does not need to apply any elaborate set of reasons and those more specialized domains that do.

zh: 在这些专门化的领域中以及与它们相关的、具有历史和文化差异性的风格中，同时存在着一种文化和历史的多元件。
en: There is both a cultural and a historical plurality of these specialized domains and of historically and culturally diverse styles associated with them.

zh: 通过对推理、方法和客体的历史风格的多样性的接受，哈金得出结论认为，思想家们频繁地纠正事物、解决问题、确立真理。
en: From the acceptance of a diversity of historical styles of reasoning, of methods, and objects, Hacking draws the conclusion that thinkers frequently got things right, solved problems, and established truths.

zh: 但是，他指出，这并不意味着我们应当追求一种统一的波普尔式的真理王国，而是像保罗˙费耶阿本德(Paul Feyerabend)那样，我们应尽可能开放地让我们的选择接受探询。问题：表达不通顺改1：我们应尽可能地让我们的选择公开接受质询。
en: But, he argues, this does not imply that we should search for a unified Popperian realm of the true; rather, a la Paul Feyerabend, we should keep our options in inquiry as open as possible.

zh: 矛盾（和两面性或虚伪一样）可推动有意图的社会效果：取悦选民，迷惑敌人，善待客人，维系友谊，以及侮辱、煽动、误导、神秘化其他人或自己。
en: Then again, contradictoriness (as duplicity or hypocrisy) can be employed as a vehicle for all manner of purposive social gain: pleasing an electorate, confusing an enemy, being polite to a guest, keeping in with a friend, insulting, provoking, misleading, mystifying another or oneself.

zh: 矛盾的较为文学化的用法会混淆信仰和主张，这种矛盾并不总是不言自明的。
en: While between the more and less deliberate uses of contradictions are beliefs and assertions which might be described as vague or fuzzy, such that contradictoriness is not always so self-evident.

zh: 沃尔夫勒姆（Wolfram 1985: 72-3）提出，人可以正视等级差异，在清晰和模糊、自证和混淆矛盾之间，个体关系的复杂性可以通过他或她矛盾的表达加以充分分析。
en: One can envisage a graded scale, Wolfram suggests (1985:72–3), between blatant and nonblatant, self-evident and fuzzy contradictions, such that the complexity of an individual’s relationship with his or her contradictory representations of self and world is given full analytical measure.

zh: 翁（Ong 1967,1977)以及其他人，对感觉在不同的文化和不同的时代是如何划分等级的事实进行了研究。
en: Ong (1967, 1977), among others, has studied ways in which the senses are hierarchically ordered in different cultures and epochs.

zh: 他认为在西方文字文化中，视觉压倒了声音和触觉、嗅觉、味觉，成为真理的凭据。
en: He argues that the truth of vision in Western, literate cultures has predominated over the evidences of sound and interlocution, of touch, smell, and taste.

zh: （玛丽˙普拉特注意到，游记中对气味极为出色的捕捉，在民族志中实际上阙如。
en: (Mary Pratt has observed that references to odor, very prominent in travel writing, are virtually absent from ethnographies.)

zh: ）人类学调査中占据优势的方法，是参与观察、数据收集、文化描述，所有这些都预先假定了一个外部立足点——看、对象化，或者更近—点，“阅读”一个给定的现实。约翰尼斯˙费边（Fabian 1983)用翁的作品来批评民族志，他探讨了把文化事实认定为观察到的事情——而不是，比如说听到的、在对话中想象出来的，或转录下来的事情一一的后果。
en: The predominant metaphors in anthropological research have been participant-observation, data collection, and cultural description, all of which presuppose a standpoint outside—looking at, objectifying, or, somewhat closer, "reading," a given reality.

zh: 接着弗朗西丝˙耶茨（Yates 1960）指出，西方的分类想象本质上是极为视觉至上的，把文化组织得仿佛它们是记忆的剧场，或空间化的阵列。
描述语言学记录和解释一种语言在其历史上某一特定时期的特点。
en: Descriptive linguistics registers and explains the features of a language at a particular time in its history.

zh: 历史语言学研究同一语言的早期和晚期形式之间的关系。
en: Historical linguistics investigates relationships between earlier and later forms of the same language.

zh: 历史语言学家主要关心的是，辨别在语言趋异过程中语言发生变化背后的力量。
en: A major concern of historical linguists is to identify the forces behind the changes that have occurred in languages in the course of linguistic divergence.

zh: 历史语言学家也提供一种手段，可大体追溯某些民族的迁徙、入侵和接触。
en: Historical linguistics also provides a means of roughly dating certain human migrations, invasions, and contacts with other people.

zh: 民族语言学研究语言，因为语言与社会、文化的其他部分以及人类行为有关。
en: Ethnolinguistics deals with language as it relates to society, the rest of culture, and human behavior.

zh: 所有同一性别和同一辈分的亲属都使用同一个称谓。
en: All relatives of the same generation and sex are referred to by the same term.

zh: 英裔美国人使用的爱斯基摩制，强调核心家庭的地位，它把所有其他属于同一辈分的亲属都混入少数笼统的、一般未加分化的范畴之中。
en: The Eskimo system, used by Anglo Americans, emphasizes the nuclear family and merges all other relatives in a given generation into a few large, generally undifferentiated categories.

zh: 在易洛魁制中，父亲及其兄弟共用同一个称呼，而母亲及其姐妹则共用另一个称呼。
en: In the Iroquois system, a single term is used for a father and his brother and another term for a mother and her sister.

zh: 平表兄弟姐妹等同于兄弟和姐妹，但却区别于交表兄弟姐妹。
en: Parallel cousins are equated with brothers and sisters but distinguished from cross cousins.

zh: 奥马哈制和克劳制中也一样，但有一点不同，它们把交表兄弟姐妹等同于不同辈分的亲属。
en: The same is true in the Omaha and Crow systems, except they equate cross cousins with relatives of other generations.

zh: 相对而言，比较少见的苏丹制或描述制，对所有的姑姨婶、叔伯舅、堂表兄弟姐妹以及亲兄弟姐妹都区别对待。
en: The relatively rare Sudanese or descriptive system treats all aunts, uncles, cousins, and sib¬lings as different from one another.

zh: 在巴西的印第安人日上，总会发生某种死亡仪式。
en: As always, on Indian Day in Brazil, a kind of macabre ritual takes place.

zh: 大众媒体谈起原住民“不可避免的灭绝”来,就好像他们是一个正在消失的物种一样。
en: The mass media talk about the "inevitable extinction" of indigenous peoples as if they were a disappearing species.

zh: 生态学家和人类学家一再申明：对于地球的未来生存而言，社会的多样性是至关重要的，而原住民也是必要的。
en: Ecologists and anthropologists reaffirm the vitality of socio-diversity and the necessity of indigenous peoples for the future survival of the planet.

zh: 需要改变的，是巴西人关于印第安人和一般少数民族的意识，而非印第安人本身——他们不只是一个曾经伟大的、过去的幸存者或“残留者”，而且完全有能力为他们自己的未来创造可行的发展模式。
en: Brazilian consciousness, in relation to Indians and minorities in general, needs to change, not the Indians who have shown that they are not merely "survivors" or "remnants" of a once great past, but fully capable of forging viable models for their future.

zh: 尽管在贝都因人社会中官方贬低这些诗歌,但它们在人们的日常生活中却发挥着至关重要的作用。
en: Despite this official devaluation in the male-dominated society of the Bedouins, however, they play a vital part in peoples's daily lives.

zh: 个人如果用“短歌”来发表言论和表达感情，那么即使这些言论和感情违反了道德体系，他们也能得到豁免具有悖论意味的是，由于那些唱歌者只和与自己关系亲密的人分享这些“不道德”的情感，并用非个人的传统曲式隐蔽地表达这些情感，这证明他们有一定的控制力，因此也实际上提升了他们的道德声望。
en: In their little songs, individuals are shielded from the consequences of making statements and expressing sentiments that contravene the moral system.Paradoxically, by sharing these "immoral" sentiments only with intimates and veiling them in impersonal traditional formulas, those who recite rhem demonstrate they have a certain control, which actually enhances their moral standing.As is often true of folklore in general, the a little songs of the Awlad AIi provide a sanctioned outlet for otherwise taboo thoughts or opinions.

zh: 就像一般的民俗一样，奥拉德阿利人的“短歌”为那些原本属于禁忌的思想或 观点提供了文化方面恰当的发泄途径。
倡导从最广义上理解民族科学的先驱是查尔斯•弗雷克 (Charles Frake)。他撰写了一系列关于生态系统、疾病的解释、法律 观念，乃至如何进入一个房子，如何在苏巴南（Subanum)、亚坎 (Yakan)和其他菲律宾文化地区讨要饮料的著作，从中探求了文化的神秘性和世俗性（参见例如Fmke 1980)。
en: The foremost proponent of ethnoscience in its broadest sense, Charles Frake, has explored both the esoteric and the mundane in his works on ecological systems, interpretations of illness, concepts of law, how to enter a house, and how to ask for a drink in the Subanum, Yakan, and other cultures of the Philippines (see, e.g., Frake 1980).

zh: 正如这些例子所展示的，弗雷克的民族科学及说明了社会行为，也对民族科学话语的静态范畴进行了说明。
en: As these examples show, Frake’s ethnoscience takes social action as well as the static categories of ethnoscientific discourse into account.

zh: 虽然民族志的田野工作是民族学的基础，但它不是民族学家的唯一工作。
en: Although ethnographic fieldwork is basic to ethnology, it is not the sole occupation of the ethnologist.

zh: 民族志的性质大致是描述性的，它为（有较多理论志向的）民族学家提供基础数据，然后民族学家就可能利用这些数据，通过把一种文化的某个特殊方面与其他文化中的相同方面做比较而对它加以研究。
en: Largely descriptive in nature, ethnography provides the basic data the ethnologist (who is more theoretically oriented) then may use to study one particular aspect of a culture by comparing it with that same aspect in others.

zh: 人类学家始终如一地做这种跨文化比较，这也是该学科的另一个标志。
en: Anthropologists constantly make such cross-cultural comparisons, and this is another hallmark of the discipline.

zh: 当你比较人们从事于北美人视为“家务”的时间，通过跨文化比较就可能产生对你自己的信念和实践的令人感兴趣的深刻见解。
en: Interesting insights into our own practices may come from cross-cultural comparisons, as when one compares the time people devote to what we consider housework.

zh: 在考古学界，瑞典学者奥斯卡•蒙特柳斯在19世纪80、90年代，完善了欧洲新石器时代和青铜时代的类型学。
en: In archaeology, Swedish writer Oscar Montelius, in the 1880s and 1890s, refined the typology of the European Neolithic and Bronze Ages.

zh: 他指出，遍布欧洲的地区变体和细节的细微发展可以被说明是由于传播而不是因为进化 (参见Trigger 1989: 155 -61)。
en: He argued that regional variations and specific small developments across Europe could be accounted for by diffusion, rather than by evolution (see Trigger 1989: 155–61).

zh: 在民族学中，事情更加微妙，但是回顾一下历史很重要。摩尔根认为亲属称谓主要依赖于迁移和传播，泰勒也经常谈到传播，并将文化描述为具有“黏附力”（adhesions) 的，或者说文化要素经常在一起被发现。
en: In ethnology, things were more subtle, but it is important to recall that Morgan’s thinking about kinship terminologies depended heavily on both migration and diffusion, and Tylor often spoke of diffusion and described cultures as having ‘adhesions’, or elements of culture usually found together.

zh: 因为考古学家一般专门研究过去的文化，因此民族学家（ethnologist），或社会文化人类学家，专门研究现在的文化。
en: While the archaeologist has traditionally concentrated on past cultures, the ethnologist, or socio-cultural anthropologist, concentrates on present cultures.

zh: 与考古学家专注于研究物质实物以了解人的行为不同，民族学家专门研究人们的观念和实践，他们看到它们、经验到它们，甚至与他们将要了解的文化中的那些人讨论这些观念和实践。
en: And unlike the archaeologist, who focuses on the study of material objects to learn about human behavior, the ethnologist concentrates on the study of human behavior as it can be seen, experienced, and even discussed with those whose culture is to be understood.

zh: 民族学家研究的根基是民族志（ethnography）。
en: Fundamental to the ethnologist approach is descriptive ethnography.

zh: 只要有可能，民族学家就设法生活在他正研究的那些人之中而成为民族志学家。
en: Whenever possible, the ethnologist becomes ethnographer by going to live among the people under study.

zh: 虽然民族志的田野工作是民族学的基础，但它不是民族学家的唯一工作。
en: Although ethnographic fieldwork is basic to ethnology, it is not the sole occupation of the ethnologist.

zh: 民族志的性质大致是描述性的，它为（有较多理论志向的）民族学家提供基础数据，然后民族学家就可能利用这些数据，通过把一种文化的某个特殊方面与其他文化中的相同方面做比较而对它加以研究。
en: Largely descriptive in nature, ethnography provides the basic data the ethnologist (who is more theoretically oriented) then may use to study one particular aspect of a culture by comparing it with that same aspect in others.

zh: 人类学家始终如一地做这种跨文化比较，这也是该学科的另一个标志。
en: Anthropologists constantly make such cross-cultural comparisons, and this is another hallmark of the discipline.

zh: 当你比较人们从事于北美人视为“家务”的时间，通过跨文化比较就可能产生对你自己的信念和实践的令人感兴趣的深刻见解。
en: Interesting insights into our own practices may come from cross-cultural comparisons, as when one compares the time people devote to what we consider housework.

zh: 在美国，普遍的信念是，家用设备消费用品的产出日益增长导致家务持续减少,相应的结果是闲暇时间增加。
en: In North American society, a widespread belief is that the ever-increasing output of household appliance consumer goods has resulted in a steady reduction in housework, with a consequent increase in leisure time.

zh: 矛盾内在于社会文化环境，其现象学方面也开始受到当代民族志的重视（Moore 1987；Ewing 1990；Rapport 1993a，1997c）。
en: The contradictoriness inherent within socio-cultural milieux, and its phenomenological appreciation, has also begun to be emphasized in contemporary ethnography (Moore 1987; Ewing 1990; Rapport 1993a, 1997c).

zh: 出现了对矛盾中的人群之间和人群内部的思想、信仰和行为的描述。
en: Here is a recounting of contradictory thoughts, beliefs and behaviours both between people and within people.

zh: 个体被看作是依附于结构并保持自己多样化的观点，由于各种因素、关系、价值观念、道德理念、渴望和期待等的不同产生矛盾。
en: Individuals are seen apt to construct and maintain a diversity of perspectives for themselves, each contradictory in terms of the elements, relationships, values, norms, desires, expectations and so on of all the others.

zh: 村委会、多贡人的贺贡或雅诺马马人的头领所发挥的作用，常常包括调停不同利益的家族团体之间的关系。
en: The role of the village council and hogon of the Dogon, or the headman of the Yanomamö, often consists of mediating between kin groups with opposing interests.

zh: 不过，他们也负责制定“外交政策”。
en: However, they are also responsible for foreign policy.

zh: 村子以外没有合法的权威，每个村子成为独立的政治单元。
en: There is no legitimate authority outside of the village, and each village is thus an independent political unit.

zh: 对于村民来说，村子就是宇宙的中心。
en: To the villagers, the village is the centre of the universe.

zh: 家庭、生计、童年回忆、身体防御和将来都在于此。
en: Family, livelihood, childhood memories, physical protection and future all lie there.

zh: （我们应该记住，这里的时态是民族志的现在时。事实上，今天的多贡人和雅诺马马人不可避免都会受到国家和世界资本主义的影响。）
en: (Here we should keep in mind that the tense is the ethnographic present. Neither the Dogon nor the Yanomamö are today unaffected by the state and world capitalism.)

zh: 欧洲中心主义的话语，诞生于对等级体系全面的支配性的编造之中，成为其人性观念的至高意识。
en: The Eurocentric discourse, born within a hegemonic and totalizing rhetoric of hierarchy, is deeply exclusive in its view of humanity.

zh: 它只允许把征服者单独看待，相反，亚马逊土著人的民族中心主义观念其实可理解为建立在平等的基础上，其对相异性的表述更多的是与自身对人性的分类相容的。
en: It allows might to the conquerors alone.In contrast, the ethnocentrism of indigenous Amazonian discourse can best be understood as being based upon a rhetoric of equality, and its expressions of alterity are much more inclusive in its categorization of humanity.

zh: 此时，并不只给自己赋予权力。
en: Here power does not accrue to self alone.

zh: 这表明在实践中，主观判断仍将是比较正确的，而且欲取得国家地位，在多数情况下，其代价仍将是冲突和流血。
en: That suggests that, in practice, might will continue to be the better part of right, and the price of statehood will continue, in most cases, to be conflict and bloodshed.

zh: 这样一个结论与亚当·罗伯茨（Adam Roberts)对民族自决的整体概念所做的剖析不谋而合，而该剖析是细心、多疑的，但并非说是专横的。
en: Such a conclusion fits well with Adam Roberts's careful and sceptical, not to say magisterial, dissection of the whole concept of national self-determination.

zh: 罗伯茨反对任何过于整齐划一和系统安排民族与国家之间关系的企图。
en: Roberts rightly warns against any attempt to be too tidy or systematic in organising the relationship between nations and states.

zh: 事实上，我即将论证，它是作为一种写作，尤其是作为文本化的过程被添造进民族志的构思和实践中的。
en: Indeed, I shall argue in a moment that it is built into the conception and practice of ethnography as a process of writing, specifically of textualization.

zh: 每一种将自己设想成“让文化变成写作”的描述或解释，从口头上东拉西扯的经验（“本地人”，的田野工作者的）发展到这种经验的完成版本（民族志文本），都在制定着“抢救”的结构。
en: Every description or interpretation that conceives itself as "bringing a culture into writing,"moving from oral-discursive experience (the "native's," the fieldworker's) to a written version of that experience (the ethnographic text) is enacting the structure of "salvage."

zh: 从民族志过程被视为铭写（而不是，例如抄写或对话）的角度看，表述将继续制定一种有效的、有问题的、寓言性的结构。
en: To the extent that the ethnographic process is seen as inscription (rather than, for example as transcription, or dialogue) the representation will continue to enact a potent, and questionable, allegorical structure.

zh: 在1931年，埃文思-普里查德又进行了一次尝试，发现人们甚至比上次更加充满敌意。
en: In 1931 Evans-Pritchard tries again and finds people even more hostile than before.

zh: 然而他又乐得有一个被接受的时期：“我终于开始感觉到自己是这个社区的一个成员，而人们也是这样接受我的，(第13页）当他受到一场疟疾的侵害的时候，他的牧歌式的插曲又一次突然中断了。
en: He nonetheless again enjoys a period of acceptance: "I at last began to feel myself a member of the community and to be accepted as such" (13).Once again his pastoral interlude ends abruptly when he falls to an attack of malaria.

zh: 他在1935年和1936年的远征调査各自持续了七周左右，都是因为严重的疾病而不得不停止下来。
en: His 1935 and 1936 expeditions each last about seven weeks, and both draw to a halt because of serious illness.

zh: 作为叙述者的埃文思-普里查德把他自己这个田野工作者描述成在最严峻的环境里能够平和地表现自己的精神的男子。
en: Evans-Pritchard the narrator depicts himself the fieldworker as a man endowed with calm presence of mind under the most arduous conditions.

zh: 他不用假设说话，还会取笑这个田野工作者。
en: He speaks without presumption and pokes fun at the fieldworker.

zh: 问题：表达不符汉语习惯改1：比上次敌意更强。
然而他又经历了一段被接受的时期
石刻刀——有像凿子—样刀口的工具——虽然是由穆斯捷工具制造者较早发明的，但是在旧石器时代晚期却是常用工具。
en: The burin — a stone tool with chisel-like edges—although invented earlier by Mousterian tool-makers, came into common use in the Upper Paleolithic.

zh: 石刻刀提供了雕刻骨头和鹿角的出色手段，把骨头和鹿角加工成为诸如鱼钩和鱼叉那样的工具。
en: The burin provided an excellent means of carving bone and antler, used for tools such as fishhooks and harpoons.

zh: 梭镖投射器是一种在顶端装上钩状物用来投射梭镙的木制器具。
en: The atlatl, which consisted of a piece of wood with a groove in it for holding and throwing a spear, also appeared at this time.

zh: 借助梭镖投射器，猎人增加了梭镖发射后的力量弓箭可以说超出了这种梭镖投射器。
en: With the atlatl, hunters increased the force behind the spear throw.The bow and arrow went even beyond this.

zh: 弓弦增加了箭枝的发射力量，能使它射得比梭镖更远，且具有更大的效力，甚至在借助于梭镖投射器发射梭镖时也是这样。
en: The bowstring increased the force on the arrow, enabling it to travel farther and with greater effectiveness than a spear thrown with an atlatl.

zh: 虽然这种活动可能强化个体之间的社会联系，但性接触权的竞争也有破坏性，因此，任何社会都有控制性接触的规则。
en: Although such activity may reinforce social bonds between men and women, competition for sexual access also can be disruptive, so every society has rules that govern such access.

zh: 乱伦禁忌几乎是普遍的，它禁止父母与其子女之间的性关系，通常也禁止同胞兄弟姐妹之间的性关系。长期以来，人类学家一直对乱伦禁忌有兴趣，但是还没有提出对禁忌的真正令人信服的解释。
en: The near universality of the incest taboo, which forbids sexual relations between parents and their children, and usually between siblings, long has interested anthropologists, but a truly convincing explanation of the taboo has yet to be advanced.

zh: 与乱伦有关的是内婚制和外婚制的习俗。
en: Related to incest are the practices of endogamy and exogamy.

zh: 内婚制是在一群人内部结婚；外婚制是在群体外结婚。
en: Endogamy is marriage within a group of individuals; exogamy is marriage outside the group.

zh: 如果群体限于直系家庭，那么几乎所有社会都禁止内婚制而实行外婚制。
en: If the group is limited to the immediate family, almost all societies can be said to prohibit endogamy and practice exogamy.

zh: 尽管有所差异，在实证主义和阐释模型之间还是有很多相同之处。
en: Despite their differences, the positivist and interpretive models have much in common.

zh: 两者都是经验主义地运作——观察世界上发生的事情——而不是仅仅通过内省。
en: Both work empirically – observing events in the world – rather than solely through introspection.

zh: 两者都是系统化地进行推断，而不是限制自己对文艺或诗艺的召唤。
en: Both systematize and generalize rather than confine themselves to literary or poetic evocation.

zh: 两者都包括主观性和客观性，毕竟是分析员在做分析；那里不存在独立于分析员的数据。
en: Both entail subjectivity as well as objectivity because, after all, it is the analyst who does analysis; there exists no body of data independent of the analyst.

zh: 最后，两者都是缜密的和精确的。
en: Finally, both can be meticulous and precise.

zh: 的确，对许多人来说，这好象根本没有作出说明，在较早的年代里，依据恒星与行星自身而不是神灵的意志和怪想来解释这些星球的运动，似乎是空洞无物的。
en: To many, no doubt, this will seem like no explanation at all.In an earlier day it may have seemed empty to explain the behavior of stars and planets in terms of stars and planets instead of the will and whim of spiritual beings.

zh: 但是在今天的物理学和生物学中，用非泛灵论与非拟人论术语来说明事件，巳经完全确立起来。
en: But the explanation of events in non-animistic and non-anthropomorphic terms is now well established in the physical and biological sciences.

zh: 唯独在社会科学中，仍然保存了不少拟人论的痕迹。
en: We still retain more than a vestige of anthropomorphism in the social sciences.

zh: 在一些社会中，年龄等级又分为年龄组（Uge sets)(有时被称为年龄级）。
en: In some societies, age grades are subdivided into age sets.

zh: 一个年龄组是一群加入同一个年龄等级，并一起经历该等级的人。
en: An age set is a group of persons initiated into an age grade who move through the system together.

zh: 例如，在东非的蒂里基人中，由在15年期间被归入一个年龄组而加入一个年龄等级的那些人构成年龄群体年龄组与年龄等级不同，它不会在经过一定的年数之后就停止存在：一个年龄组的成员通常在他们的一生尚中彼此都保持密切的联系，或者至少在其一生大部分时间如此。
en: For example, among the Tiriki of East Africa, the age group consisting of those initiated into an age grade for a 15-year period amounts to an age set.Age sets, unlike age grades, do not cease to exist after a specified number of years; the members of an age set usually remain closely associated throughout their lives, or at least through much of their lives.

zh: 答案看来存在于农业革命所确立的社会经济系统与技术系统的关系之中。
en: The answer seems to lie in the relationship between socio- economic system and technological system established by the Agricultural Revolution.

zh: 如我们已指出的，每一社会系统皆依赖和取决于技术系统。
en: As we have noted, every social system rests upon and is determined by a technological system.

zh: 但每一技术系统都在社会系统发挥功能，因此又受社会系统的制约。
en: But every technological system functions within a social system and is therefore conditioned by it.

zh: 为农业革命所创立的社会系统作用于技术过程，以便最终“容纳它”，并且实际上进而使整个文化进步陷于迟滞。这就是农业技术如何陷于迟滞的情状。
en: The social system created by the Agricultural Revolution affected the technological process so as eventually to "contain it" and to bring further progress in culture as a whole virtually to a standstill.This is how it was done.

zh: 奴隶制下的性堕落将被忘记，婚姻受到鼓励，家庭生活受到赞美。
en: The sexual depravities of slavery would be forgotten, marriages encouraged,family life celebrated.

zh: 整齐而粉饰一新的村舍将变成幸福和孝行的场所。
男人就像男人一样行为，独立、承认劳动神圣、管教妻子待在家里和照顾孩子。
真正的自由建立在对房屋的所有权上，它可以阻止贪婪的种植园主榨取额外的租金或非人地对待佃户。
问题：错译改1：奴隶制下的性堕落将被忘记，婚姻受到鼓励，家庭生活受到赞美。
整齐而粉饰一新的村舍将变成幸福和孝行的场所。
en: Neat white-washed cottages would become places of happiness and nurseries of piety.

zh: 人们敦促男人像男人一样做事，独立、承认劳动神圣、命令妻子待在家里和照顾孩子。
en: Men were urged to act as men, to be independent, to recognise the dignity of labour, to command their wives to stay at home and look after the children.

zh: 真正的自由建立在对房屋的所有权上，它可以阻止贪婪的种植园主榨取额外的租金或非人地对待佃户。
en: Real freedom depended on the ownership of houses, which prevented prying planters from charging exorbitant rents or treating tenants in unmanly ways.

zh: 其中，因为田野调查，而且因为对于非欧洲社会的定位，人类学贡献了重要的洞见，比如，它认为“现代性”和“传统”并不是相互排斥的，而这与马克斯·韦伯和其他早期现代性理论家所持的观点正相反。
en: Because of fieldwork, and because of its orientation towards non-European societies, anthropology has contributed important insights to the effect that "modernity" and "tradition" are not mutually exclusive, contrary to what Max Weber and other early theorists of modernity held.

zh: 现代政治、为工资工作和现代化政府可以很好地与祖先崇拜和家系组织并存，尽管在如此复杂的社会中，一定会有各种紧张和矛盾存在。
en: Modern politics, wagework and a modern state may well exist side by side with ancestral cults and lineage organisation, although there are bound to be tensions and contradictions within such complex societies.

zh: 它还说明了，生活在“现代”社会中的人可以保留重要的“传统”特征，例如，裙带关系和道德排他主义、社区层面上的社会内聚力和从处女生子到巫术等各种宗教信仰。
en: It has also been shown that people who live in "modern" societies can retain important "traditional" characteristics, such as, for example, nepotism and moral particularism, social cohesion at the community level and a wide range of religious beliefs ranging from virgin birth to sorcery.

zh: 与此同时，毫无疑问的是，现代化带来了无可挽回的社会和文化变化。
en: At the same time, there is no doubt that modernisation entails irreversible social and cultural change.

zh: 就如在特罗布里恩德岛民中那样，在许多人类社会中的婚姻都是由某种类型的经济交换肯定下来的。
en: As among the Trobriand Islanders, marriages in many human societies are formalized by some sort of economic exchange.

zh: 在特罗布里恩德人中，就如前面所述，它采取了礼物交换的形式。
en: Among the Trobrianders, this takes the form of a gift exchange, as just described.

zh: 更常见的是聘礼，有时也叫彩礼。

en: Far more common is bride-price, sometimes called bride wealth.

zh: 此外，还有失业者、罪犯、流浪者等组成的流氓无产阶级，同时，还存在一个贵族阶级，其成员依靠财产的利息生活。
en: In addition, there are lumpenproletariats of unemployed, criminals, vagrants, etc., as well as an aristocracy whose members live off the interest from property.

zh: 毫无疑问，即使是在那些强调平等的社会里，人们之间也存在着系统的等级差异。
en: There are doubtless great systematic rank differences between people even in societies where equality is emphasised.

zh: 实际上，阶级差异倾向于被一代一代地复制下去，所以孩子们会继承其父母的阶级身份，尽管一直都存在着一定的社会流动性。
en: In practice, class differences tend to be reproduced over the generations, so that children take on their parents' class membership, although there is always a certain social mobility.

zh: 不论这些差异是否必然地与拥有生产手段相联系，从系统的视角和以行动者为中心的视角来说，它们都是极其重要的。
en: Whether or not such differences are necessarily connected with ownership of means of production, they are very important from a systemic as well as an actor-centred perspective.

zh: 但是，应该注意到，大部分社会科学家所支持的一种有关不平等的思考方式都与马克思主义相反，他们不把经济财产作为优先的解释变量。
en: It should nevertheless be noted that the majority of social scientists support a way of thinking about inequality which, contrary to Marxism, does not give priority to economic property as an explanatory variable.

zh: 斯科特拉普人居住在芬兰北部地区，传统上靠打渔和饲养驯鹿为生。
en: The Skolt Lapps, whose homeland is in northern Finland, traditionally supported themselves by fishing and herding reindeer.

zh: 尽管他们在某些物质产品上要依靠外部世界，但当地拥有对他们的系统至关重要的资源，所有的人实际上都可利用这些资源。
en: Although they depended on the outside world for certain material goods, the resources crucial for their system were found locally and were for all practical purposes available to all.

zh: 关键性的资源每个人都可以得到，在人与人之间几乎不存在社会和经济分化。
en: No one was denied access to critical resources, and little social and economic differentiation existed among the people.

zh: 他们的社会基本上是平等社会。
en: Theirs was basically an egalitarian society.

zh: 放牧驯鹿对于斯科特拉普人是特别重要的。
en: Of particular importance to the Skolt Lapps was reindeer herding.

zh: 的确，鹿群管理対于他们把自己定义为一个民族是至关重要的。
en: Indeed, herd management is central to their definition of themselves as a people.

zh: 在历史上，妇女很少担任重要的政治领导职位，而当她们担任的时候，有时因为缺少合格男子承担这一职位。
en: Historically women rarely have held important positions of political leadership, and when they have, it sometimes has been for lack of a qualified man to hold the position.

zh: 然而，在一些社会中，妇女一直以来都与男子享有政治上的平等，例如，在纽约州的易洛魁部落就是这样。
en: Nonetheless, in a number of societies, women have enjoyed political equality with men, as among the Iroquoian tribes of New York State.

zh: 在他们那里，妇女很乐意让男子拥有职权，因为她们不仅有权任命他们，而且也有权把他们撤掉。
en: In these tribes, all men held office at the pleasure of women, who not only appointed them but could remove them as well.

zh: 在尼日利 亚中西部的伊格博人中，妇女和男子各拥有一个行政等级制度，这两个制度相互平行和制衡。
en: Among the Igbo of midwestern Nigeria, women held positions in an administrative hierarchy that paralleled and balanced that of the men.

zh: 在集权化的政治制度下，妇女最易于从属于男子，当国象把控制强加在男女平等的社会之上的时候，这种性别关系就会发生改变，即男人统治女人。
en: Under centralized political systems, women are most apt to be subordinate to men, and when states impose their control on societies marked by sexual egalitarianism, the relationship changes so that men dominate women.

zh: 在群体内发生的交换一般采取泛化互惠或平衡互惠的形式。
en: Exchanges that occur within a group of people generally take the form of generalized or balanced reciprocity.

zh: 当交换在两个群体之间进行时，就可能有敌对和竞争的倾向。因此，这类交换可能采取消极互惠的形式，除非人们做好某种安排，确保交换大致接近于平衡。
en: When they occur between two groups, at least a potential for hostility and competition is apt to exist.Therefore, such exchanges may well take the form of negative reciprocity, unless some sort of arrangement has been made to ensure at least an approach to balance.

zh: 物物交换是消极互惠的一种形式，通过这种交换，一个群体的稀缺物品与另一个群体的合意物品相交换。
en: Barter is one form of negative reciprocity, involving the exchange of scarce items from one group for desirable goods from another group.

zh: 交换时要计算相对价值，尽管双方外表上满不在乎，与一个群体内部交换更加平衡的性质相比，精明的交换更是惯例。
en: Relative value is calculated, and despite an outward show of indifference, sharp trading is more the rule, when compared to the more balanced nature of exchanges within a group.

zh: 由于通过民族志学方法可以获取丰富的知识，它有时被誉为是一个发现意义和洞见的极好方式。
en: Owing to the richness of learning acquired through the ethnographic method, it is sometimes touted as an excellent way to discover meanings and gain insights.

zh: 不过作为一种核实（或反驳）理论的方式它也受到质疑，因为它所抽样的仅是一个大群体中的一小部分。
en: It is also doubted as a way of verifying (or refuting) theories, because it samples only a small segment of a population.

zh: 一燕不成夏，对一个小群体的详细分析不会证明一个普遍原则。
en: A swallow does not make a summer, and detailed analysis of a small group does not prove a universal principle.

zh: 不过，一个详细的研究可以强有力地质疑普遍原则的宣称，并有可能创造性地提出洞见，丰富这一理论。
en: A detailed study can, however, forcefully call into question claims of universal theory and can creatively suggest insights to enrich such theory.

zh: 有不少学者时常认为，19世纪早期是人类学史上相对沉闷的年代。
en: It is often said that the early nineteenth century was an era of little interest to historians of anthropology.

zh: 那些视18世纪启蒙运动为我们时代的科学之晨曦的人们将19世纪早期看作是一种倒退。
en: Those who might point to the eighteenth-century Enlightenment as the dawn of our science regard the early nineteenth century as a step backwards.

zh: 那些认为学科始于19世纪晚期的人们则认为19世纪前半期是人类学基本原则尚未被广泛接受的时期。
en: Those who would begin in the late nineteenth century regard the earlier part of that century as an age before anthropology’s basic principles came to be accepted.

zh: 毫不意外，作为一名女性主义者，斯特拉森批判了与上述故事相一致的人类学的社会性概念，其中社会被隐喻性地划分为男性的领域。
en: It is hardly surprising that Strathern, as feminist, critiques anthropological perceptions of sociality when they coincide with the above story of society.In it society is seen as a domain that is metaphorically categorized as male.

zh: 社会被看作是可调节范围更大的社会性；它等同于男人的公共领域，聚集起全体男人为社会负责。
en: Society is understood as a wider regulating sociality; it is equated with the public domain of men, who form together a collectivity of men responsible for society.

zh: 这与女人的个性化的、家庭的行为形成了鲜明的对比，后者被看作男人的、乃至整个社会的“难题”，它们威胁和冲击了全体男性之间的团结（cf.
en: This is to be contrasted to women’s individuating, domestic activities which are viewed as ‘the problem’ for men, and thus for society at large, in that they threaten and impinge upon the solidarity of the collectivity of males (cf.

zh: Pateman （1989: 641））,此人评述说，卢梭式的社会契约只是针对男人的，女人不但被排除在外，而且被看作是对运行良好的社会的持续威胁）。
en: Pateman (1989:641) who observes that the Rousseau-esque social contract is for men only, with women being seen not just as excluded from it but a continual danger to society’s orderly running).

zh: 这意味着破坏人们的身份认同，即对他们是谁以及他们如何看待自己加以破坏。
en: This means destroying people's identities, who they are and how they perceive themselves.

zh: 强奸在这样一个战略中是一个潜在的武器。
en: Rape can be a potent weapon in such a strategy.17

zh: 瑞纳塔·萨利科（Renata Salecl）将这一论点推进一步，指出战争的目的是破坏整个民族幻想的结构。民族神话的形成与某些作为民族存在象征的神圣的领土有关。
en: Renata Salecl pushes this argument further and suggests that the aim of war is to destroy the fantasy structure of a whole population.National myths are constructed about certain territories which become sacred, symbolic of the nation's existence.

zh: 对民族幻想的破坏通过对身体的真实伤害来实现。
en: The destruction of the fantasy of the nation occurs through inflicting real injuries on bodies.

zh: 由于亲类的结构是双边的，所以除同胞兄弟姐妹之外，一个亲类对任意两个人来说，从来不会是相同的。
en: Because of its bilateral structure, a kindred is never the same for any two persons except siblings (brothers and sisters).

zh: 因此，没有哪两个人（除同胞兄弟姐妹之外）属于同一个亲类。
en: Thus, no two people (except siblings) belong to the same kindred.

zh: 例如，“自我”的父亲这一方的第一代堂表兄弟姐妹的亲类，不仅包括父亲的姐妹（或兄弟），就像“自我”的亲类也包括她们（他们）一样，还包括父亲姐妹（或兄弟）的配偶，以及与这些配偶有血缘关系的亲戚。
en: The kindred of ego's first cousin on the father's side, for example, includes not only the father's sister (or brother)，as does ego's, but the father's sister's (or brother's) spouse, as well as consanguineai relatives of the latter.

zh: 至于“自我”父母的亲类，它们从直系向上可以延伸到祖父母外祖父母，向旁系可以延伸到远得连“自我”都不认识的堂表兄弟姐妹。同样，“自我”的叔伯舅姑姨们的亲类也是如此。
en: As for the kindreds of ego's parents, these range from grandparents lineally to cousins too distant laterally for ego to know, and the same is true of ego's aunts and uncles.

zh: 是什么方面使得亲属制度如此重要？
en: What is it about kinship that makes it so important?

zh: 简单的回答是，正是在许多社会中，亲属制度是单个的最重要的社会制度。
en: The simple answer is that in very many societies kinship is the single most important social institution.

zh: 在许多例子中，家族照顾了人的生计、职业、婚姻、防护和社会身份。
en: The kin group, in many cases, takes care of one's livelihood, one's career, one's marriage, one's protection and one's social identity.

zh: 第四章首次探讨亲属制度重要性，并且简要指出了在亲属制度系统和社会组织的其他方面之间有一种密切的相互关系。
en: Chapter 4 offered a first glimpse of the importance of kinship, and indicated that there is a close interrelationship between the kinship system and other aspects of social organisation.

zh: 在某些例子中，人类学家对亲属制度系统的描绘可能实际上和社会组织并存，因为社会的成员及其大部分活动，可能首要地是根据亲属制度原则而被组织起来的。
en: In some cases, what anthropologists delineate as the kinship system may indeed be coexistent with social organisation, since the members of society, and most of their activities, may first and foremost be organised along kinship principles.

zh: 失范是一种真实的威胁，因为候选人是第一次能够从外部去观察他们自己和社会，并且也许会对此进行批评的反思。
en: Anomie is a real threat, as the candidates are for the first time able to see themselves and society from the outside, and perhaps reflect critically on it.

zh: 或许，如今现代社会中具有代表性的被拉长的青春期，可以被理解为一个漫长的过渡仪式。
en: Perhaps, indeed, the extended adolescence typical of contemporary modern societies may fruitfully be seen as a very long rite of passage.

zh: 迄今为止，社会人的发展一直被描述为一种个人和社会之间的互动。
en: So far, the development of the social person has been described as an interplay between individual and society.

zh: 我们现在更深入了一步，转向了大众的社会组织，着眼于谁和什么人一起做什么事，以及社会是如何随着时间维持（和变化）的。
en: We now move a step further and turn towards the social organisation of communities, looking at who does what with whom, and how societies are maintained (and change) through time.

zh: 酋邦(chiedoms)是两个或多个地方群体在单个统治者——酋长——之下借以组织起来的区域政治机构，酋长在人们的等级体系中列首位。
en: A chiefdom is a regional polity in which two or more local groups are organized under a single ruling individual—the chief—who is at the head of a ranked hierarchy of people.

zh: 一个个体与酋长关系的亲密程度决定他或她在这种政治机构中的地位。
en: An individuaPs status in such a polity is determined by his or her closeness of relationship to the chief.

zh: 那些与酋长最亲密的人在官方地位等级中居高位，而且那些处于较低等级者对他们毕恭毕敬。
en: Those closest are officially superior and receive deferential treatment from those in lower ranks.

zh: 酋长的职务通常是终生的，而且往往是世袭的，由一个男子传给他自己的儿子或者他姐妹的儿子，这取决于继嗣是根据父系的还是根据母系而定。
en: The office of the chief is usually hereditary, passing from a man to his own or his sister's son, depending on whether descent is reckoned patrilineally or matrilineally.

zh: 与队群和部里的头人不同，酋长一般是真正的掌权者，在任何时候，在任何事务上，他的权威能够把他的人民团结起来。
en: Unlike the headmen in bands and lineages, the chief is generally a true authority figure, and his authority serves to unite his people in all affairs and at all times.

zh: 德里达认为把全部文本作为分析单位是荒谬的（例如 Derrida 1976[1967];1978[1967]), 在这一点上他的思想与结构主义产生分歧。
en: Derrida (e.g., 1976 [1967]; 1978 [1967]) broke with structuralism in an attempt to expose what he saw as the fallacy of any analysis which accepts the totality of a text as a unit of analysis.

zh: 他声称任何文本都离不开矛盾。
en: Any text, he argues, will entail contradictions.

zh: 索绪尔的“差异”（后索绪尔结构主义者用来说明有区分的特征或二元对抗）观念被转化成一个复杂的概念，其中既有“差异”（来自法语的différence，即“差异”) ，又有“服从”（来自法语的différance [sic]，是德里达为这一现象杜撰的新词）的意思。
en: The Saussurian notion of ‘difference’ (referred to by post-Saussurian structuralists in terms of distinctive features or binary oppositions) is transformed into a complex concept where meaning is both ‘different’ (through différence, ‘difference’) and ‘deferred’ (through différance [sic], Derrida’s neologism for this phenomenon).

zh: 下面一点很快就变得明显：没有一个“完整的”第一时间知识大全，没有人——最不可能的是来访的民族志学者——能够了解这一知识，除非通过一系列偶然的、饱含权力关系、结局开放的遭遇。
en: It soon becomes apparent that there is no "complete" corpus of First-Time knowledge, that no one—least of all the visiting ethnographer — can know this lore except through an open-ended series of contingent, power-laden encounters.

zh: “人们公认不同的萨拉马卡历史学家有不同版本的历史，而听者为自己拼凑起关于某一事件的他暂时愿意接受的版本”（Price 1983:28)。
en: "It is accepted that different Saramaka historians will have different versions, and it is up to the listener to piece together for himself the version of an event that he, for the time being, accepts" (28).

zh: 尽管普赖斯，一个小心谨慎的田野工作者和历史学家，带着写作的武器，聚拢了一个其内容超过任何个人所知或所说的文本，这一文本“仍然只代表了萨拉马卡人集体保存的关于第一时间知识的冰山一角”(Price 1983：25）。
en: Though Price, the scrupulous fieldworker and historian, armed with writing, has gathered a text that surpasses in extent what individuals know or tell, it still "represents only the tip of the iceberg that Saramakas collectively preserve about First-Time" (25).
If the world is conceived of as having certain classes of being, then this is because society has such classes (houses, lineages, status groups, say).

zh: 如果社会按照空间和时间划分，那是因为社会存在这些划分（例如住所、年度节庆、同龄人）。
en: If the world is conceived of in terms of divisions of space and time, then this is because society has such divisions (between habitations, between annual festivities, between agegrades).

zh: 如果社会针对一定的关系和一定的力量划分成某些部分，那也是因为社会中固有这些关系和力量（例如等级、因果、权力和权威）。
en: And if the world is conceived of as party or prey to certain relations and certain forces, then this is because society is home to relations and forces too (hierarchy, cause-and-effect, power and authority).

zh: 对于涂尔干和莫斯来说，社会就是逻辑分类的一个基本典范，并且这一分类体系（例如科学）正逐渐从社会现实、社会功能和社会需要中分离出来。
en: For Durkheim and Mauss, in sum, society was the elemental model for logical classification, and only gradually did such schemata come to dissociate themselves (for example, science) from social realities, social functions and social needs.

zh: 他提出相对论的问题是是否只有一个世界，但普遍性行为的问题在哲学上是不同的。
en: Essentially, he says that the problem of relativism is whether there is only one world, whereas the problem of universals is philosophically different.

zh: 而且，对普遍性行为的研究本身也不是一种普遍的行为，而是具有文化特殊性的（例如，不是所有民族都进行这种研究，但是这本书的读者也许在进行这种研究）。
en: Moreover, the search for universals is itself not a universal but is culturally specific (it is found not among all peoples, but, for example, among the sort of people who might read this book).

zh: 但是这一研究可以影响所有的人，而且这种影响（今天的理论家称之为“全球化”）已经在发挥作用。
en: Yet such a search is accessible to all human beings, and its diffusion (present-day theorists would say ‘globalization’) is taking place.

zh: 其中，因为田野调查，而且因为对于非欧洲社会的定位，人类学贡献了重要的洞见，比如，它认为“现代性”和“传统”并不是相互排斥的，而这与马克斯·韦伯和其他早期现代性理论家所持的观点正相反。
en: Because of fieldwork, and because of its orientation towards non-European societies, anthropology has contributed important insights to the effect that "modernity" and "tradition" are not mutually exclusive, contrary to what Max Weber and other early theorists of modernity held.

zh: 现代政治、为工资工作和现代化政府可以很好地与祖先崇拜和家系组织并存，尽管在如此复杂的社会中，一定会有各种紧张和矛盾存在。
en: Modern politics, wagework and a modern state may well exist side by side with ancestral cults and lineage organisation, although there are bound to be tensions and contradictions within such complex societies.

zh: 它还说明了，生活在“现代”社会中的人可以保留重要的“传统”特征，例如，裙带关系和道德排他主义、社区层面上的社会内聚力和从处女生子到巫术等各种宗教信仰。
en: It has also been shown that people who live in "modern" societies can retain important "traditional" characteristics, such as, for example, nepotism and moral particularism, social cohesion at the community level and a wide range of religious beliefs ranging from virgin birth to sorcery.

zh: 与此同时，毫无疑问的是，现代化带来了无可挽回的社会和文化变化。
en: At the same time, there is no doubt that modernisation entails irreversible social and cultural change.

zh: 她是低格栅值，因为她的群体是平等的、民主的。
en: She is in a low-grid situation because her group is egalitarian and democratic.

zh: 与艾丽斯不同，她还是高群值，是一个受团体多种限制的人。
en: Unlike Alice, she is also in a high-group situation, one full of group-oriented constraints.

zh: 艾丽斯属于许多社团。
en: Alice belongs to lots of different societies.

zh: 德博拉只属于她的团队性很强的系。
en: Deborah only belongs to her strongly group-oriented department.

zh: 像卡洛斯一样，她花许多时间参与系里的活动，无论这个群体（她的系）想做什么，其中的每个人都会去做。
en: Like Carlos, she spends lots of time in departmental activities, and whatever the group (her department) all want to do, everyone does.

zh: 典型人格概念尽管有许多可取之处，但是它作为研究群体人格的一种手段仍然显出一些困难。
en: While having much to recommend it, the concept of modal personality as a means of dealing with group personality nevertheless presents certain difficulties.

zh: 其中一个困难是测量技术的复杂性，它难于在田野里实施。
en: One of these is the complexity of the measurement techniques, which may be difficult to implement in the field.

zh: 因为，其一，必须有关于主题的适当的代表性样本。
en: For one, an adequate representative sample of subjects is necessary.

zh: 这一问题在这里有两重性：要确保样本有真正的代表性，以及要有必要时间和人员来实施测验、进行访谈等等，所有这些都可能是漫长的过程。
en: The problem here is twofold: making sure the sample is genuinely representative and having the time and personnel necessary to administer the tests, conduct interviews, and so on, all of which can be lengthy proceedings.

zh: 而且测验本身也构成了问题，因为在一种文化背景中设计出来的测验可能不适合于另一种文化背景。
en: Also, the tests themselves constitute a problem, for those devised for one cultural setting may not be appropriate for another.

zh: 如果角色分析所提供的工具是普遍适用的——放之四海而皆准——它们也仅只是提供了一个起始点，如果目标是理解各种社会和文化系统的差异和雷同的话。
en: If the tools provided by role analysis are universally applicable – can be useful in the study of any society – they provide a mere starting-point if the goal is an understanding of differences as well as similarities between social and cultural systems.

zh: 人类学家常常认为某些民族的人缺少私人角色（或我们也可以说，个人身份）的观念。
en: It has often been argued by anthropologists that some peoples lack a concept of the private persona (or, as we might put it, of personal identity).

zh: 可以肯定地说，人格的公共方面和私人方面在不同的社会里有很大的差异。
en: At the very least, it is certain that the relationship between private and public aspects of personhood varies greatly between societies.

zh: 即使在文化相对同质的各个西欧和北美的社会，都有着重要的不同，许多欧洲人被北美人对陌生人谈及他们的私生活时的轻松自如所震惊。
en: Even in the comparatively culturally homogeneous Western European and North American societies, there are important variations.Many Europeans are shocked at the ease with which North Americans may speak about their private lives to strangers.

zh: 如果我们更深入地探究，会发现差异更加深刻。
en: If we move further afield, the differences become more profound.

zh: 在理解现在所称的“全球化”这一进程中，什么是人类学潜在的或可能的角色？
en: What is anthropology's potential role in understanding the processes now called "globalization"?

zh: 在19世纪晚期及20世纪早期，极少有其他学科关注第一世界之外的人类生活。
en: In the late nineteenth and early twentieth century, very few other disciplines were concerned with human life outside of the first world.

zh: 尽管在这一时期殖民主义是一个进取的或者也可说是富有攻击性的政治与经济力量，但对殖民地人们的学术研究则主要落到一个学科身上，即人类学。
en: Although colonialism was an aggressive political and economic force during this period, academic study of the people in the colonies fell primarily to one discipline, anthropology.

zh: 现在，当其他学术领域发现了一个相互连接的地球这一思想来进行研究并从中获益时，人类学对非西方文化研究的独一无二的所有权也就受到了挑战。
en: Now, when other academic fieldsfindthe idea of an interconnected globe to hold promise for study and profit, anthropology's unique claim on the study of non-Western cultures is challenged.

zh: 人类学作为一个整体（即包括生物人类学也包括文化人类学）保持着对两个相当不同的问题的长期关注：人性的理解和文化多样性的研究。
en: Anthropology as a whole (including biological as well as cultural anthropology) retains a long-standing concern with two quite different problems: the understanding of human nature and the study of cultural diversity.

zh: 在18 世纪的启蒙运动中，人性的理解是主要的兴趣。
en: In the eighteenth-century Enlightenment the former was the main interest.

zh: 19 世纪，随着人类学特有的发展，文化多样性在多元起源论者手中变得凸现起来。
en: With the development of anthropology proper, in the nineteenth century, cultural diversity became prominent in the hands of the polygenists.

zh: 这样的“现实主义”简直就是可悲的。
en: "Realism" of this sort is simply pathetic.

zh: 事实上这根本不是现实主义，而是人类中心主义，除了依据作为原始动力的人以外，就无力解释一系列事件。
en: As a matter of fact, it is not realism at all but anthropocentrism, an inability to interpret a chain of events except in terms of man as the prime mover.

zh: 当然，只有人才能修饰自己的仪表，当然，文化也并不是随心所欲和飘泊不定的游魂，当然，只有人才紧钟表的发条、制造汽车和建筑摩天大楼，等等。
en: Of course it is people who enamel their fingernails; of course culture is not a disembodied soul going its way of its own sweet will; to he sure, it is people who wind clocks, manufacture automobiles, build skyscrapers.

zh: 在同时期的美国，田野民族志和认知人类学的研究是通过人类普遍行为模式、语言模式和文化特有的语义结构的研究而发展起来的。它完全可以与其他国家的“ 结构主义” 相媲美。
en: Meanwhile in the United States, studies in ethnoscience and cognitive anthropology developed through interests in human universals, linguistic models, and culture-specific semantic structures which parallel ‘structuralism’ proper in other countries.

zh: 列维－斯特劳斯自己曾经常赞美我们大家都普遍认为是游离在结构主义传统之外的美国学者，因为这些美国学者为他的理论做出了贡献。
en: Le ́vi- Strauss himself has frequently praised Americans outside the structuralist tradition as we usually think of it, for their contributions towards his own theories.

zh: 在她们重新融入社会之前，桑德联盟中有经验的妇女会教她们作为未来子女的抚养者如何履行道德责任和实际职责，一旦培训结束，这些行过成年礼的女孩也会成为桑德联盟的一分子。
en: Until their incorporation back into society, they are trained in the moral and practical responsibilities of potential childbearers by experienced women in the Sande association, an organization the initiates will belong to once their training has ended.

zh: 不过，这一培训也不完全严酷无情，因为有唱歌、跳舞和讲故事相伴。而且这些行成年礼的女孩吃得也很好。
en: This training is not all harsh, however, for it is accompanied by a good deal of singing, dancing, and storytelling, and the initiates are very well fed.

zh: 这样,她们会对身为女人形成一种积极的看法，强烈地感受到姐妹情谊。
en: Thus, they acquire both a positive image of womanhood and a strong sense of sisterhood.

zh: 一旦培训结束，她们就会用树叶泡水制成的药物进行一次仪式性的洗涤，去掉在幽闭期间庇护她们的巫术防护。
en: Once their training is complete, a medicine made by brewing leaves in water is used for a ritual washing, removing the magical protection that has shielded them during the period of their confinement.

zh: 同时，我们必须承认，一定程度的和谐在任何合适地发挥功能的文化中都是必要的，我们不应该假定完全的和谐是必须的。
en: While we must recognize that a degree of harmony is necessary in any properly functioning culture, we should not assume complete harmony is required.

zh: 因为没有两个个体以恰好同样的方式经历濡化的过程，没有两个个体以正好同样的方式感知他们的文化，因而在任何文化中总存在某种变化的潜力。所以我们倒是应该说说文化的黏合应力。
en: Because no two individuals experience the enculturation process in precisely the same way, no two individuals perceive their culture in exactly the same way, so always some potential for change exists in any culture.We should speak, instead, of a strain to consistency in culture.

zh: 只要各个部分是合理地黏合的，那么文化就会充分合理地运行。
en: So long as the parts are reasonably consistent, a culture will operate reasonably well.

zh: 然而，如果黏合应力失效，那么文化危机的情境就会接踵而至。
en: If, however, that strain to consistency breaks down, a situation of cultural crisis ensues.

zh: 比如，苏丹的定居的福尔人（Fur）和游牧的巴格拉人（Baggara）之间的关系，有一种经济上的互补。
en: In the relationship between the sedentary Fur and the nomadic Baggara in the Sudan, for example, there is an economic complementarity.

zh: 他们在商品交换上是相互依靠的，并且在生态领域上互补。
en: They are mutually dependent on commodity exchange and occupy complementary ecological niches.

zh: 如同贡纳·哈兰德（Gunnar Haaland 1969）曾经说过的，通过交换生活方式，福尔人可以变成巴格拉人，如同利奇（Leach 1954）曾表明的，克钦人也可以变成掸人（Shan）；但是在这个过程中，区分不同群体的种族边界仍然保持不变。
en: As Gunnar Haaland (1969) has shown, Fur may become Baggara by changing their way of life, just as Leach (1954) showed that Kachin could become Shan; but the ethnic boundary separating the groups remains untouched in the process.

zh: 由于涂尔干对社会秩序的认识受到19世纪自然科学动态平衡和强调能量守恒的观点的支持，同时受到认可的还有人类社会生活中矛盾的普遍性，以及后爱因斯坦时代所强调的熵和秩序的基点，它与感觉和感知的一致性（Bateson 1951：246ff.）。
en: Inasmuch as Durkheimian notions of social order were in sympathy with nineteenth-century natural-scientific notions of homeostasis and an emphasis on the conservation of energy, an appreciation of the ubiquity of contradictoriness in human social life coincides with a post-Einsteinian emphasis on the contingency of order, its pertaining to perception and perspective, and on entropy (cf. Bateson 1951:246ff.).

zh: 目前另一种更具反思性的人类学观点涉及人类建构的秩序的含义及随之而来的不确定性；这些建构出来的秩序是特定的多样的，且会变化。
en: There is now a far more reflexive anthropological appreciation of the implicatedness of human beings in the order they construe and the uncertainty this gives onto; constructions are situated and diverse, and constructions change.

zh: 即使人会为他们自己和他们的世界寻求意义和秩序，他们的生活依然是无法预测的，和其他人一样，甚至是一样的杂乱（Abrahams 1990；Prigogine 1989）。
en: Even as human beings seek meaning and order in themselves and their world, their lives remain unpredictable—to themselves as to others—even chaotically so (cf. Abrahams 1990; Prigogine 1989).

zh: 这不仅仅是一个空间运动问题而且也是个时间问题：第一代移民和他那不说乌尔都语的孙辈对于“穆斯林印度人”身份的定义是截然不同的。
en: This is not only a question of spatial movement but also of time: what defines the "Muslim Indian" identity is rather different for a firstgeneration immigrant and for his grandson who does not speak Urdu.

zh: 我们在此面对的是过渡身份。

en: We are confronted here with transitional identities.

zh: 这并不一定意味着，我们在朝着完全融入“主导性”群体前进，而意味着我们不能将定义相对明确的“少数者群体”概念作为我们分析的基础。
en: This does not necessarily imply that we are heading towards full integration into the "dominant" group, but that we cannot base our analysis on relatively well defined "minority groups".

zh: 巴恩斯建议叫做社会关系网络的正是这种关系系统。
en: It is this kind of system of relations that Barnes proposed calling social networks.

zh: 这里应该注意到，关系网通常没有边界和清楚的内部组织，因为任何人都认为他或她自己是这个关系网的中心。巴恩斯进一步认为，小型社区和大范围社会之间最重要的区别之一是，前者的社会关系网比后者的社会关系网更加稠密。
en: Here it should be noted that networks often have no boundaries and no clear internal organisation, since any person may consider him- or herself the centre of the network.Barnes further holds that one of the most important differences between small communities and large-scale societies is the fact that the networks are more dense in the former than in the latter.

zh: 当大都市里的两个人第一次会面时，他们很难发现双方有一些共同的熟人；小型社会中则相反，“每个人”都以不同的方式相互认识——通过家族关系、普通朋友、邻居、共同的学校经历、职业生涯和/或婚姻关系。
en: When two people meet for the first time in a large-scale urban society, it is quite rare for them to discover that they have many common acquaintances; in small-scale societies, on the contrary, "everybody" knows each other in many different ways – through kinship, common friends and neighbours, shared school experiences, professional life and/or intermarriage.

zh: 人类学对分类的研究始于涂尔干一莫斯的论文，其中认为分类的源泉是社会群体，分类的目的是社会化群体成员并使之凝聚，分类的结果是将共同的集体生活世界对象化。
en: Anthropological work on classification began with the Durkheim—Mauss thesis which posited the sources of classification as being the social group, the purposes of classification as being the socialization and integration of group members, and the consequence of classification as being the objectification of a collective life-world which all share.

zh: 这里设想在社会群体、它的语言世界和语言的含义之间存在一一对应的关系：语言成为单一的连续的分类框架（Berger and Luckmann 1969: 66）。
en: Here was an imaging of a one-to-one relationship between a social group, its language-world, and that language's meanings: language as determinant of a single and consistent classificatory schema (cf. Berger and Luckmann 1969:66).

zh: 一直提倡的是更宽容的看待分类体系、语言、群体成员、世界观和行为之间的关系和各种潜在的可能性。
en: What has been argued for since is a freer appreciation of the relations and the potential among system of classification, language, group membership, world-view and behaviour.

zh: 从术语的字面意思看，他们的科学是他们的常识、他们的共同意思。
en: Their science is, in the literal meaning of the term, their commonsense, their common meaning.

zh: 从这个常识移到更广泛的公众“常识”，这再次涉及一个翻译行为。
en: To move from this common sense to the "common sense" of the wider public involves again an act of translation.

zh: 在社会人类学或者一般而言的社会学的情况，在这个层次上并不是非常不同的。
en: The situation of social anthropology, or sociology in general, is not at this level so very different.

zh: 区别在于这个事实，即社会学的现象被进行客观研究，只是在一定程度上才将它们的主现含义考虑进来，被研究的人们潜在地能够分享社会学家对他们的社会学意识。
en: The difference lies in the fact that sociological phenomena are objectively studied only to the extent that their subjective meaning is taken into account and that the people studied are potentially capable of sharing the sociological consciousness that the sociologist has of them.

zh: (Pocock 1961:88；着重号是我加的）
en: (1961:88—89; emphasis added)

zh: 大多数生物学家关心共同点。
en: Most biologists focus on the similarities.

zh: 在把人当做文化产物进行研究的时候，情况会更加复杂。
en: In the study of humans as cultural beings, the situation is more complicated.

zh: 当然，人类学家必然会考虑那些所有人都有的共同点，因为我们已达成共识，所有人都是文化生物以及都与社会习俗有所联系。
en: Certainly, anthropology necessarily deals with something all humans havein common, since we have already established that all humans are cultural creatures and relate to social conventions.

zh: 另一方面，许多人类学家也致力于解释个体差异和那些具有唯一性的独特社会。
en: On the other hand, many anthropologists have also been concerned with accounting for individual variations and with the uniqueness of particular societies.

zh: 社会学和社会心理学就是把握这类超个人决定因素的科学技术结构。
en: Sociology and social psychology were the organizations of scientific techniques to grapple with this class of meta-individual determinants.

zh: 在这些科学的组织结构中，人们曾假设决定人类行为的诸范畴现在已被穷尽了。
en: In the organization of these sciences it was assumed that the categories of determinants of human behavior had now been exhausted.

zh: 天文学和地球物理学将注重无机性决定因素，解剖学、生理学利心理学将围绕个人决定因素进行研究，而社会学即关于社会的科学将探讨超个人的决定因素。还有什么其它的决定因素需加以探讨吗？
en: Astronomy and terrestrial physics would take care of the inanimate determinants; anatomy, physiology, and psychology would encompass the individual determinants; and sociology, the science of society, would deal with the supraindividual determinants: what other determinants were there to be reckoned with?

zh: 民主国家是社会有机体，它的生活是由整合和管理机构调节的，这种机构在其正式领域里表现为国家，而在其非制度化或至少是法律以外的领域中则是“政治机器。
en: A democratic nation is a social organism.Its life is regulated by a mechanism of integration and control that is the State in its formal aspects and the "political machine" in its non-institutionalized or at least extra-legal aspect.

zh: ”这一机构协调该政体的各个部分与过程，并且建立与其它国家的各种关系。
en: This mechanism coordinates the various segments and processes of the body politic, and negotiates relations with other nations.

zh: 这样，国家生活就是由一个相对较小的部分来调控的。
en: The life of the nation is thus regulated and controlled by a relatively small segment.

zh: 选举也不过成为要选民们对那些并非由他们亲自提出，而且多半不知其姓名的候选人说声“是”或“不是”而已。
en: The electorate is permitted to say "yes" or "no" with reference to a number of candidates whom they have had no hand in choosing, and of whom, for the most part, they have never heard.

zh: 1989年社会主义的瓦解对戈德利埃在近年背离结构主义毫无影响，而且他完全清楚，马克思主义作为他所说的元理论已经死亡，虽然他仍然在某些与权力和屈服相关的特定马克思主义观点当中看到了潜能。
en: The collapse of socialism in 1989 has done nothing to encourage Godelier to retreat from structuralism in recent years, and he fully recognizes that Marxism as what he calls a meta-theory is dead, though he continues to see potential in particular Marxist insights relating to power and subjection.

zh: 相反，泰雷、梅阿索、雷伊等人看来始终更接近主流的马克思主义。
en: By contrast, Terray, Meillassoux, Rey, and so on have always seemed closer to mainstream Marxism.

zh: 不过，他们也同样感到，必须要对马克思主义的正统信条进行调整以适应为前资本主义社会找到某种充分的马克思主义式的解释这一要求。
en: They too, however, feel compelled to adjust Marxist orthodoxy to the demands of finding some sort of adequate Marxist interpretation for precapitalist societies.

zh: 印度尼西亚是湿的，而摩洛哥是干的。
en: Indonesia is wet, and Morocco is dry.

zh: 以这一对比作为出发点，格尔茨探讨了一个摩洛哥地区和一个印度尼西亚（巴厘岛的）地区的社会组织的不同之处。
en: With this contrast as a starting-point, Geertz discusses differences of social organisation in a Moroccan and an Indonesian (Balinese) locality.

zh: 首先，明显的一点是，两个社会中的农民必须种植不同的农作物。
en: First, it is obvious that farmers in the two societies must grow different crops.

zh: 格尔茨所研究的摩洛哥地区种植小麦和橄榄；巴厘岛用灌溉水田种水稻。
en: The Moroccans studied by Geertz cultivate wheat and olives; the Balinese grow rice in irrigated paddies.

zh: 在摩洛哥，水是一种稀缺而昂贵的资源，但在巴厘岛，水却是免费而丰富的。
en: Water is a scarce and costly resource in Morocco, while it is free and abundant in Bali.

zh: 第一个层次，”功能”表示一种制度对另一种制度的影响，就是说，是社会制度之间的关系。
en: At the first, ‘function’ denotes the effects of an institution on other institutions, that is, the relation between social institutions.

zh: 这个层次类似于拉德克利夫－布朗著作中所说的制度。
en: This level is similar to that in Radcliffe-Brown’s work.

zh: 第二个层次牵扯到以社区成员阐释的观点理解制度。
en: The second involves the understanding of an institution in terms defined by members of the community.

zh: 社会科学术语中的一些常见词语，如社会习俗（social convention）、互动（interaction）、社团（corporations）和部门（categories），都是高度抽象的比较概念。
en: Common words in social science jargon, such as social convention, interaction, corporations and categories are highly abstract comparative concepts.

zh: 在跨文化比较中，它们都是很有用的，但它们在本国（或本民族）词汇中只占很稀少的一部分。
en: They are useful in cross-cultural comparison, but they only very rarely form part of the native (or emic) vocabulary.

zh: 对于另一些被用来描述人类不同类型的社会关系的那些概念来说，这一点也是正确的。
en: This also holds true for an additional, useful group of concepts which have been developed to describe the various kinds of social relationships engaged in by humans.

zh: 首先，社会的所有成员都对其他成员具有一定的权利和义务，而很少有两个人会具有完全同样的权利和义务。
en: First, all members of society have certain rights and duties in relation to other members, and there are hardly two individuals who have exactly the same rights and duties.

zh: 在某种程度上，族群性和阶级是可以比较的，因为两种现象都与权力差异和在公共空间的竞争有关。
en: Ethnicity and class are to some extent comparable, since both phenomena are related to power discrepancies and competition in public space.

zh: 相反，跨越族群性和阶级的分割线的性别在一种简单的意义上与两者都不相关，但它在众多社会情境中都很重要。
en: Gender, on the contrary, cuts across both ethnicity and class and is not related to either of them in a simple way, yet it is important in a multitude of social situations.

zh: 因此，并不是地位决定了在阶级、性别和族群性之间，哪个身份是最“根本的”。
en: This is not the place, therefore, to decide which status is the most "fundamental" out of class, gender and ethnicity.

zh: 而且，对于多数印度人来说，一种囊括所有印度教徒的共同的集体身份的想法也远非那么明显：种姓和重要的语言学区别在划分印度教徒的同时也团结了他们。和平等主义的欧洲社会不同，印度社会因为等级制度和差异而繁荣，印度教原教旨主义强调的却是相似性。从意识形态上看，印度教原教旨主义类似于欧洲的民族主义和其他地方的身份政治。它的一些特点，也可以在其他环境中鉴别出来一从斐济到南斯拉夫一如下，括号中的例子大部分是说明。
en: Also, the idea of a shared collective identity encompassing all Hindus is far from obvious to most Indians; both caste and important linguistic distinctions have divided Hindus as much as uniting them.

zh: 外部边界被过度传达，内部差异被传达不足。
（在印度教原教旨主义的例子中，有含义的他人是穆斯林——不论在印度还是在巴基斯坦。
）问题：翻译不准确贴切改1：而且，对于多数印度人来说，一种囊括所有印度教徒的共同的集体身份的想法也远非那么明显：种姓和重要的语言学区别在划分印度教徒的同时也团结了他们。
和平等主义的欧洲社会不同，印度社会因为等级制度和差异而繁荣，印度教原教旨主义强调的却是相似性。
en: Unlike egalitarian European societies, Indian society has thrived on hierarchy and difference.Hindutva nevertheless emphasises similarity.

zh: 从意识形态上看，印度教原教旨主义类似于欧洲的民族主义和其他地方的身份政治。
en: Ideologically, hindutva is reminiscent of both European nationalisms and identity politics elsewhere.

zh: 它的一些特点，也可以在其他环境中鉴别出来一从斐济到南斯拉夫一如下，括号中的例子大部分是说明。
en: Some of its features, which can be identified in many other settings as well – from Fiji to Yugoslavia – are as follows.

zh: 外部边界被过度传达，内部差异传达不足。
en: The external boundary is overcommunicated; internal differences are undercommunicated.

zh: （在印度教原教旨主义的例子中，举足轻重的他人是穆斯林——不论在印度还是在巴基斯坦。）
en: (In the case of hindutva, the significant others are Muslims – both Indian and Pakistani.)

zh: 形态学关心语言中声音组合的最小意义单位——词素。句法涉及一些原则，短语和句子根据这些原则构成。
en: Syntax refers to the principles phrases and sentences are built with.

zh: 语言的完整形式结构构成语言的语法，它由关于语言的词素和句法的所有观察资料组成。
en: The entire formal structure of a language, consisting of all observations about its morphemes and syntax, constitutes its grammar.

zh: 人类语言根植于我们从灵长目动物祖先继承来的姿势一呼叫系统。姿势一呼叫系统起到“为”言语“定基调”的作用，为解释语言形式提供合适的框架。
en: Human language is embedded in a gesture-call system inherited from our primate ancestors that serves to "key" speech，providing the appropriate frame for interpreting linguistic form.

zh: 这一系统的姿势成分由用来传递信息的身体运动组成；把这些身体运动做成标记并记录下来的系统叫作声势学。
en: The gestural component of this system consists of body motions used to convey messages; the system of notating and recording these motions is known as kinesics.

zh: 辅助语言代表呼叫成分，它是由包括各种各样音质和发嗓音的语言外声音构成的。
en: The call component is represented by paralanguage, consisting of extralinguistic noises involving various voice qualities and vocalizations.

zh: 但“文化”也是其他学科的研究领域，包括：社会学、民俗研究、文学批评。
en: But then "culture" is the province of other academic disciplines besides: sociology, folklore, literary criticism.

zh: 人类学研究的不同点，在格尔茨看来，在于其操作化的方式；人类学家所做的，首先也最重要的，是民族志。
en: What distinguishes anthropological study, for Geertz, is the way that it is operationalized; what anthropologists do, first and foremost, is ethnography.

zh: 民族志可以被看作是一种“记录”文化的特殊方式，一种特别的“浓重”的写作。
en: And ethnography can be understood as a particular way of "inscribing" culture, as a special kind of ‘thick’ writing.

zh: 人类学的分析，一言以蔽之，就是在深描中冒险。
en: What anthropological analysis amounts to, in a word, is a venture in thick description.

zh: 生态学部分从物质环境和统治结构开始（第一章），再转向作为乡村生活基础的家庭（第二、三章），并以较长的篇幅描述转场放牧作结（第四、五、六、七章）。
en: The ecology begins with the physical environment and structures of domination (chapter 1), moves on to the household as the foundation of village life (chapters 2 and 3), and concludes with an extended portrait of transhumant pastoralism (chapters 4, 5, 6, and 7).

zh: 勒华拉杜里让由克莱格家族所代表的以家庭为形式的乡村生活对抗浓缩在皮埃尔˙莫里这个人身上的山上放牧生活。
en: Le Roy Ladurie opposes village life in households, exemplified by the Clergues, to shepherd life in the hills, epitomized in the person of Pierre Maury.

zh: （后者以下面要讨论的一种异常的方式，受到了比前者既更广泛也更理想化的处理。
en: (The latter, in an anomalous manner discussed below, receives both more extensive and more idealized treatment than the former.)

zh: ）组织得比较松散的考古学部分则是以体态语开始，以神话结束。
en: The more loosely organized archeology begins with body language and ends with myth.

zh: 在这两者之间，勒华拉杜里常常以令人心痒的调子讨论性、性欲、生命周期（婚姻、孩童时期、死亡）、时间和空间、巫术、宗教、道德，以及另外的世界。
en: In between Le Roy Ladurie discusses, often in titillating tones, sex, libido, the life cycle (marriage, childhood, death), time and space, magic, religion, morality, and the other world.

zh: 叙述者从头到尾都在用斜体的引文点缀他的正文—这些引文说起来似乎是那些农民自由的、直接的说话，仿佛某人一边就在村子里旁听，一边用言辞把它们呈现在这里。
en: Throughout, the narrator punctuates his text with italicized citations, the purportedly free direct speech of the peasants, verbally presented as if one were eavesdropping in the village itself.

zh: 可是，卡特林的视觉井不牢靠。
en: Catlin's vision is not, however, secure.

zh: 与今天的社会科学家不同，后者的理论(且不论其价值）为他们的民族志提供了可信性，而卡特林的可信性最终取决于他的描述的力量。
en: Unlike today's social scientists whose theories (regardless of their merit) serve their ethnographic credibility, Catlin's credibility has ultimately to rest on the power of his descriptions.

zh: 正如他的画作并非特别可信一样，其散文也是如此。
en: Just as his painting is not particularly believable, nor is his prose.

zh: 它自己否定了自己。
en: It undermines itself.

zh: 他的目的是现实主义的，而他的文风却是浪漫主义的。
en: His intention is realistic, but his style is romantic.

zh: 通过隐喻，常常是毫无节制的隐喻、惊叹（ecphonesis)、混乱地使用称呼、夸张法、动人之辞（pathopoeia)、欲言又避而不谈（apoplanesis)、打断、延迟、主观主义——这只道出了他文体策略中的一小部分——卡特林努力给他的描述赋予一种强制的真实性，但正是这些策略颠覆了他的意图。
en: Through metaphor, often extravagant metaphor, ecphonesis, the promiscuous use of the vocative, hyperbole, pathopoeia, apoplanesis, interruption, suspense, subjectivism—to name only a few of his stylistic strategies—Catlin tries to give to his descriptions a compelling veracity, but it is precisely these strategies that subvert his intention.

zh: 现实主义要求文体上的节制。
en: Realism demands stylistic sobriety.

zh: 而对于卡特林来说，这种节制却会妨碍他的可信性所依赖的生动叙述。
en: For Catlin such sobriety precludes the hypotyposis upon which his credibility rests.

zh: 他们的观点源于一种缺失感：现代社会缺乏传统意义上的家，这种家具有固定性和物理上的中心，具有绝对的价值观点和统一的实体。
en: Their ideas derive from a sense of loss: that in the modern world there has been lost a traditional home of fixity and physical centredness, of absolute values and a unified reality.

zh: 如今这种“原初”社会文化环境被连根拔起，后来的也不能成为真正意义上的家。
en: Now uprooted from this first and ‘original’ socio-cultural milieu, no succeeding one becomes truly home.

zh: 个体穿行于多重的生活世界，却未能找到一个家。
en: Individuals are in transit between a plurality of life-worlds but come to be at home in none.

zh: 正是人类社会有可能为了他们的生存而破坏生态环境这一事实应该证明，我们远非被我们的生态系统所决定，也远非完美地适应了生态系统。
en: The very fact that it is possible for human societies to undermine the ecological conditions for their own survival ought to prove that we are far from determined by, and perfectly adapted to, our ecosystem.

zh: 但是，这一事实也可提醒我们，提醒我们在社会和环境之间存在着一种持续而必要的相互交换。
en: However, this fact also serves as a reminder that there is a continuous, and necessary, mutual exchange between society and environment.

zh: 有些社会已经被证明相当稳定，因为他们复制了一种不会采用不可挽回的方式改变环境的技术——那些方式要求技术革新或是剧烈的社会变迁。
en: Some societies have proven remarkably stable in that they have reproduced a technology which did not alter their environment irreversibly in ways requiring technical innovation or dramatic social change.

zh: 穆布提的俾格米人在前面的章节里已经讨论过，另一个例子是新几内亚高地的园艺种植社会。
en: The Mbuti pygmies have been discussed in an earlier chapter; another example might be the horticultural societies of highland New Guinea.

zh: 最近的考古学发现似乎显示，在几千年以前就已在那里出现了几乎与今天的主导技术相同的技术。
en: Recent archaeological findings seem to indicate that roughly the same kind of technology which is dominant today was present there thousands of years ago.

zh: 戴尔·海姆斯（Dell Hymes 1981）关于美洲土著人神话叙事中诗歌的研究为理解日常诗歌做出了相当大的突破性贡献。
en: The writings of Dell Hymes (1981) on the poetics of the mythic narration of Native Americans are a ground-breaking endeavour for the enterprise of understanding everyday poetics.

zh: 他揭示了北美土著人叙事中十分精致的诗歌，一种人类学过去从未认识也未想到的诗歌形式（“原始人”不可能有诗歌！）。
en: He unfolds the well-elaborated poetics of Native North American narrations, a poetical form neither recognized nor expected by anthropology in the past ("primitives" cannot have poetics!).

zh: 他坦率地把自己的方法称为“结构主义”，不过实际上仅仅从法国结构主义那里借用了一些形式主义的东西。
en: His methodology is one that he frankly labels as "structuralist", but it is a formalism that only hints at a precedent of French hue.

zh: 列维-斯特劳斯认为（1961: 386）我们自己的民族中心主义是与某种实际存在的或仪式上的食人习俗的道德基础相关的。
en: Lévi-Strauss comments (1961:386) on our own ethnocentrism in being appalled on moral grounds by either actual or ritual cannibalism.

zh: 谴责食人行为，意味着某种身体复活的观念，与身体在物质上被解体相对应。
en: To condemn cannibalist practices implies for instance a belief in bodily resurrection, which would be compromised with the material destruction of the corpse.

zh: 这作为一种宗教性的信仰和那些仪式性的食人行为所依据的信仰如出一辙。
en: This would be a religious belief of the same order as those in which ritualized cannibalism is practised.

zh: 艾伦斯参阅了大量人类学研究，却没有发现一例可靠的目击食人族的说明。
en: Arens, referring to a mass of anthropological research, could not find a single reliable eye-witness account of cannibalism.

zh: 他指出，许多民族编造故事说他们的相邻部落是食人族，这也许可以说明认为食人族真实存在的看法如此普遍。
en: He points out that many peoples tell stories to the effect that the neighbouring tribe are cannibals, which may explain why the belief in cannibalism is so widespread.

zh: 他宣布，事实上，食人禁忌可能和乱伦禁忌一样普遍。如果艾伦斯至少是部分正确的，食人族就应该与分类法相关，但不是食物分类法。
en: Actually, he intimates that a rule against cannibalism may be as universal as the incest taboo.If Arens is at least partly right, cannibalism has to do with classification, but not classification of food.

zh: 虽然食肉动物经常分享食物，但在非人类的灵长成年动物中分享食物的例子很少，这些例子多半包括雄性黑猩猩合作狩猎，然后通常与成年雌性和幼年黑猩猩分享猎获物。
en: Although carnivorous animals often share food, the few examples of food sharing among nonhuman primate adults all involve groups of male chimpanzees cooperating in a hunt and later sharing the spoils, frequently with adult females as well as juveniles.

zh: 这表明食物分享和分工的起源，与偶尔吃陶转变到经常吃肉的食物习性的转变有关，这似乎是在大约250万年前随最早的人类成员产生而发生的。
