en: Stand up straight with your feet together or nearly so, and bend at the knees, keeping the hips locked straight.This will require rising onto your toes, and applying a mild backwards lean of the torso.

zh: 刚开始做这个动作时，上身容易前倾，你会觉得这个动作特别难，但用不了多久，你做起来就会轻松自如。
en: At first this exercise is tricky, because you want to bend forwards at the waist, but eventually you’ll get the hang of it.

zh: 做这个动作时，大部分力量通过膝盖传递，所以膝盖弯曲不要超过90°。
en: Most of the force is transmitted through the knees, so never bend them more than ninety degrees.

zh: 这两种物质已被证实可以改善老鼠的认知能力。
en: These two substances have been shown to improve cognitive function in mice.

zh: 老年灰鼠接受了这两种物质的注射后，在迷宫尽头找到食物的速度，会变得和年轻灰鼠一样快。没注射的老年灰鼠可没那么快。
en: When old mice are injected with the substances, they find food at the end of the maze as fast as young mice—and faster than old mice that have not had them.

zh: 肉毒碱是一种氨基酸，它促逬了人体细胞间能量的传递。
en: L-carnitine is an amino acid that helps transfer energy between our cells;

zh: 乳房X线照片和PKT扫描可以让小肿瘤现身，虽然它们不能确认癌症，只有活组织切片检查能够做到这点。
en: Mammograms and PET scans are valuable tools for showing small tumors (though they don't prove cancer; only a biopsy can do that).

zh: 人们正在不断地幵发着新的工具以发现癌症。
en: And new tools for detection are constantly being developed.

zh: 比如说通常的手术性乳房内窥镜检查法（KOBE),是用窥镜放大乳房组织60倍，可以找到比乳房X线照片找到的小一百倍的肿瘤。
en: The routine operative breast endoscopy (ROBE), for instance, uses a viewing scope to magnify breast tissue up to sixty times its normal size and identify tumors 1/100th the size of what can be picked up on mammograms.

zh: 早期探测到乳腺癌的治疗通常可以由乳房肿瘤切除术进 行，即摘除肿块。
en: With early detection of breast cancer, the treatment can usually be handled by a lumpectomy—the removal of the lump.

zh: 人们正茌不断地开发着新的工具以发现癌症。
en: And new tools for detection are constantly being developed.

zh: 比如说通常的手术性乳房内窥镜检查法（KOBE)，是用窥镜放大乳房组织60倍，可以找到比乳房X线照片找到的小一百倍的肿瘤。
en: The routine operative breast endoscopy (ROBE), for in stance, uses a viewing scope to magnify breast tissue up to sixty times its normal size and identify tumors 1/100th the size of what can be picked up on mammograms.

zh: 早期探测到乳腺癌的治疗通常可以由乳房肿瘤切除术进行，即摘除肿块。
en: With early detection of breast cancer, the treatment can usually be handled by a lumpectomy—the removal of the lump.

zh: 食物所发挥的作用之一就是帮你的身体加工处理雌性激素。
en: One of the ways food can play a role is to help your body process estrogen.

zh: 一些不同种类的食物对此会起些作用。
en: A couple different categories of foods can help.

zh: 十字花科食物如花椰菜、白菜、菜花都含有该复合物，这种物质能促成类雌性激素活性，防止乳腺癌。
en: Cru-ciferous foods like broccoli, cabbage, cauliflower, and Brussels sprouts contain compounds that help produce estrogen-like activity and protect against breast cancer.
Think of omega-3s as a can of WD-40 for the body.

zh: Ω3脂肪酸就像适用子人体的润滑剂，它可以对关节起到润滑作用，让关有效地工作。关节若是一直保待润滑，老年时关节发生摩擦受阻、挤压磨损或疼痛的几率都会下降。
en: Omega-3s are believed to help provide the lubrication that the joints need to function at an effective level By keeping the joints lubed, you experience less friction, less grinding, and less pain as you age.

zh: 很多研究表明，03脂肪酸能够缓解关节发炎。
en: Omega-3s have been shown in repeated studies to decrease inflammation in inflamed joints.

zh: 萨金特 (1921)最先发明了通过纵跳测试成人腿部最大功率的试验。
en: The measurement of maximal leg power by means of a vertical jump was first developed for adults by Sargent (1921).

zh: 要求受试者尽可能向上进行垂直跳。
en: Subjects are required to jump vertically as high as they can.

zh: 测试者在垂直跳的最高点用粉笔标上记号。
en: At the peak of the jump, the examinee marks the measuring board with chalk.

zh: 从跳跃的高度可以计算出受试者竭尽全力所能产生腿部“功率”的能力。
en: The subject's ability to exert 'power' with the legs is derived from the height of the jump.

zh: 3次跳跃的最大值或平均值作为试验的得分。
en: The best or the average value of three jumps is generally taken as the test score.

zh: 纵跳被认为是腿部功率的有效指标。从萨金特试验演化出各种各样的纵跳方案，如跳起-手触墙试验，阿巴拉科夫试验。
en: The vertical jump has been accepted as a valid measure of leg power and various vertical jump protocols have been derived from the Sargent test (e.g.jump-and-reach test, the Abalakow test).

zh: 近年来，相对选择性β2-激动剂(β2-agonists)的发展，具有使支气管平滑肌松弛的作用，而对心脏的作用较小。
en: Recent years have seen the development of relatively selective β2-agonists, that have potent bronchial smooth muscle relaxant effect, with little cardiac stimulation.

zh: 这些药物，包括（美国）阿布特罗或（世界其他地方）沙丁胺醇,奥西那林，特布他林，比托特罗,非诺特罗和沙米特罗是治疗哮喘中支气管痉挛的主要药物。不论是对慢性的或急性的支气管痉挛，也包括运动性哮喘有效。
en: These agents, including albuterol (USA) or salbutamol (rest of the world), metaproterenol, terbutaline, bitolterol, fenoterol and salmeterol, are the mainstay in the treatment of the bronchospastic component of asthma, be it chronic or acute, including EIA.

zh: 山羊挺身是我推荐的少数需要训练伙伴的练习之一。
en: The hyperextension is one of the few exercises I advocate which requires a training partner.

zh: 趴在餐桌、书桌或较高的台子上，让双腿（直到骨盆）在平面上，上半身从髋部处开始悬空并下垂——与双腿的夹角成90°，你要想保持这个姿势，需要他人压住你的脚踝，以免摔下来。
en: Lie face down on a table, desk or high bench, so that your legs are resting on the surface up to your pelvis, but your torso is hanging straight down.Your trunk and legs will form a right angle at the hips.To maintain this position, you’ll need somebody to push down on your ankles so you don’t fall off.

zh: 你可以在髋部下面放个垫子或一块毛巾，以增加舒适度。
en: A cushion or wrapped up towel under your hips is also a good idea to prevent the edge of the table from cutting into you.

zh: 双手置于脑后，上半身向上抬起，直到与双腿持平。
en: Place your hands behind your head, and raise your torso until it is level with your legs.

zh: 坚持此姿势片刻，然后慢慢放低身体，如此重复。山羊挺身能够锻炼腘绳肌、臀肌、髋部和脊椎肌肉，而同时也不会给脊柱造成任何压力。
en: Hold this position for a moment before lowering yourself back down again and repeating for high reps. Hyperextensions work the hamstring complex, the glutes, the hips and spinal muscles.

zh: 那些由于做大重量硬拉或深蹲而使椎间盘破裂或部分错位的家伙，可以通过该练习锻炼背部肌肉，而不会加重旧伤。
en: It’s a handy exercise to know, because it trains all these muscles without transmitting any pressure down through the spinal column.Guys who have ruptured or partially dislocated their discs by doing heavy deadlifts and squats will be able to train their back muscles with this exercise without aggravating their existing injuries.

zh: 流感病毒就像一个想要赖在你的沙发椅上借宿的高中同学一样，会使你的生活混乱一些日子后扬长而去。
en: The flu virus, like a high school friend who wants to crash on your couch, makes your life miserable for a few days and then hightails it out of there.

zh: 至于其他像传染性单核细胞增多症，会使你非常累，但你需要更长时间经历其发展过程。
en: Others, like mononucleosis, which makes you extremely tired, take a little longer to run their course.

zh: 还有一些如疱疹病毒，它们会想办法存活下来并且安静地待在你的身体里，但是会偶尔突然发作（就像伤风发热时的唇疱疹来来去去的反复）。
en: Still others, like the herpesvirus, figure out a way to survive and be quiet within the body but then flare up occasionally (cold sores come and go).

zh: 当血小板碰到血管壁上不平的补丁时，它们会散成颗粒，牢牢地附在血管壁上，像抓救命稻草一样。
en: When blood platelet do hit that rough patch, they degranulate and grab onto the lining as if it’s a life preserver.

zh: （如果血管不平是因为皮肤割伤，那你应该很高兴血小板及时赶到，因为它们可以在血管破损处凝血，最终变成伤痂，有利于止血复原。）
en: (If the roughness were a cut in the skin, you’d be glad they’d arrived on the scene because they’d be there to make a clot at the end of the blood vessel, which would eventually become a scab that would help you stop bleeding and heal.)

zh: 在运动肌肉中，Po2和pH值较低，而乳酸水平较高。
en: In exercising muscle, Po2 and pH are low and lactate concentrations are high.

zh: 伤口的内环境具有类似的条件。
en: Similar conditions can be found in the interior milieu of wounds.

zh: 正在愈合的伤口特征是形成新毛细血管和胶原蛋白。大量研究人员对pH值和呼吸气体浓度的变化可能对促生长作用进行了研究。
en: The healing wound is characterized by new capillary and collagen formation, and a number of investigators have focused on possible growth-promoting effects of the changes in pH and respiratory gas concentrations.

zh: 在组织水平上，伤口愈合和运动引起的合成代谢之间是否存在着共同的机制？
en: Might there be common mechanisms at the tissue level linking wound healing with exercise-induced anabolism?

zh: 背向墙壁（不接触墙壁）站立，身体向后弯曲，双手举过头顶，与墙壁接触，做出第七式的起始姿势（图95）。
en: This step begins when you are standing totally clear of the wall, with your back to it.From here, assume the start position you learned for walking down; bend backwards with your hands over your shoulders making contact with the wall (fig. 95).

zh: 然后，如第七式中描述的那样，双手向下“行走”，直到贴着墙根做出标准的桥式（图97）。
en: Then walk down the wall as described in Step 7, until you are in a full bridge hold next to the base of the wall (fig. 97).Now it’s time to go back up.

zh: 接下来，你需要向反方向运动。
en: This is done by reversing the movement.

zh: 让一只手重新接触墙壁，同时用力推墙壁，之后让另一只手也接触墙壁，位置比之前那只手略高（图98）。
en: Place one palm back on the wall, pushing through it.Next, place your other palm above it (fig. 98).

zh: 把双手从地面上转移到墙壁上，是该动作最难的地方。
en: This transition whereby your palms go from the floor back onto the wall is the hardest part of the technique.

zh: 接下来只是交替地把一只手放得比另一只手更靠上一些，顺着墙壁往上“走”。
en: Now simply place one palm above the other repeatedly as you go back up the wall.

zh: 随着身体逐渐伸展，你很可能需要慢慢小步移动向墙壁靠拢，以保证手掌处有足够的压力。
en: As your body straightens, you will probably have to take mini-steps back towards the wall to keep a healthy pressure going through your palms.

zh: 继续向上“走”，直到身体几乎伸直（图99）。
en: Continue walking upwards until you are nearly straight (fig. 99).

zh: 然后，双手轻轻推墙，再次完全脱离墙壁站立（图100）。
en: From here, push gently away from the wall until you are standing totally clear from it again (fig. 100).

zh: 站立、向下“行走”、向上“行走”、再回到站立姿势，这就是一个完整的上行桥动作。
en: This cycle—standing, walking all the way down, walking back up, and standing free again—constitutes one single repetition of the wall walking bridges (up).

zh: 我认为每位训练者都应该为每个身体部位准备至少一个爆发式动作。
en: I’m a big believer that every student of bodyweight training should have at least one explosive movement in their arsenal for each bodypart.

zh: 哨兵引体向上便是这种极佳的练习之一。
en: Sentry pullups are one of the best.

zh: 向上跳起抓住横杆，做标准引体向上，但不要在动作最高点停下来，而是继续向上，直到躯干高过横杆。然后下压手臂让其完全伸展并锁定，此时横杆应该位于你的髋部。
en: Jump up to a chinning bar and do a full pullup.But don’t stop at the top—keep lifting your torso up until it is over the bar, and then press your arms to lockout so that you are fully extended, with the bar at hip level.

zh: 这个动作应该一气呵成——这需要借助惯性来完成。
en: This should be performed as one fluid movement, and it will require some momentum to achieve.

zh: 这种爆发式引体向上可以锻炼你的背部和肱二头肌，之后向下压动作的过渡过程能够很好地锻炼你的肘部、腕部及前臂，最后的下压部分中，锻炼的肌肉与屈臂撑所锻炼的相同，主要是肱三头肌、胸肌和背阔肌。
en: The explosive pullup works the back and biceps, and the circular transitional movement into a downwards press position very powerfully trains the elbows, wrists and forearms.The final part of the technique, the downwards press, works the same muscles as dips; triceps, pectorals and lats, mainly.

zh: 心脏就像你家一样，也有“门厅”——心房，储存流入心脏的血液。
en: Now, just like your house, your heart also has an atrium, which holds the blood coming into your heart.

zh: 当这种相对不太重要的房间发生纤维性颤动时，人们会感到心悸。
en: When fibrillation happens in this less critical chamber, folks feel palpitations.

zh: 与需要植入AICD的心脏病人不同，这种患者有时需要用其他方法治疗，比如植入起搏器、射频消溶手术或服用药品。药物治疗包括服用降低血液黏度的药品，能够防止不断运动的心房壁上因凝血累积而引发中风。
en: Instead of an AICD, these people sometimes need minimally invasive procedures like a pacemaker insertion, ablation or medications including a blood thinner to prevent blood clots that accumulate on the quivering  atrial walls and can cause strokes.

zh: 根据身体运动情况不同，每天能量摄入可以变动。
en: Energy intake may fluctuate from day to day according to physical exercise.

zh: 为合理控制血糖，强制性固定、定量和经过测量的膳食是不必要的，从心理上考虑也不受欢迎。
en: To impose a fixed, weighed and measured diet is not required for optimal glycaemic control and is undesirable for psychological reasons.

zh: 单纯限制碳水化合物摄入的膳食，自然会导致摄入过多的脂肪，因而对血管有害。
en: A diet that simply restricts the carbohydrate intake automatically results in an excessive intake of fat which is harmful to the blood vessels.

zh: 显然，笼统限制能量摄入将妨碍正常的生长发育（Dorchy et al.，1979)。
en: Overall energy restriction prevents normal growth (Dorchy et al., 1979).

zh: 运动员必须有一个良好平衡膳食，适合每天的胰岛素活性和身体运动的需要。
en: It is necessary for the athlete to have a wellbalanced diet, adapted daily to both insulin activity and physical exercise.

zh: 但是，使用合适的公式，身体成分评定可以成为综合评价健康状况、身体素质和运动能力的一个重要组成部分（Boileau et al.，1988)。
en: However, when appropriate equations are used, body composition assessment can be an important component in the comprehensive evaluation of health fitness and performance (Boileau et al., 1988).

zh: 脂肪与瘦组织的重量会影响运动能力的事实已得到公认。
en: It is well recognized that relative amounts of fat and fat-free mass influence performance.

zh: 对于采用运动能力测试身体素质试验而言，这一事实有着十分重要的意义。
en: This fact has important implications for physical fitness testing in which performance-based items are used.

zh: 髙水平的身体活动是否能延缓原发性的自然衰老过程是未知的，但目前，没有证据支持这个观点。
en: Whether high levels of physical activity can extend the natural, or primary, aging process is not known, but at present, no evidence supports that idea.

zh: 就人类而言，这个问题很难通过实施实验来解答。
en: The question, of course, would be extraordinarily difficult to address in the experimental setting for human beings.

zh: 最好的替代方式是利用动物实验，它们的生存周期较短，并且更容易作为受试者参加长期的实验研究。
en: The best we can do is look at animals, who don’t live as long and can be coerced to participate as long-term research subjects more easily.

zh: 如果你认为美国存在体重问题，那么中国人的问题还要严重。
en: If you think America has a weight problem, pity the poor Chinese.

zh: 因为他们历史上经历过长时间的饥荒，生成了预防饥饿的基因，所以对美国人来说造成糖尿病的体重増加数哪怕一点零头，也会造成中国人的糖尿病。
en: Because they went through long periods of famine, they developed the genetics to prevent starvation so well that just a small fraction of the weight gain that causes diabetes in Americans causes diabetes in the Chinese.

zh: （在身体综合指数同为27的情况下，中国人患Ⅱ型糖尿病的几率要高60倍。
en: (At the same BMI of 27; the Chinese are sixty times more likely to have type 2 diabetes.)

zh: ）这就是缘于饥饿基因。
en: That's attributed to starvation genes.

zh: 初恋的经历会使你了解到身心连接的强烈体验。
en: As you know from your first love, there is a strong mind-body connection.

zh: 当你心情愉快的时候，生理感觉也会不同。
en: You feel different when you're happy.

zh: 事实上，心情愉快让你更健康。
en: In fact, you’re healthier when you’re happy.

zh: 因此我们的情感（尤其指处理生活中非理性事务的态度）能够对身体机能产生非常重大的影响，也就没有什么可奇怪的了。
en: So it shouldn't be a surprise that your emotions—specifically, how you handle some of the nonscientific things in your life—can have an enormous impact on the way your body works.

zh: 如果你经常乘飞机，就应该每隔两小时起身四处走动一下，或坐在座位上活动腿部。
en: If you fly a lot, you should get up and walk around every two hours, or move your feet with exercises at your seat.

zh: 这样能够避免产生深静脉血栓（或腿部静脉阻塞）。
en: Doing so will help you prevent a condition called deep vein thrombosis (or clotted leg vein) that occurs when you're sitting in the same position for a long time.

zh: 在固定位置上久坐会出现这种健康问题：腿部不活动，血液凝块就会形成。
en: The danger is that without movement, a blood clot can form in the leg.

zh: 这种凝块还有时能进入肺部，阻住血液输往肺部（那就糟糕了）。
en: That clot can then slip up into the lungs and block off their blood supply (that's a bad thing).

zh: 贝诺伊特的神话当然是来自于其职业摔跤手的家族传统。
en: Benoit's myth was surely grounded in his pedigree as a professional wrestler.

zh: 当贝诺伊特只是一个加拿大普通少年儿童时，他就展现出了对职业摔跤的巨大的兴趣。他崇拜那些已经成名的摔跤手，比如布雷特“职业杀手”哈特，著名英国摔跤组合斗牛犬的一员，被人们所熟知为“炸药小子”的汤姆•比林顿。
en: Benoit showed interest in professional wrestling as a teenager in Canada, idolizing established wrestlers like Bret "The Hit Man" Hart and the one-half of famous tag team The British Bulldogs, Tom Billington, who was known as “The Dynamite Kid.”

zh: 疼痛或不适感之所以很难预料（比如，当时拉里•金感到右臂剧痛，而心脏痛时通常不是右侧痛），是因为心脏本身不会感到疼痛；心脏没有专门的痛觉神经纤维，心脏神经不会直接感到疼痛。
en: The reason the pain or discomfort can be so unpredictable (the reason, for instance, that Larry King felt intense pain in his right arm, which is not the usual side for heart pain) is that the heart itself does not feel pain; it does not have specific pain fibers.The heart's nerves do not feel pain directly.

zh: 不过当心脏发生问题时，心脏神经电活动会变得不稳定。
en: But when something is going wrong with the heart, its nerves may become electrically unstable.

zh: 当心脏神经通过脊神经时，会让其他神经短路——比如与手臂、胸部或颌部等相连的各处神经。
en: And when they cross the spinal column, they may short-circuit other nerves—nerves that connect with your arm, for example, or your chest.

zh: 这种神经能传递疼痛的感觉，因此手臂或者是胸部和颌部会疼，只要神经短路的部位都会产生疼痛。
en: And those nerves are the ones that transmit the pain impulses.So your arm aches, or your chest; or your jaw; wherever nerves are being shorted out.

zh: 人脑受到的早期训练，确实会影响神经细胞的强健与否。
en: The way we train our brains at an early age actually has an effect on which of those neuron systems will become good and strong and which won't.

zh: （以自闭症患儿为例，根据目前最先进的理论，使用较少的神经链不会脱落，这说明交叠的结构令自闭儿童很难集中注意力，因为脑中同时发生的事情实在太多了。
en: (In autistic children, as the current best theory goes, those underused links don't fall off, meaning the jumbled mass makes it hard for autistic children to focus because there too much going on.)

zh: ）这与影响注意力集中的一种神经系统紊乱缺乏注意力综合征(ADD)不同。
en: This is different from attention deficit disorder (ADD)—a disorder affecting the ability to concentrate.

zh: 实际上，我们许多人在儿时都出现过这种问题（但是在几年前，医生几乎无法诊断出这种疾病），很难将注意力集中在一件事情上，这种情况甚至可能会延续到成年。
en: Many of us actually had it as kids (but it was rarely diagnosed years ago), and difficulty concentrating on only one subject can be something we carry even into adulthood.

zh: 人脑中约有1亿个神经细胞（又称神经元），如果将它们排成一列，长度可以达到4万8千公里。
en: You have 100 billion neurons in your brain, which, if stretched out in length, would reach thirty thousand miles.

zh: 每个神经细胞都含有要发送到其他神经细胞的信息，这样人体能正常工作。
en: Each of these nerve cells contains pieces of information that need to be transmitted to another neuron so that your body can properly function.

zh: 神经细胞携带信息，但是只有把信息传给其他细胞，这些信息才有用。
en: Neurons hold the information, but unless it’s communicated to another neuron, it’s virtually useless.

zh: 狂食行为通常包括摄人高热量的食物(糖果），常常不引人注意或秘密地进食。
en: The eating binge typically includes high caloric density foods (sweets), usually eaten inconspicuously or secretly.

zh: 通过呕吐来缓解腹部不适，但患者能继续狂食行为。
en: By using vomiting to relieve abdominal discomfort, the individual can continue the binge.

zh: 与神经性厌食症一样，神经性易饿症也是开始于青春期或成年早期(American Psychiatric Association, 1987)。
en: As with anorexia nervosa, bulimia nervosa begins in adolescence or in early adulthood (American Psychiatric Association, 1987).

zh: 易饿症患者的家长常常是肥胖的，而易饿症患者在青春期通常也是肥胖的。
en: Parents of bulimics are frequently obese, and bulimics have often been obese during adolescence.

zh: 从传统意义上来说，脑部问题可以分为两种情况。
en: Traditionally, brain malfunctions have been broken up into two kinds.

zh: 其一，脑部机能障碍有明确的生理学、神经学和医学原因，如中风、失忆和帕金森综合征。
en: In one, the brain dysfunction has an obvious physiological, neurological, and medical explanation: things like strokes, memory loss, and Parkinson's disease.

zh: 其二，神经障碍设有明确的神经学解释，如抑郁症、焦虑和人格分裂。
en: In the other kind, the neural dysfunction has no clear neurological explanation: things like depression, anxiety, and personality disorders.

zh: 长久以来，这些问题一直令人捉摸不透，因为诊断结论都是不明确和不精准的。
en: For years, these types of problems were as murky as floodwaters because their diagnoses were unclear and imprecise.

zh: 我们相信，会有越来越多的医学证据指明，造成这些紊乱症状的，都是什么种类的神经障碍问题。
en: More and more medical evidence will suggest what neurological malfunctions are taking place to cause some of these disorders.

zh: 并非只有“胆结石"和“滚石”乐队这两种“石”会影响我们的生活。
en: Gallstones and the Rolling Stones aren't the only stones that can change your life.

zh: 还有一种“石”会让你痛得昏过去，像橄榄球运动员被对手在肚子上猛顶一下一样。
en: The other is the one thatll make you keel over like a rugby player who's been kneed in the groin.

zh: 尿液含水量过少，会形成小晶体，接着晶体会聚集形成结石，即肾结石。患者在排尿时，背部下侧和腰侧都会剧痛。
en: Kidney stones form when urine becomes so concentrated that small crystals and then stones are formed—creating intense pain in your lower back and side and when you urinate.

zh: 肾结石的主要防治方法是把自己的身体当成一个空的游泳池，将池子装满水，让水冲出来，通过用水稀释结晶体的方法来防止其进一步形成结石。
en: The main method of prevention is to treat your body like an empty swimming pool and flood it with water to flush it out, which inhibits the formation of the crystals by diluting them with water.

zh: 肾上腺也分泌降肾上腺素和肾上腺素。当你激动时，这两种物质的分泌水平就会上升。
en: Your adrenal glands also produce norepinephrine and epinephrine, levels of which rise when you get excited.

zh: 在正常的日常生活中，肾上腺素的水平维持在每毫升200至800毫微克（十亿分之一克）。
en: In normal daily life, your levels of epinephrine hover between 200 to 800 nanograms per milliliter.

zh: 你一定了解那种感觉，就是当你险些遇上车祸时，你会感到脸红、心跳，甚至咒骂那些不长眼睛的并道行驶司机。
en: You know that feeling when you narrowly avoid a car accident—when your face feels flushed, your heart races, and you swear at the incompetence of no-look mergers?

zh: 在这种情况下，肾上腺素的水平升至1500到2500毫微克之间。
en: In that case, epinephrine levels rise to between 1,500 and 2,500.

zh: ★它会使你的血压升高。
en: ★ It increases your blood pressure.

zh: ★这会增加心脏病、中风、记忆力减退、肾衰竭、眼睛问题、关节炎和肺病的风险。
en: ★ It increases your risk of heart attacks, strokes, memory loss, kidney failure, eye problems, arthritis, and lung disease.

zh: ★它降低了你对抗感染的能力。
en: ★ It decreases your ability to fight off infections.

zh: 肾上腺是位于你的肾脏上方呈三角形的腺体。它们看起来像一顶贝雷帽（见图10.3)。
en: These are triangular-shaped glands located on the top of your kidneys; they look almost like a beret or even a two-colored plastic hat you'd put on the top of Mr Potato Head (see Figure 11.3).

zh: 但是请别把它们奇怪的外表 (和橡皮一样的质地结构）看做不重要的东西。这顶帽子的梢梢倾斜就会造成你体内的激素大乱。
en: But don't mistake their odd appearance (and eraser-like texture) for lack of importance; a slight tip of the hat would lead to a hormonal riot in your body.

zh: 饮食中主要的能量来源是高碳水化合物和加工的食物，也就是说这种饮食经常依靠果葡糖浆（也称精制糖）调味，意味着升糖指数(GI)非常高，这个数值指的是身体处理过后的食物转化成糖原或者血糖的比率。
en: The problem with a diet that gets most of its calories from high-carb, processed foods is that it often relies on high-fructose corn syrup (aka refined sugar) for taste and is high on the glycemic index, which measures the rate at which foods are processed by the body and converted into glycogen, or blood sugar.

zh: 这种饮食方案的结果是，当吸收的大量糖分进入血液时，我们的身体会奋力进行处理和存储。
en: The consequence of this kind of diet is that when we continually dump loads of sugar into the bloodstream, our bodies struggle to process and store this bonanza.

zh: 为了能实现这一过程，身体会分泌更多的胰岛素，胰岛素是给肝脏和全身输送糖分的激素。
en: To accomplish this, the body releases more and more insulin, which is a hormone that transports sugar to the liver and throughout the body.

zh: 虽然传统的和新的身体成分测量方法一般能够提供比较精确的结果，可是它们通常只局限在实验室内使用并且技术昂贵。
en: While the traditional and newer body composition methods generally offer better accuracy and precision, their application is normally restricted to a laboratory setting and requires expensive technology.

zh: 此外，这些检测需要受试者的合作和（或）冗长的测量程序，这两点对于儿童都可能成为问题。
en: Additionally, these measurements may require extensive subject cooperation and/or a lengthy measurement process, both of which can be problematic with children.

zh: 因此场地和临床测试十分需要能够提供快速、安全、便宜和精确的身体成分检测的方法。
en: Methods which provide rapid, safe, inexpensive, accurate and precise body composition measurements are needed for clinical and field testing.

zh: 在这个意义上，有3种最常用的方法可供使用：体重指数、人体测量技术和生物电阻抗分析法。
en: In this context, the three most frequently utilized methods are the body mass index (BMI), anthropometry and bioelectric impedance analysis (BIA).

zh: 如果是大脑的潜意识在控制节奏，它就必须有密切监视时间流逝的能力。
en: If the subconscious brain controls pace, it must have the ability to closely monitor the passage of time.

zh: 这个中央控制器必须知道你在比赛中跑过的距离和时间，否则它不能有效地运作。
en: Such a central controller cannot operate effectively unless it is aware of the distance you’ve run and the time that’s passed in the race.

zh: 这意味着，我们所有的人都必须有一个可靠的生物钟。
en: That means we must have, in all of us, a reliable, internal clock.

zh: 那么，这是我们在本书中第一次谈到内在计时机制和生物钟，它们决定了运动表现，之后，我们会发现更多的证据。
en: This, then, is our first encounter in these pages of intrinsic timekeeping mechanisms, clocks that dictate exercise performance.Before we reach the end, we will find evidence for many more.

zh: 假如是说女明星黛米•摩尔（《人鬼情未了》女主角），这个论断就是真的。
en: Well, in Demi Moore's case, it may be true.

zh: 嗓音沙哑往往是声带在发生变化，特別是那些常常大声说话的人，比如学校老师和球队教练，就更得当心了。
en: But hoarseness can signify actual changes of your vocal cords, especially in people who often speak loudly, like schoolteachers and football coaches.

zh: 当吸烟或嗓子用得过多时（职业歌手，即使是那些对型唱歌的，就被医生告诫不得吸烟，不得用嗓过多），声带过度劳累，会留下伤痕，伤痕随即还会增生，称为息肉。
en: When you smoke or strain your voice (which professional singers—even those who lip-synch—are taught not to do), you irritate the vocal cords and form scars and subsequent overgrowths that are called polyps.

zh: 随着年龄增长，我们都会有健忘的时候。
en: As we get older, everyone has bouts of forgetfulness.

zh: 你甚至还会忘记很重要的事情，而且这些事情似乎都是很容易就能记的，比如朋友的名字、结婚周年纪念日、最爱乐队的名字（“就是那个四人组合，呃，发型很糟的……怎么就是想不起来呢？”）。
en: You might even forget things important to you and seemingly simple to remember, like names of friends, the date of your anniversary, the name of your favorite band (You know, the four guys, c'mon, bad haircuts...).Anyway, age-related memory loss is normal.

zh: 不管怎样，我们不需要被动地接受自然衰老的结局（“啊，想起来了，是‘甲壳虫’乐队组合！”），我们可以想办法防止与衰老有关的失忆发生。
en: But, as we'll outline later in the chapter (the Beatles!), we don't have to accept normal aging and we can take steps to prevent age-related memory loss.

zh: 湿球温度是最常用的热应激的指标，它考虑到了气温、湿度和太阳辐射三个条件。
en: The most commonly applied heat stress index is the wet bulb globe temperature (WBGT), which takes into account temperature, humidity and solar radiation.

zh: 用于测量这三种指标并计算出WBGT的便携式热应激检测器已有商品出售，我们向所有户外运动项目的组织者推荐使用这种产品。
en: Portable heat stress monitors which measure these three variables and compute WBGT are commercially available and are recommended for all organizers of outdoor athletic events.

zh: 表23.5列举了根据WBGT指数修改户外活动的意见。
en: Modification for outdoor activities, according to the WBGT index are outlined in Table 23.5.

zh: 坚持这个痛苦的姿势10秒钟，尽可能绷紧背部肌肉。
en: Hold this painful pull, squeezing the back muscles as hard as you can, for ten seconds.

zh: 暂停5秒钟，重复动作5次。
en: Pause for five seconds, before repeating.Do this exercise five times.

zh: 十字架式是绝佳的收尾动作，无需其他装备，一分钟内完成四个动作周期，就能让你肌肉酸痛、汗流浃背。
en: Crucifix pulls are a brilliant finisher; although they will leave you sweating and in pain, they require no kit, and four cycles will take under a minute.

zh: 2000年，Maurice Greene (莫里斯•格林） 美国世界冠军和奥运冠军的短跑名将，并且曾经是世界上跑得最快的人——把他在Gaz de France (法国燃气公司）田径大奖赛上输给葡萄牙选手Francis Obikwelu (弗朗西斯•奥比克维鲁）的结果归咎于时差。
en: 2000.U.S. world and Olympic champion sprinter Maurice Greene, once the world’s fastest man, explains that jet lag was to blame for his loss to Portugal’s Francis Obikwelu in the 100 meters at the Gaz de  France track meet.

zh: 2002年，他退出在法国举行的100m大奖赛的比赛，理由是时差导致了他在预赛中平庸的10.56s的成绩。
en: In 2002, he withdraws from the Grand Prix 100-meter event in France, citing jet lag as responsible for his mediocre time of 0:10.56 in the heats.

zh: 2004年，他在法国再次输给了Obikwelu，他抱怨说由于跨境飞行，他的身体十分疲惫。
en: In 2004, he again loses to Obikwelu in  France, complaining that his body was very tired from his overseas flight.

zh: 毫不夸张地说，时间是最重要的。
en: Time is, quite literally, of the essence.

zh: 实际上，它为我们生活在这个星球上划出了许多界限。
en: Indeed, it creates the very boundaries of our lives on this planet.

zh: 从我们出生的那刻起，沙子就开始从沙漏不断地流出，一直记录到我们离开的那个点，从不间断。
en: From the moment of our birth, the sand begins to flow without ceasing through the hourglass to mark the point of our exit.

zh: 在这段时间中，我们用所做的一切来标记时间，包括睡觉、吃饭、工作、度假等等。
en: In between times, we mark time in all that we do—our sleeping, eating, working, vacations.

zh: 显然，再没有其他任何因素可以定义我们的存在。
en: Clearly, no other single factor so defines our existence.

zh: 难怪历史上伟大的思考者，包括哲学家、数学家、诗人、神学家和物理学家都一直在努力了解时间的本质。
en: No wonder, then, that the great thinkers—philosophers, mathematicians, poets, theologians, physicists—have struggled throughout history to understand the nature of time.

zh: 时间是我们都知道的东西。
en: Time is something we all know about.

zh: 但它究竟是什么？
en: But what is it?

zh: 根据以前的场景，我们都体验了这样那样的时间观念，它们提醒我们掌控我们每天的活动和决定。
en: The previous scenario, which we’ve all experienced in one form or another, reminds us how an acute perception of time governs our daily activities and decisions.

zh: 事实上，很难想到任何不涉及时间感觉的活动。
en: Indeed, it’s difficult to think of any action that doesn’t involve some kind of temporal sense.

zh: 我们需要在空间 和时间上洞察周围的环境。
en: We need to perceive our environment in both spatial and temporal realms.

zh: 你要等多久的红灯，才会意识到它坏了，然后直接穿过马路？
en: How long do you wait for the red light to change before realizing that it’s malfunctioning and driving on through?

zh: 你是如何安全地穿过一条繁忙的街道的？
en: How do you safely cross a busy street?

zh: 由于食物对消化的影响如此之大，我们有理由进一步推论: 只要想出哪些食物在为健康制造障碍，我们就能改变自己的生活质量，让自己感觉更好。
en: Since food has so much of an influence on our digestion, it stands to reason that you can change the way you live and feel by figuring out the foods that are causing you trouble.

zh: 鉴于可供挑选的食物品种繁多，最好的检验办法是食品排除法测试。
en: Since there are so many foods to choose from, the best way to experiment is through the food-elimination test.

zh: 在这个测试里，大约每隔三天，你就能彻底排除掉一组食品。
en: In this test, you completely eliminate one group of foods for about three days in a row.

zh: 每个人都会随着一年年生日的过去而同步衰老，这就是你的“日历年龄”。
en: Everyone ages at the same rate with birthdays every year—that's your calendar age.

zh: 但是，你却可以通过选择不同的生活方式让你的时钟走得快些或是慢些。生活方式的选择会因为不同的人对待身体的方式和给身体输送的东西不同而有所差别。
en: But you have the power to turn your clock faster or slower with the lifestyle choices you make regarding what you do with your body and what you put into it.

zh: 比如有一位50岁的女性，抽烟让她的肺里充满了尼古丁，她的食物结构也基本是以肝泥和香肠为主。这些对身体的糟踏使她拥有的是一个65岁女性的身体。而如果一个50岁的女性饮食健康，远离毒素，并且进行适量的体育锻炼，照顾好自己的身体，那么她的身体和健康状况就相当于一个36岁的女性。
en: For example, a fifty-year-old who douses her lungs with nicotine and builds her food pyramid with chopped liver and sausage actually may have the body of a sixty-five-year-old because of the destruction she's doing, while a fifty-year-old who eats well, stays away from toxins, and takes care of her body with moderate physical activity could have the body and health of a thirty-six-year-old.

zh: 消化系统食物中毒就像人体内刮起一阵破坏力极强的飓风，曾经食用变质肉食而整晚腹泻的人是最清楚不过的。
en: Anybody who’s had a bad piece of meat or fish that led to a one-night stand with a toilet knows all too well the typhoon that swirls in your digestive system from a bad case of food poisoning.

zh: 在美国，食物中毒每年会造成2500人死亡，通常是由于外来细胞侵入人体所致。常见的临床表现为呕吐和腹泻，患者很可能会对这种痛苦经历印象深刻。
en: Responsible for twenty-five hundred deaths every year in the United States, food poisoning—caused by the invasion by foreign bacteria of your system—usually manifests itself with vomiting, diarrhea, and your promise to swear off the culprit forever.

zh: 横向研究设计（cross-sectional studies）为同一时间点对不同年龄受试者进行测验(例如6、8 、10岁儿童)，与纵向研究相较之下，可花费较少时间来执行此类研究。
en: Cross-sectional studies are usually less time-consuming to carry out than longitudinal studies.Cross-sectional studies test several age groups (e.g., 6, 8, and 10) at the same point in time.

zh: 但是 ，虽然横向研究比纵向研究具备时间上的经济效益，横向研究的限制是有所谓世代问题(cohort problem)的存在。所谓世代问题，指的是在同一时间点接受调查的各族群，是否在当时也都具备了同样的条件与环境？换句话说，各年龄层的受试者都是来自同一个母群体吗？
en: Although these studies are more time efficient than longitudinal studies, a limitation called the cohort problem exists: Are all the age groups really from the same population (group of cohorts)?

zh: 举例来说，影响现今6岁儿童垂直跳成绩的学习条件与环境，跟现今的10岁儿童在当他们6岁时，所有学习条件与环境是一样的吗？或者应该这么解释，所有可能会影响现今6岁儿童垂直跳成绩的外在环境条件，在现今10岁儿童当时是6岁时，也都存在吗？有无可能在经过了4年后，体育课程又有了一些更创新的教学、指导与练习方法，所以现今6岁的儿童可以学习更先进的有关垂直跳之观念与技术指导，而这些都是现今10岁儿童在4年前无法学到的新知识、技术指导与练习方式，这就叫做世代问题。
en: Asked another way, Are the environmental circumstances that affect jumping performance for 6-year-olds the same today as when the 10-year-olds were 6, or have physical education programs improved over this 4-year span so that 6-year-olds receive more instruction and practice in jumping than the 10-year-olds did when they were 6?

zh: 发展初步假设与进行粗略检定，通常使用横断性研究设计(cross-sectionaldesign)与生态性研究(ecologicalstudy)等简单的描述性研究 (descriptive studies)。
en: Initial hypotheses are developed and crudely tested using simple descriptive studies that use cross-sectional and ecological study designs.

zh: 更为精细的研究设计则进一步运用于研究(analytical studies)，以 验证特定的研究假设。
en: More refined study designs can then be used to test specific hypotheses in analytical studies.

zh: 分析性研究使用个案对EfS(case-control)与世代 (cohort)研究等设计，且死亡率或疾病发生率通常是其研究的依变项。
en: Analytical studies use case-control and cohort study designs, and mortality or disease incidence is often the dependent variable for the investigations.

zh: 上述两种研究设计作为流行病学研究的重要工具，在过去50年被广泛使用，并累积坚实的研究证据支持这些方法。
en: These two designs, the workhorses of epidemiological research, have been used for the last 50 years, and a solid body of evidence has been amassed to support their basic methods.

zh: 如果曾经有一个运动员是时间的奴隶，那他就是芬兰伟大的跑步选手帕沃•鲁米。
en: If ever there was an athlete who was a slave to time, it was the great Finnish runner Paavo Nurmi.

zh: 鲁米的成就，包括了25项世界纪录和9枚奥运会金牌（从1500m到20000m项目），这些成就让一些人认为他是历史上最伟大的长跑运动员。
en: Nurmi’s achievements, which included 25 world records and 9 Olympic gold medals (in distances from 1,500 to 20,000 meters), have caused some to consider him the greatest distance runner in history.

zh: 他也是唯一一个以名字命名小行星的跑步运动员。
en: He’s also the only runner to ever have an asteroid named after him.

zh: 鲁米的比赛理念是集中精力在时钟上。
en: Nurmi’s philosophy during racing was to focus entirely on the clock.

zh: 运动员可能需要经历系统的脱敏阶段，从消除单纯的焦虑过渡到消除专项运动复杂焦虑，这在一定程度上保证运动员能够随着生物学上的愈合与机体康复在心理上对重返赛场做好准备。
en: An athlete may follow a system of desensitization hierarchies from simpler through more difficult anxieites that are sport-specific, at a rate that ensures that the athlete will be psychologically ready to return to sport by the time of completion of biological healing and physical rehabilitation.

zh: 心理、愈合与康复这三项进程需要协调进展，同时为重返赛场做好准备。
en: The three processes should be coordinated so that emotions, healing and rehabilitation are all prepared for return to activity at approximately the same time.

zh: 运动员应在放松状态下通过脱敏阶段，想象每一步骤的成功完成，以视觉化的方式进行康复。
en: The athlete proceeds by means of visualization through the desensitization hierarchy, imagining successful completion of each step while remaining in a relaxed state.

zh: 有视力损害的运动员要佩戴合适的护目镜，这一点非常重要。
en: It is critical that athletes with visual impairment use appropriate protective eyewear.

zh: 过去对功能性单眼的认定有些武断。
en: In the past, the definition of the functionally one-eyed ahtlete has been somewhat arbitrary.

zh: 在美国，多数州不会将驾驶执照颁发给矫正视力低于20/50的人。
en: Most States in the USA will not issue a driver's lisence to anyone with a corrected visual acuity that is worse than 20/50.

zh: 因此，单眼最佳矫正视力低于20/50也被认为是功能性单眼。
en: Therefore, anyone with best corrected vision in one eye that is worse than 20/50 should be considered functionally one-eyed.

zh: 如果你留意一下眼睛的生理构造，你就会发现一些人类与动物之间最主要的区别。
en: If you look at the revolutionary anatomy of eyes, you'll notice some major differences between humans and animals.

zh: 比如说，人类的两只眼晴比其他许多动物的眼睛都靠得更近些，这使我们有极佳的视角深入地观察。
en: For one, huamns have their eyes set closer together tham many other animals, which gives us wonderful depth perception.

zh: 而我们换来的是一些重要的外围视线的丧失，这些外围视线能够保护动物，比如牛，就是如此。
en: In exchange, we lose some of the great peripheral vision that protects cows.

zh: 从某种程度上说，这使人类成为一种视线缺损的物种，因为我们拥有的是双视线。
en: In a way, that makes us a species with blinders on—because we have binocular vision.

zh: 试题反应理论则建立在比古典测验理论更强的假设下。
en: IRT is based on stronger assumptions than CTT is.

zh: 两个主要的假设分别是单向度(unidimensionality) 与局部独立性 (local independence) 。
en: The two major assumptions are unidimensionality and local independence.

zh: 单向度表示只有单一能力或特 质被测量。
en: Unidimensionality means that a single ability or trait is being measured.

zh: 这个能力无法被直接测量,因此试题反应理论有时又称为潜在特质理论(latem trait theory) 。
en: This ability is not directly measurable, so IRT is sometimes referred to as latent trait theory.

zh: 在古典测验理论中,项目难度是以全体回答的结果来测量。
en: In CTT, item difficulty is measured as a function of the total group.

zh: 而在试题反应理论中,项目难度是固定的,而且可以由对应的受试者能力水准来评量。
en: In IRT, item difficulty is fixed and can be assessed relative to an examinee’s ability level.

zh: 因此 ,特定能力的受试者能正确回答一个题目的机率,便可以数学的方式被描绘成一条试题特征曲线(item characteristic curve, Iconvict conditioning )。
en: Thus, the probability that an examinee with a particular ability level will make a correct response to an item can be mathematically described by an item characteristic curve (Iconvict conditioning).

zh: 对个别题目而言,试题特徵曲线是一条由左向右渐增的非线性迴归曲线,表示答对的机率随著能力或是潜在特质的提高而增加。
en: The Iconvict conditioning is a nonlinear regression for any item that increases from left to right, indicating an increase in the probability of a correct response with increased ability, or latent trait.

zh: 患有更为复杂的心律失常的患者，包括心房扑动和心房颠动，交界区心动过速，室性心动过速（ventricular tachycardia)或多源性室性心律失常,在允许参加运动之前，必须到心脏病科进行检查和接受必要的治疗。
en: Individuals who experience more complex dysrhythmias, including atrial flutter and fibrillation, junctional tachycardia, ventricular tachycardia or multifocal ventricular dysrhythmias, should be referred to a cardiologist for evaluation, and possible treatment, before athletic participation is allowed.

zh: 心律失常可能与结构性先天性心脏缺损有关联。
en: Dysrhythmias may be associated with structural congenital heart defects.

zh: 这些患者在允许参加运动之前，必须得到心脏病科医生的检查和治疗。
en: These individuals should be under the care of a cardiologist before physical activity is allowed.

zh: 一种比较复杂的心律失常是室性早搏(premature ventricular contraction, PVC)。
en: A more complex dysrhythmia results from premature ventricular contraction (PVC).

zh: 室性早搏是心室内的一个兴奋灶引发的一次提早的搏动。
en: In this situation, a focus in the ventricle initiates a premature contraction by the ventricle.

zh: 在听诊时，心律不规则，在不规则心跳之后出现一个“代偿间歇”。
en: On auscultation, the rhythm is irregular and is followed by a 'compensatory pause'.

zh: 在长代偿间歇前的心跳常常是很有力的，患者会感觉到漏掉了一次心跳。
en: The beat following the compensatory pause is often more forceful and is perceived by the individual as a skipped beat.

zh: 末经过巴氏灭菌的酸奶里含有嗜酸性乳酸菌。这种有益健康的细菌把牛奶变成酸奶，并去除与真菌相关的感染。
en: Yogurt that hasn't been pasteurized contains Lactobacillus acidophilus—a healthy bacteria that turns milk into yogurt and fights off fungus-related infections.

zh: 或者你可以以补充剂形式每天分两次服用20毫克的嗜酸菌，它能帮你防止真菌在你体内的过多增长。
en: Or you can take acidophilus in supplement form of 20 milligrams twice daily.It works by helping to prevent the overgrowth of fungi that shouldn't be able to grow in your body.

zh: 从事青年体育教育和运动训练的工作者一定会熟悉下面的现象：男孩A是13.5岁，身高171 cm,体重60 kg，上臂拉力65 kg；而男孩B也是13.5岁，身高150 cm，体重40 kg,上臂拉力只有32 kg。
en: Those engaged in education or coaching of youths are certainly familiar with the following scenario: boy A who is 13.5 years old, has a stature of 171 cm, weight 60kg and a static strength score of 65 kg on an arm pull test, while boy B who is also 13.5 years old, has a stature of 150 cm, weight 40 kg and a strength score of 32 kg.

zh: 但是通常总是要求日历年龄相同的男孩在一起进行各种各样的集体和个人运动项目比赛以及接受同样的身体素质测试。
改1：从事青年体育教育和运动训练的工作者一定会熟悉下面的现象：男孩A是13.5岁，身高171 cm,体重60 kg，手臂拉力65 kg；而男孩B也是13.5岁，身高150 cm，体重40 kg,手臂拉力只有32 kg。
但是通常总是要求日历年龄相同的男孩在一起进行各种各样的集体和个人运动项目比赛以及接受同样的身体素质测试。
en: These boys of exactly the same CA are often required to compete against each other in a variety of team and individual sports, and often on fitness tests.

zh: 此外，许多性专科医生认为手淫对健康有益，比 如，手淫可以缓解紧张。
en: In addition, many sex therapists believe that masturbation can improve your health—by relieving stress, for instance.

zh: 但是，专家们警告说，手淫绝不能代替与伴侣的性爱。
en: What they do warn, though, is that masturbation should never be a substitute for sexual activity with your partner.

zh: 另一方面，没有确切证据能表明手淫对前列腺肥大作用是正是负。
en: On the other hand, there's no dear evidence showing a beneficial or harmful effect of masturbation on benign prostatic hyperplasia.

zh: 发达国家的人均寿命的大幅上升——在美国，平均寿命由19世纪中叶的40岁增加了一倍，达到现在的大约80岁——完全是因为继发性衰老的延迟。
en: The progressive rise in longevity in developed nations—doubling in the United States from an average of about 40 years in the mid-1800s to around 80 years at present—is due entirely to a delay in secondary aging.

zh: 明显的原因是，在过去的150年，健康护理、医疗系统和设备，以及营养方面得到了的巨大改善。
en: The obvious explanation is the dramatic improvements in health care, sanitation, and nutrition that have occurred over the past 150 years.

zh: 然而， 原发性衰老的过程并未随着时间而改变。
en: It is probable, however, that the natural course of primary aging in human beings has not changed over time.

zh: 我们将在随后的部分讨论这个话题。
en: We’ll discuss this a bit more later.

zh: 体操动作会自然地利用关节，从而使关节与肌肉协调发展。
en: The authentic movements offered by calisthenics apply the power of the joints naturally, as they evolved to be used.

zh: 久而久之，你的关节就会更加强劲有力，而不会饱受折磨、越来越弱。
en: The result is that they develop in proportion to the muscular system, becoming more powerful over time rather than weaker and worn down.

zh: 随着你的关节组织逐步修复，原来的老伤旧痛会一扫而去，以后你也就不会轻易受伤了。
en: As the joint tissue rebuilds itself, former aches and pains are worked out of the system, and future injuries are avoided.

zh: 手术会切除掉部分阻碍气管的组织，帮助患者提高呼吸质量，治愈睡眠呼吸暂停综合征。另外有助瘦身的手术（即缩小胃部手术）也很有效，它可以治愈严重的睡眠呼吸暂停综合征。
en: Surgery removes some of the obstructing tissue, which helps you breathe better and cure the apnea, and procedures that help you lose weight (that is, gastric bypass surgery) are also effective and can help some people who have severe sleep apnea.

zh: 不过，你自己就可以给呼吸状况带来最大程度的改善。
en: But the biggest change can come from you.

zh: 体重只要减轻4.5公斤，呼吸暂停的频度就可以减少30%，而体重增加4.5公斤结果就正相反。由此可知，瘦身比手术还有效。
en: Losing just ten pounds can decrease your episodes of sleep apnea by 30 percent, while gaining ten pounds does the reverse —making weight loss even more effective than surgery.

zh: 消化系统有两种激素分别控制饥饿感和食欲。
en: Your digestive system has two main hormones that control hunger and appetite.

zh: 饥饿激素由胃部分泌，能够增强食欲。
en: Ghrelin is secreted by the stomach and increases your appetite.

zh: 胃部变空，就会把饥饿激素派出去索要食物。
en: When your stomach's empty, it sends ghrelin out requesting food.

zh: 瘦素则会告诉大脑饱了。当人进食的时候，脂肪细胞会分泌瘦素，让人停止进食。
en: Leptin tells your brain that you're full When you eat, your fat cells secrete it so that you stop eating.

zh: 这些物质对免疫系统是有益处的，它们同时也有利于防止白内障的发生。
en: There've been shown to be helpful for your immune system, but they're also helpful for protecting against cataracts.

zh: 翻翻第10章看一看那些列出的含有非凡 功用的类黄酮的食物。
en: See Chapter 10 for a list of the foods that contain powerful flavonoids.

zh: 许多水果和蔬菜中含有维生素C和生物类黄酮。有证据证明丰富的食谱内只需每天含有四份水果，就会使你的生理年龄年轻4岁之多。
en: Many fruits and vegetables contain C and bioflavonoids, and there's evidence that eating a diverse diet that includes just four servings of fruits a day can make your REAL AGE as much as four years younger.

zh: 衰老的种类在讨论衰老这个话题之前，应该让聪明的读者了解一些重要的概念和注意事项。
en: Categories of agingBefore launching into our topic, the discerning reader should be aware of certain important concepts and cautions.

zh: 首先，应该意识到存在两种衰老的类型。
en: To start with, it should be recognized that two kinds of aging exist.

zh: 原发性衰老是一种人类组织固有的过程，不受疾病和环境因素支配，在这个过程中，细胞的完整性和功能会随着时间而衰退，最终通向死亡。
en: Primary aging is an intrinsic process of all human tissues, independent of disease and environmental factors, in which progressive deterioration of cellular integrity and function over time eventually leads to death.

zh: 一个特别有趣的观察似乎包含了许多衰老机制的理论。
en: One particularly intriguing observation seems to reside over many of the theories about the mechanism of aging.

zh: 本书的引言简短地提到了这一点：动物静息时的新陈代谢率与他们的身体大小和寿命呈负相关。
en: The introduction to this book mentions this briefly: The resting metabolic rate of animals is inversely related to both their body size and their life span.

zh: 小动物每千克体重有着一个更髙的新陈代谢率，并且相比于大的动物，其寿命更短。
en: Smaller animals have a higher metabolic rate per kilogram of body mass and a shorter life span than larger ones.

zh: 这种爆发式引体向上可以锻炼你的背部和肱二头肌，之后向下压动作的过渡过程能够很好地锻炼你的肘部、腕部及前臂，最后的下压部分中，锻炼的肌肉与屈臂撑所锻炼的相同，主要是肱三头肌、胸肌和背阔肌。
en: The explosive pullup works the back and biceps, and the circular transitional movement into a downwards press position very powerfully trains the elbows, wrists and forearms.The final part of the technique, the downwards press, works the same muscles as dips; triceps, pectorals and lats, mainly.

zh: 一旦你的手臂已经完全伸直，就落下来并重复以上动作。
en: Drop back down and repeat the exercise once your arms are straight.

zh: 刚开始练习的时候，你主要是靠跳起来的惯性完成动作转换，但随着你不断变强，对跳跃的依赖就会越来越少。
en: In the early days, you’ll find yourself jumping hard to achieve the transition, but you’ll do this less and less as you get stronger.

zh: 有些人称之为双力臂动作。
en: In some circles, this exercise is called the muscle-up.

zh: 我是在圣昆汀学到这个动作的，那儿的囚徒们将其称之为“哨兵引体向上”，但我在其他地方从没听过这样的称呼。
en: In San Quentin, where I first learned this technique, the convicts called them “sentry pullups,” although I’ve never heard the name anywhere else.

zh: 赛后应提供液体来补充水分，用复合碳水化合物来促进糖原储备的恢复。
en: After exercise, fluids should be offered to promote hydration and complex carbohydrates encouraged to replenish glycogen stores.

zh: 一些家长不适当地向自己的孩子提供食品来奖 励他们的好成绩。
en: Some parents may inappropriately use food as a bribe to encourage a winning performance.

zh: 必须告诫家长不能采用特殊的待遇来奖励出色的儿童，至少应该有所克制。
en: Parents should be advised that special treats should not be used to reward a child that does well and withheld if not.

zh: 儿童无论是否成功完成比赛，都与赛后用餐无关。
en: Whether the child competed successfully or not should have no bearing upon post-exercise intake.

zh: 水平俯卧撑其实并不是真正意义上的俯卧撑。
en: The plank is not really a pushup.

zh: 它是生活在第二个黄金时代的大力士所钟爱的静力绝技之一，而且它的历史可以追溯到更早的时候。
en: It’s a static feat of strength that was a favorite amongst the strongmen of the second Golden Age, although it stretches back much further than that.

zh: 那时的人喜欢这本亏趁是因为：水平俯卧撑对身体素质有很高的要求，不但每一块肌肉都有要强劲有力，而且还要有较高的平衡能力与协调能力。
en: The old-timers loved this exercise, and not without reason—the plank requires strength in almost every single muscle of the body, as well as balance and coordination.

zh: 此外，这也是个很酷的聚会特技。
en: Besides which, it makes for a cool party trick.

zh: 双手撑地，与肩同宽，双臂弯曲，肘部内收，贴在身体两侧，然后身体前倾，直到双脚离地，双腿镇定。
en: Place your palms on the floor shoulder width apart, bend your arms, tucking your elbows into your torso, and lean forwards until your feet are off the ground with the legs locked.

zh: 在生长过程中出现的过度使用损伤通常被称为过度生长损伤。
en: Injuries incurred as a result of the growth process have been referred to as overgrowth injuries.

zh: 1/3的用力性损伤是生长障碍或骨软骨病。
en: One-third of the so-called exertion injuries were growth disturbances or osteochondroses (Orava & Puranen, 1978).

zh: 患骨软骨病的儿童，如奥-施氏病（胚骨粗隆骨软骨病）、朔伊尔曼氏病（脊柱骨软骨病）、潘纳尔氏病（青年畸形性跖趾骨软骨炎）、股骨头骨骺骨软骨病，可能会因为不同原因就诊。
en: Children with osteochondroses, e.g.Osgood-Schlatter disease, Scheuermann's disease, Partner's disease and Legg-Calvé—Perthes disease, may have different reasons for seeking health care.

zh: 你曾经听说过拥有第六感官的事儿，但是你也许拥有第三只眼睛。
en: You've heard of having a sixth sense, but you also may have a third eye.

zh: 东方神话有时在人的额头中间描出第三只眼睛。
en: Eastern religions sometimes portray people with an eye in the middle of their forehead.

zh: 亊实上，它与你的大脑的松果体处于同一位置。
en: Turns out, that's located in about the same spot as the pineal gland in your brain.

zh: 素食者是很长时间不吃肉的一类人，他们再吃肉时会产生排斥。
en: Vegetarians who haven't eaten meat in a long time don't like it if they try it again.

zh: 这是因为从他们的唾液腺到胃腺和小肠腺，都 不再分泌与消化肉类相对应的一系列酶，人体无法顺利消化肉食。
en: That's because they don't secerte the right mix of enzymes from the salivary galnds to the stomach's digestive enzymes and small intestine to optimally digest meat.

zh: 素食者吃肉时，身体就会发生一种反应：肉食感觉很重，无法正常消化，因此感觉不舒服，对肉产生排斥。
en: That triggers a reaction when you do eat it: it feels heavy, you don't digest it as well, so you don't feel good and you don't enjoy it.

zh: 糖尿病不是一个病，而是有多种 同原因的一个综合征。
en: Diabetes mellitus is not a disease, but a syndrome with a number of different causes.

zh: 高血糖症和糖尿是临床上的特点。
en: Clinically, it is characterized by hyperglycaemia and glycosuria.

zh: 如果不经过治疗，会发展为酸中毒和酮中毒（酮症），脱水， 昏迷和死亡。
en: If untreated, it may progress to acidosis and ketosis, dehydration, coma and death.

zh: 少年糖尿病是胰腺P-细胞内源性胰岛素供应不足引起的，所以要用胰岛素进行治疗。
en: Diabetes of juvenile onset is usually due to a deficiency in the endogenous supply of insulin by the pancreatic (3-cells and should therefore be treated by the administration of insulin.

zh: 胰岛素依赖型糖尿病(insulin -dependent diabetes mellitus，HDDM)现在称为i型糖尿病。
en: Insulin-dependent diabetes mellitus (IDDM) is now called type I diabetes.

zh: p-细胞的完全衰竭要经过数年的时间。
en: Total exhaustion of the (3-cells, however, may take several years.

zh: 手术会切除掉部分阻碍气管的组织，帮助患者提高呼吸质量，治愈睡眠呼吸暂停综合征。另外有助瘦身的手术（即缩小胃部手术）也很有效，它可以治愈严重的睡眠呼吸暂停综合征。
en: Surgery removes some of the obstructing tissue, which helps you breathe better and cure the apnea, and procedures that help you lose weight (that is, gastric bypass surgery) are also effective and can help some people who have severe sleep apnea.

zh: 不过，你自己就可以给呼吸状况带来最大程度的改善。
en: But the biggest change can come from you.

zh: 体重只要减轻4.5公斤，呼吸暂停的频度就可以减少30%，而体重增加4.5公斤结果就正相反。由此可知，瘦身比手术还有效。
en: Losing just ten pounds can decrease your episodes of sleep apnea by 30 percent, while gaining ten pounds does the reverse —making weight loss even more effective than surgery.

zh: 特定的一些物质，如尼古丁，会释放多巴胺，那是一种引起愉悦感的化学物质，让人体想要更多的尼古丁。由此引发的习惯性行为会让多巴胺源源不断地注入人体系统中。
en: Certain substances like nicotine release dopamine, the pleasure chemical, and your body craves more of it—which leads to a habitual behavior to keep pumping dopamine into your system.

zh: 并非所有的成瘾现象都是由多巴胺引起的，但是这也在一定程度上说明，像碳水化合物之类的物质也可能具有成瘾性。
en: Not all addictions are caused by dopamine, but it may give some insight into the theory that such things like carbohydrates can be addictive.

zh: 与成年人相比，极限运动时儿童的血乳酸和肌肉乳酸水平无法达到很高水平（Astrand, 1952; Eriksson et al.，1971; Eriksson, 1980)。
en: Children are not able to attain high blood and muscle lactate concentrations during maximal exercise, compared to adults (Astrand, 1952; Eriksson et al., 1971; Eriksson, 1980).

zh: 但是，在生长过程中，最大的血乳酸水平随着年龄的增长而增高 (Astrand, 1952; Eriksson et al., 1971; Eriksson, 1980)。
en: However, maximal blood lactate concentration increases with age during growth (Astrand, 1952; Eriksson et al., 1971, 1973; Eriksson, 1980).

zh: 在次极限运动时，儿童和青少年肌肉乳酸水平比成年人低（Astmnd, 1952; Bar-Or, 1983; Moritani et al., 1989)。
en: Muscle lactate concentration during submaximal exercise is also lower in children and adolescents, compared to adults (Astrand, 19 52; Bar-Or, 1983; Moritani et al., 1989).

zh: 上述研究表明，正在生长中的个体与成年人相比，无论在有氧运动还是在无氧运动中都较少依赖糖原酵解生成乳酸这一代谢途径来补充ATP。
en: These observations suggest that growing individuals rely less than adults on the glycogen to lactate metabolic pathway to replenish ATP during both aerobic and anaerobic exercise.

zh: 在史前时期，当早期人类想增强并展示自己的身体能力时，他们会利用自己对身体的控制力。他们会将身体向上拉起、屈膝跳跃，还会借助手臂的力量把身体推离地面。
en: Ever since prehistory, when the first men wished to develop and display their power they did so by demonstrating their control over their body; lifting the body up, bending the knees and jumping, and pressing the body away from the surface of the earth using the strength of the limbs.

zh: 这些动作最终演化成了体操的基本动作。
en: These actions eventually evolved into what we would recognize today as the art of calisthenics.

zh: 对食物中B12的吸收需要一种来自胃部的物质，称为体内自带物质。随着年龄的增长，这种物质的产量会减少。
en: Absorption of Bl2 in food requires a substance from our stomachs called intrinsic factor, the production of which decreases with age.

zh: （美国医 学院推测70岁后，就没有人有体内带这种物质了。
en: (The American College of Physicians assumes that no one has intrinsic factor over age seventy.)

zh: ）因此，我们要么可以通过注射让B12进入体内，要么以服用晶体药片的形式。（除非你身上的针孔比瘾君子还多，再多扎些也无所谓，否则我们还是建议你优先考虑服药。）
en: So you can either get Bl2 into your body through a shot or a crystalline pill form (unless you have more body piercings than a punk rocker, we assume you'd prefer the crystalline pill).

zh: 体温调节功能（thermoregulation)可以受到各种环境条件、身体和生理状态的影响。
en: Thermoregulation may be affected by the environmental conditions, and the physical and physiological state of the body.

zh: 影响体温调节功能的环境条件有周围环境的温度、空气湿度和风速。
en: The environmental conditions that affect thermoregulation are ambient temperature, air humidity and wind velocity.

zh: 影响体温调节功能的身体因素包括体格的大小，身体成分以及身体表面面积与体重的比例。
en: Physical factors affecting thermoregulation include body size, composition and body surface area to mass ratio.

zh: 本章概要介绍儿童与成人之间在体温调节方面的差异，并且尽可能介绍青少年时期在酷热和寒冷中运动的生理反应的变化情况。
en: This chapter outlines the differences in thermoregulation between children and adults and the possible changes which occur during adolescence in the physiological response to exercise in the heat and in the cold.

zh: 为了帮助早期诊断，我们将介绍各种热和冷环境引起的疾病的早期体征和症状。
en: The early signs and symptoms of various heat and cold disorders are described to facilitate their early  identification.

zh: 最后，讨论体温过高 (hyperthermia)和体温过低（hypothermia) 对身体的损害及其预防措施。
en: Finally, the adverse effects of hyperthermia and hypothermia and their prevention are discussed.

zh: 这就是说，孩子们随着长大而变得更加强壮，这主要是因为肌肉体积增大；有氧耐力和运动节省化（exercise economy)的提髙主要是由于腿长和步频的增加。
en: That is, children become stronger as they grow, mainly because of muscle enlargement.Improvements in aerobic endurance fitness and exercise economy happen mainly due to increases in leg length and stride frequency.

zh: 与年龄相关的VO2max的增加，则与更大的心室可以产生更大的心输出量有关。
en: Age-related increases in VO2max parallel the larger stroke volumes of bigger heart ventricles.

zh: 此外，在这个年龄组中，运动表现和体质随着时间的提髙，通常反映了激素的活动，这些激素的作用是促进身体生长。
en: In this age group, then, increases in performance and markers of physiological fitness over time generally reflect the action of hormonal agents that are responsible for promoting body growth.

zh: 最好，以重量表示的体重应该采用经过正确校正的杠杆式体重计来称重并记录到0.1kg的精度。
en: Ideally, body mass expressed in units of weight should be obtained on an accurately calibrated beam-type balance and recorded to the nearest 0.1 kg.

zh: 受试者必须裸体称重或者穿着已知重量的服装（这样可以计算出裸体的重量)。
en: The subject should be weighed nude or in clothing of known weight so a correction to nude weight can be made.

zh: 在早晨常规测定的称重值是监测体重变化最稳定的数值，这时的体重是经过12小时消化和排泄后的体重。
en: The most stable values for monitoring weight change are those obtained routinely in the morning, 12 h after having ingested food, and after voiding.

zh: 可是，这种严格的控制对于监测生长通常是没有必要的。
en: However, such exact control is not generally necessary for growth records.

zh: 在大多数情况下，校正过的弹簧称测量到0.5kg的精度已能满足要求。
en: For most purposes, a calibrated spring scale with measurement made to the nearest 0.5 kg is satisfactory.

zh: 虽然在技术上体重指数（body mass index, BMI)不能归类为身体成分测量，但是它在临床和流行病学方面在成年人中得到了广泛的应用。
en: While BMI cannot be technically classified as a body composition measurement, it has received widespread use with adults in clinical and epidemiological assessments.

zh: 体重指数只需要测量身髙和体重。
en: BMI only requires measurement of height and body weight.

zh: 它的定义就是体重/身髙的平方，以kg / m2表示。
en: It is defined as body weight/height2 and expressed as kg/m2.

zh: 体重计。
en: Weighing machine.

zh: 传统上体重计是平衡杠式的，以1kg和1/10kg为单位。
en: Classically, the weighing machine was a balance beam scale calibrated in kilograms and tenths of kilograms.

zh: 全世界有各种各样品名的体重计。
en: These are to be found under different brand names throughout the world.

zh: 其中最好的是可以校准的体重计。
en: The best of them provide for calibration adjustments.

zh: 近年来，已经被数字体重计所取代。
en: In recent years, these have given way to digital scales.

zh: 大多数是弹簧式体重计并转换成电子数字读数。
en: Most of these are converted spring-type scales with electronics to convert a digital read out.

zh: 他们不比浴室用的体重计精确。
en: They are no more accurate than an ordinary bathroom scale.

zh: 毫无疑问，古人使用了许多不同体系的体操来锻炼身体。
en: There were doubtless many different systems of calisthenics training used by the ancients.

zh: 不过，从留存至今的文字与图 像中我们所能了解的是，那些极富传奇色彩的战士和运动员使用的自身体重训练法与今天广 为人们熟知的“体操”几乎没有一点儿相似之处—远不是一种软绵绵的有氧训练。
en: What we do know from the surviving descriptions and images was that the bodyweight training performed by these legendary warriors and athletes bore little resemblance to what is known as “calisthenics” today.

zh: 而更像是 力量训练·事实上，他们的锻炼方法的确更适用于增强力量和爆发力。
en: Rather than being a relatively soft form of aerobic training, their systems would have looked more like gymnastics, and would definitely have been geared more solidly to the progressive development or power and strength.

zh: 尽管吸烟的危害远远超过这种体重增加的危险，在戒烟期间，我们还是能防止体重增加的。
en: Though the dangers of smoking far outweigh the dangers of this additional weight, you can prevent weight gain during the quitting process.

zh: 散步就能起到这样的作用。
en: Walking will help.

zh: 无糖口香糖也会舒缓口腔对食物的渴望。
en: Chewing sugarless gum will ease oral cravings.

zh: 在手腕上缠一圈橡皮筋，这样你的手指就有事可做了，而不会习惯性地想夹起一根香烟。
en: Put a rubber band around your wrist so you have something to do with your fingers besides pick up baby back ribs.

zh: 饮食主要是低脂肪的，比如水果、蔬菜和不含黄油的爆米花，还可以吃一些含有少量健康脂肪的小吃，比如水果核桃拼盘。
en: Concentrate on low-fat snacks, like fruits, vegetables, and unbuttered popcorn, with a few healthy-fat snacks like six walnuts with the fruit.

zh: 布里尔等（Brill et al., 1989)研究了 参加高中或大学竞技运动队的345名25~ 60岁的男子。
en: Brill et al. (1989) studied 345 men aged 25—60 years who had participated in competitive sports teams in high school or college.

zh: 当与75名非运动员对照组比较时，原运动员在成年期的经常体力活动的水平是没有差别的。
en: Level of regular physical activity during adult years was not different in the former athletes when compared to 75 non-athlete control subjects.

zh: 两组之间的大多数冠心病的危险因素（体重指数，血清脂质状况和血压）类似的。
en: Most coronary risk factors (body mass index, serum lipid profile and blood pressure) were similar in the two groups.

zh: 原运动员的吸烟者较多（22%)，但是跑台耐力运动的时间长于非运动员。
en: Prevalence of smoking was greater in the ex-athletes (22%), who had longer treadmill endurance times than the non-athletes.

zh: 3次跳跃的最大值或平均值作为试验的得分。
en: The best or the average value of three jumps is generally taken as the test score.

zh: 纵跳被认为是腿部功率的有效指标。从萨金特试验演化出各种各样的纵跳方案，如跳起-手触墙试验，阿巴拉科夫试验（Abalakow test;见Kirby, 1991的综述）。
en: The vertical jump has been accepted as a valid measure of leg power and various vertical jump protocols have been derived from the Sargent test (e.g.jump-and-reach test, the Abalakow test) (for review see Kirby, 1991).

zh: 打造自己的家庭健身房只需要一个壶铃、一副跳绳和一个安装引体向上单杠的地方。
en: You can start building your home gym with just a kettlebell, a jump rope, and a place to install a pull-up bar.

zh: 这些器械只能满足进行身体自重的CFE训练。
en: This will suffice for the many CFE workouts that use body weight only.

zh: 然而某些时候,你也希望做一些自由力量的练习。
en: At some point, however, you will want free weights.

zh: 虽然你可以在健身中心或者商业健身房进行CrossFit训练,但是这些地方普遍没有高弹片(奥林匹克举重的必需品——进行更大重量的举重时,扔扛铃是很普遍的动作)。
en: Although it is possible to do CrossFit workouts at fitness centers and commercial gyms, they generally don’t have bumper plates (a necessity with Olympic lifts—dropping the barbells is routine when youpursue heavier lifts).

zh: 20世纪30年代，乔在圣路易斯与“铁臂阿童木”（The Mighty Atom）共同锻炼。
en: In St. Louis in the 1930s, Joe worked out with The Mighty Atom, one of the most famous strongmen of all time.

zh: “铁臂阿童木”是有史以来最著名的大力士之一，身高只有163厘米，体重约64千克。
en: Standing at just 5’4” and weighing 140 lbs.

zh: “铁臂阿童木”是一个奇迹，他的日常表演会令众多的现代健美者哭着去找妈妈。
en: , The Atom was a phenomenon.He performed feats on a daily basis that would make modern bodybuilders cry for their mommies.

zh: 他能挣脱铁索、徒手把大钉子钉进松木板里，还能把小钉子咬成两半。
en: He broke out of chains, drove spikes into pine planks with his palms, and bit penny nails clean in half.

zh: 声波进入耳朵，振动鼓膜和三个相连的小骨。
en: The sound waves entering the ear vibrate both the eardrum and three attached small bones.

zh: 最后一根小骨将过滤后的声波传至耳蜗管。听觉神经会在此将信息转化成电流脉冲传达到大脑。
en: The last bone passes a filtered sound wave into the cochlear duct, where hair cells and your acoustic nerve convert the information to electrical impulses for the brain.

zh: 内耳的半规管有回转仪的作用，使我们保持平衡。
en: The semicircular conals work like a gyroscope to keep us balanced.

zh: 对于很少接触力量和体能训练的传统跑者,他们很难想象将过顶深蹲、跳箱和挺举融入到自己的训练中。
en: For the traditional runner who has had minimal exposure to strength and conditioning work, it may be hard to imagine adding exercises such as overhead squats, box jumps, and clean and jerks to your workout regimen.

zh: 这些器材或训练思路对他们来说似乎是颠覆性的。
en: Maybe the equipment or logistics seems overwhelming.

zh: 但事实并不是这样。
en: Not the case.

zh: 结合CrossFit训练— 不 论是在CrossFit健身房或在自己家,比你想象的更容易。
en: Adding CrossFit workouts to your program—whether in a CrossFit gym or in your own home—is easier than you think.

zh: 同时效度(concurrent validity)是指在相近的时间内，执行的测量结果与效标结果之相关的一种效标效度(同时)。
en: Concurrent validity is a type of criterion validity that involves correlating an instrument with some criterion that is administered at about the same time (i.e., concurrently).

zh: 许多动作表现测量的分数都用此方法来佐证效度。
en: The scores from many physical performance measures are validated in this manner.

zh: 常用的效标包括已经被证实有效度或广为接受的测量方式，例如评分者评量与实验室技术。
en: Popular criterion measures include already validated or accepted measures, such as judges’ ratings and laboratory techniques.

zh: 同时效度也经常用于研究者想以较为简短或较易操作的测验，来替代某个操作困难的效标。
en: Concurrent validity is usually employed when the researcher wishes to substitute a shorter, more easily administered test for a criterion that is difficult to measure.

zh: 近几年，多方试图解决关于文献回顾的问题已被提出。
en: In recent years, several attempts have been made to solve the problems associated with literature reviews.

zh: 最值得注意的是Glass ( 19 7 6 )文章里所做的诸多尝试，以及后续Glass、McGaw、与Smith ( 1981 ) 书中所提及称作统合分析( meta-analysis) 的一个技巧。
en: The most notable of these attempts was made in a paper by Glass (1976) and followed up with abookby Glass, McGaw, and Smith (1981), in which they proposed a technique called meta-analysis.

zh: 这个章节主要的目的即是用以呈现统合分析概要，以及已建立用来使用在统合分析的程序步骤（对于一般性研究整合的做法，请参见Cooper & Hedges, 1994) 。
en: The major purpose of this chapter is to present an overview of meta-analysis and the procedures developed for use in meta-analysis (for a more general approach to research synthesis, see Cooper & Hedges, 1994).

zh: 癌细胞是由于基因细微的突变而引起的。这些基因忙着复制细胞以应付一天的活动。
en: Cancer is all about subtle mutations in your genes that are busy reproducing cells for the day s activities.

zh: 这种神奇的机器在你需要更多的细胞的时候，会像加速器一样运转，当你需要慢下来时又能像抑制器一样发挥作用。它偶犯会丢失一段基因。
en: This spectacular machinery, complete with accelerators for when you need more cells and inhibitors for when you need to slow down, occasionally loses a piece of a gene.

zh: 这些基因大多数是不重要的，而且没人会注意到。
en: Most are unimportant and no one notices.

zh: 接着你正常细胞中的物质就会产生一种免疫系统无法识别并且无法对其做出反应的基因突变。
en: Then something in your normally functioning cell creates a genetic mutation that your immune system doesn't recognize and isn't able to react to.

zh: 孩童时，我看到迪克·布特库斯（Dick·Butkus）在接受采访时说，高中时推一辆两吨重的汽车帮他练就了橄榄球比赛中不可思议的爆发力。从那时起，我就开始向往推汽车。
en: When I was a kid I saw a Dick Butkus interview where he talked about developing his awesome power for football by pushing a two-ton vehicle around when he was in high school.As a result, I became  obsessed with the idea of pushing cars.

zh: 这听起来好像是只有超人才能完成的事情。
en: It seemed like something only Superman could do.

zh: 只要有机会，我就会将妈妈那辆破旧的福特翼虎沿街推上一小段。
en: Whenever I got the chance, I would push my mom’s scratched up Ford Maverick a short way along the block.

zh: 我儿时的胳膊长得像意大利细面条，那时虽然只能把车往前推几米，但我感到很满足！
en: My arms were like spaghetti when I was a kid and it took forever to get a few yards, but man was it a satisfying feeling!

zh: 虽然在狱中不怎么看芝加哥熊队的比赛，但我一出狱就立刻恢复了推汽车的爱好。
en: I don’t follow the Chicago Bears much any more, but as soon as I got out of prison I quickly rediscovered my love of car pushing.

zh: 我会找一段空旷的马路或小道，关掉汽车引擎、挂上空挡——如果不挂空挡推起来会有点儿困难。
en: Find a clear stretch of road or track, turn off your engine and stick your whip into neutral (you might experience a little trouble if you keep it in gear).

zh: 然后走到车后，将手掌撑在后备箱上——不要推后挡风玻璃。
en: Get round the back of your car and put your palms on the metal of the trunk—you don’t want to be putting a load of force through a glass rear windshield just in case.

zh: 双臂几乎伸直，上身前倾，靠双腿发力推动汽车。
en: Keep your arms nearly straight and lean into the movement as much as you can.Push away with your legs.

zh: 虽然汽车动起来之后推起来会容易一点儿，但也不会好太多。
en: Once you get over the vehicle’s inertia, pushing gets a little easier.But not much.

zh: 确切地说，这些类别是根据对个人是否参加运动的现状进行研究与评估后得出的。
en: Typically, these classifications were made after the fact and assessed the individual's current status of sport involvement or non-involvement.

zh: 这些描述意味着，少年儿童要么参与运动要么退出运动，不存在第三种情况。
en: These definitions infer an all-or-nothing meaning to sport participation or withdrawal.

zh: 这些用语没有反映少年儿童退出运动这一复杂的过程。
en: What these terms fail to capture is the rather complex process that contributes to the child's withdrawal from sport.

zh: 研究人员用这些更为传统的用语就不能确认一些情况的“是”与“否”，比如说：个体对另外一项运动感兴趣还是对运动以外的活动有兴趣。
en: Researchers utilizing these more traditional definitions cannot evaluate, for example, whether or not: The individual develops an interest in another sport or an activity outside of sport.

zh: 这样一来，小肌群的工作量便会转移到它们所属的大肌群上，如腓肠肌和髋部屈肌的工作量便转移到了臀大肌和腘绳肌上。
en: This shifts the workload away from smaller muscles such as the calves and hip flexors to large muscles such as the glutes and hamstrings, where it belongs.

zh: 为了培养正确的CFE跑步技巧，麦肯齐训练的运动员需要掌握如下技能。训练快速的步频。
en: To develop proper CFE running technique, MacKenzie’s athletes work on mastering the following skills.Develop a rapid cadence.

zh: 理想的跑步步频比你习惯的步频要快很多，通常要求每分钟180次。
en: Ideal running requires a cadence that may be much quicker than you’re used to.Shoot for 180 footfalls per minute.

zh: 气味似乎是吸引异性的主导性因素之一，这个结论也许会令世界各地的时尚产品制造者和发型师大失所望。
en: Perhaps to the disappointment of fashion manufacturers and hairstylists everywhere, smell seems to be one of the dominant factors in attracting partners.

zh: 成人会释放称为外激素的化学物质，它能够分泌吸引异性的气味。
en: Adult species release chemical compounds called pheromones that secrete smells that make us attractive to others.

zh: 这是一种化学反应，而不是大脑反应，正因为此，有些人会觉得你很有吸引力，而另外一些人则会对你很排斥，而喜爱和讨厌又都没有理由。
en: It s a chemical reaction more than a cerebral one, which is why wc'rc attracted to some people and repelled by others without really knowing why.

zh: 动脉血管最外层是外膜，很像香肠的肠衣。它在外围固定着动脉血管的整体结构，像玻璃纸的外包装一样。
en: The outer layer is the adventitia, and it's like a sausage casing; it holds your artery together from the outside, within a kind of cellophane wrap.

zh: 当然，有些情况会让系统运作失常。
en: Several things, of course, can throw the works off schedule, and you can see how the process functions in Figure 2.

zh: 图2.1描绘了动脉血管的具体工作过程。
腰围。
en: Waist girth.

zh: 在腰部明显狭小的水平上的围度，大约位于肋骨下缘与髋嵴上缘之间距离的一半处。
en: Perimeter at the level of the notice­ able waist narrowing located approximately half way between the costal border and iliac crest.

zh: 对腰部不明显的受试者，腰围是在两侧肋骨下缘的水平上进行测量。
en: In subjects where the waist is not ap­ parent, an arbitrary waist measurement is made at this level about the lateral level of the 10th rib.

zh: 儿童时期体力活动的方式会影响到未来的疾病发生率。
en: Patterns of physical activity during childhood may affect the incidence and morbidity of disease later in life.

zh: 例如，弗里曼等(Freeman et al.,1990)近来研究了英国成年人冠状动脉疾病高发地区儿童的潜在危险因素。他们发现这些地区的儿童普遍缺乏体力活动。
en: For example, Freeman et al. (1990) recently studied potential risk factors among children who lived in neighbourhoods in the UK where adults had a high incidence of coronary artery disease.Lack of physical activity was more predominate in children living in the high-risk neighbourhoods.

zh: 正如莱曼斯克等人和米德尔顿所指出的，哮喘患者呼吸道的病理过程是具有钙依赖性的：“在平滑肌中兴奋-收缩的耦合，在肥大细胞和黏液腺中刺激-分泌的耦合……和炎性细胞的移动和激活（都有钙的参与）。
en: As Lemanske and Middleton point out, the pathological processes in the airways of patients with asthma are calcium-dependent: 'excitation—contraction coupling in smooth muscle, stimulus—secretion coupling in mast cells and mucous glands . . . and the movement and activation of inflammatory cells'.

zh: ”钙通道阻滞剂尼索地平和维拉帕米对阻断运动性哮喘都有效，而地尔硫卓却无效。
en: The calcium channel blockers nifedipine and verapamil have been shown to be effective in blocking EIA, while diltiazem has not.

zh: 图29.15和表29.2显示一些治疗运动性哮喘常用药物疗效的比较。
en: Fig. 29.15 and Table 29.2 show the comparative effects of some of the drags most commonly used for EIA.

zh: 这些类似维生素的物质（它们功效类似维生素，但是并非生命的必需品），已经显示出有减缓动脉和免疫力老化的功用。
en: These vitamin-like substances (they work like vitamins but aren't essential for life) have been shown to decrease the rate of arterial and immune aging.

zh: 它们似乎能使你的记忆库更久更深刻地保持对过去敌人的记忆。
en: They seem to allow your memory bank to maintain the memory of old foes longer and more intensely.

zh: 如果你的食谱里含类黄酮——大约一天31毫克的量，就可以对你的生理年龄起到重要影响。
en: If you eat a diet rich in flavonoids——about 31 milligrams of them a day——you'll have a significant effect on your Real Age.

zh: 钾能促进动脉健康（最好从食物中摄取，每日四种水果，特别是香蕉、鳄梨和瓜类）。每天补充维生素A不应超过2500国际单位（不少于）1500国际单位）。
en: Potassium promotes arterial health (get it from dietary sources: four fruis per day, especially bananas, avocados, and melon.) And avoid more than 2,500 IU of vitamin A a day (minimum is 1,500IU).

zh: 每天分两次正确补充多种维生素，会让你的生理年龄小6岁以上。
en: The correct multivitamin taken twice a day can make your Real Age more than six years younger.

zh: 许多水果和蔬菜中含有维生素C和生物类黄酮。有证据证明丰富的食谱内只需每天含有四份水果，就会使你的生理年龄年轻4岁之多。
en: Many fruits and vegetables contain C and bioflavonoids, and there's evidence that eating a diverse diet that includes just four sevings of fruit a day can make your RealAge as much as four years younger.

zh: 一个最近的研究表明对于超过50岁的人来说，一天内至少吃三份水果的人比那些只吃一份半的人更能避免患视网膜中心退化。
en: Specifically, a recent study showed that people over age fifty who ate at least three servings of fruit a day were less likely to develop macular degeneration than those who ate one and a half servings.

zh: 在某些方面，获得阳光是非常重要的。
en: In some ways, getting sun is very important.

zh: 每天晒10-20分钟的阳光能够帮助你把某种形式非活性的维生素D转化成一种维生素原，这种物质能变成活性的维生素D，这对于你的心血管和免疫系统都有很大的好处。
en: Getting ten to twenty minutes of sun exposure every day helps you convert some forms of inacitve vitamin D into a precursor that becomes active vitamin D—which has a huge beneficial effect on your cardiovascular and immune systems.

zh: 那会使你拥有年轻一岁多的生理年龄的效果。

en: And that has a RealAge effect of making you more than two years younger.

zh: 维生素D3的来源有三种：日光、食物和维生素补品。
en: You can get vitamin D3 from three sources: the sun, food, and vitamin supple-ments.

zh: 日照实际上是引发了一种化学反应，可以让原先不活跃的维生素D3具有活性。但是大多数人接受日照的吋间都不足以获得适量的维生素D3(而待在阳光下时间过长，则会增加得皮肤癌的危险；防晒霜也会阻碍不活跃维生素D3转化为活性维生素）。
en: The sun actually triggers a chemical reaction that turns inactive vitamin into active vitamin D3, but most people aren't exposed to enough sun to get the recommended amount of (and prolonged exposure can increase your risk of skin cancer; sunblock also blocks the vitamin conversion).

zh: 胃是人体的食物储藏室，食物滑下食道，就留在胃里。
en: It's your stomach-- the storage bin of food.Once your food drops down your esophagus, it lingers there.

zh: 食物待在胃里的时间越长，我们就越觉得饱，不想进食。
en: The longer it stays, the fuller you feel and the less you eat.

zh: 由于堆积着食物，胃里能发生许多事情。
en: A lot of things happen in your stomach because of the accumulation of all that food.

zh: 你胃部有发热的感觉，可能会猜想是轻度的胃食道反流或胃灼热。
en: When you feel that burning sensation in your gut, you assume it's a mild case of GERD or heartburn.

zh: 看看马吧，马不会呕吐，所以当它们吃了有毒的东西后，就无法将毒物排出体外。
en: Horses, for instance, can't vomit, so when they eat poisonous stuff, they can't get it out of their system.

zh: 这就带来了绞痛，或者说是由消化道受损引起的剧烈腹痛。绞痛是马死亡的主要原因。
en: That promotes a condition called colic—or severe abdominal pain caused by trauma in the digestive tract—and that's the leading cause of equine deaths.

zh: 因此，我们应该庆幸人类能够呕吐、吐痰，还会嗝气。
en: So the stars of MTV's Jackass aren't the only ones who should be thankful humans can vomit, spit up, and vent air with Richter-registering burps.

zh: 这种排毒控制系统让我们能将有害物质排出，但它也会造成胃酸逆流。
en: This poison-control system helps us clear harmful sub-stances out of our bodies, but it also contributes to acid reflux.

zh: 一个广泛使用的无氧功率指标是最大功率输出。最大功率输出是采用温盖特无氧试验进行测试的，是受试者在30秒钟内全力蹬车时第一个或第二个2.5-5秒内产生的最大无氧功率。
en: A widely used measure of anaerobic power is provided by the peak power (PP) output generated during the first or second 2.5-5s interval of the all-out 30s cycle ride of the Wingate anaerobic test (WAnT).

zh: 在5秒钟内的这种运动主要取决于以肌酸激酶为限速酶的三磷酸腺苷-磷酸肌酸系统；或者取决于肌肉内能源系统快速补充ATP的能力。
en: Performance during such a task (5s), depends predominantly on the adenosine triphosphate (ATP)-creatine phosphate system, with creatine kinase being the rate-limiting enzyme, or the capacity to replenish ATP by means of the immediately available muscle sources of energy.

zh: 卧推被吹捧为顶级的上身练习动作，其实这是错误的。
en: The bench press is often touted as a superior upper body exercise, but this is a fallacy.

zh: 因为卧推不仅人为地将上身孤立，还会（即便是进行短期练习）损伤肩袖，对肘关节和腕关节也有不利影响。
en: Not only does bench pressing isolate the upper body in an artificial way, it also destroys the rotator cuff muscles as well as irritating the elbow and wrist joints when performed over even short periods.

zh: 俯卧撑不但会保护这些关节，还能发展出能用的力量——在现实世界中（而不仅仅在健身房中）真正有用的力量。
en: The pushup protects the joints and builds functional strength, real-world strength—not just the kind of strength that can be used in a gym.

zh: 这就是为什么俯卧撑在全世界的巅和军事训练营都是肌肉训练的首选——自从历史上第一位战士开始力量训练时，它就一直如此。
en: This is why the pushup is the number one muscle-building exercise in military training camps and academies the world over.It always has been, since the first warriors trained for strength.

zh: 做乌鸦式时，双膝分开，呈蹲坐姿势。
en: In the crow stand, sit down on your haunches with your knees apart.

zh: 双手手掌放在身体前面的地板上，与肩同宽。
en: Place your palms on the floor in front of you, at approximately shoulder width distance apart.

zh: 双臂略微弯曲，身体向前倾斜，然后让双膝稳稳地夹在两肘外侧（图109）。
en: Your arms should be bent a little.Lean forwards, placing your knees securely on the outside of your elbows (fig. 109).

zh: 但是，必须认识到月经周期长短的变化不会引起闭经。
en: However, it must be recognized that alterations in cycle length may occur that do not produce amenorrhoea.

zh: 例如，当只收集月经的数据时，就容易遗漏掉短黄体期、黄体期不足（luteal phase insufficiency)和无排卵期的数据。
en: For example, three aberrations —the short luteal phase, luteal phase insufficiency and anovulation — can easily be missed when only menstrual data are obtained.

zh: 在月经初潮后早期，无排卵（anovulation)的月经周期的发生率（5%-7% )最高 (Vollman，1977)。
en: The highest incidence (5—7%) of anovulatory cycles is found in the early postmenarcheal years (Vollman, 1977).

zh: 30s全力的Wingate自行车运动测试可以提供最大功率和无氧功率信息。
en: Performance on a 30-second all-out Wingate cycling test provides information regarding peak and mean anaerobic power.

zh: 这些变量证实了这样的生物节律，即下午3: 00-9: 00最大功率达到峰值，振幅为8%。
en: These variables demonstrate circadian rhythmicity, with highest values between 3:00 and 9:00 p.m.and an amplitude of 8%.

zh: 在台阶试验和楼梯跑跳测试中也发现了相似的昼夜节律。
en: Similar diurnal periodicity has been observed with bench exercises as well as with stair-running and jumping tests.

zh: 有些情况就不一定是这样了。
en: Others have not been so sure.

zh: 例如，物理运动规律不会因物体的运动方向相左而改变。
en: Physical laws of motion, for example, work just as well in reverse as they do in forward motion.

zh: 也就是说，如果你按照牛顿力学原理记录一个运动系统的影像，放映时你根本不会知道哪个片段在前或在后。
en: That is, if you filmed a system corresponding to the laws of Newtonian mechanics, you would never be able to tell whether the film was later being projected backward or forward.

zh: 同理，你不仅可能计算出太阳系周围行星未来的位置，还可能计算出它们过去的位置。
en: It is possible to calculate not only the future positions of the planets around the solar system, but also their locations in the past.

zh: 总之，物理学原理观照下的物理过程不存在时间向度上的方向性。
en: In the laws of physics, there is no preferred direction of physical processes in respect to time.

zh: 粪便带血可能会说明多种情况，但重要的是注意观察异常情况。通过结肠镜检查在有癌变前兆的息肉转变为结肠癌前，我们就能发现异常。（我们建议50岁以上的人，或是有结肠癌家族病史的40岁以上的人，每3年检查一次。）
en: If you do have a positive reading-blood can be a sign of many things, but it's important to look for it so that a colonoscopy recommended every ten years for people over fifty or every five years for people over forty who have a family history of early onset colon cancer—can catch the precancerous polyps before they lead to colon cancer.

zh: 硒是我们身体所需的微量矿物质元素之一。它大部分来自食物，比如大蒜。大蒜是通过从土中吸收硒（有许多鱼类，如鳕鱼、青鱼、鲭鱼、沙丁鱼和巴西坚果中也含有硒）。
en: One of the trace minerals needed by our bodies, selenium largely comes from foods like garlic that absorb selenium from the soil.(Many fish, such as cod, herring, mackerel, and sardines, and Brazil nuts also have it.)

zh: 有项研究显示，那些每天两次每次服用100微克硒的人，癌症死亡率会减少50%。
en: One study showed a 50 percent reduction in cancer deaths among individuals who took 100 micrograms of selenium twice a day.

zh: 蜥蜴俯卧撑包括四个难度水平。
en: There are four levels of difficulty to the gecko pushup.

zh: 最简单的是训练者在做标准俯卧撑的基础上，将脚踝相扣，这样就只有一只脚与地面接触，这个动作有时也被称为三点俯卧撑。
en: In the easiest version the athlete does full pushups, but with one ankle hooked over the other so that only one foot is making contact with the floor.These are sometimes called three-point pushups.

zh: 第二个难度动作是训练者在做俯卧撑时，要始终抬起一只脚并伸直。
en: In the second version, the athlete raises one leg off the floor, but keeps it locked straight out behind him as he does his pushups.

zh: 这个细微的差别使这个动作对稳定肌（包括腿部、髋部、腰部和脊椎肌肉）提出了双倍的要求。
en: This nuance doubles the isometric involvement of the movement’s stabilizers; the legs, hips, waist and spinal muscles.

zh: 与标准俯卧撑相比，这个动作需要更强的平衡能力与精神集中力。
en: It also requires greater balance and focus than the normal pushup.

zh: 第三个难度动作是训练者的两腿都蹬地，但一只手臂要伸向前方，与头部等高。
en: In the third version the athlete keeps both legs on the floor, but stretches one arm out straight in front of him, level with his head.

zh: 这个动作本质上是单臂俯卧撑，区别只是有一只手臂指向前，而不是固定在身后。
en: This is essentially a one-arm pushup, but with one limb pointing forward instead of being secured next to the lower back.

zh: 最难的是蜥蜴俯卧撑，训练者要把第二个与第三个难度动作结合起来——向前伸出一只手臂，同时另一侧的腿也要向后伸出。
en: In the fourth and hardest version of the gecko pushup, the athlete combines the second and third versions.He lifts one arm out straight in front, as well as stretching the opposite leg out behind him as he performs the movement.

zh: 用这种方式做俯卧撑时，为了保持身体稳定，上肢需要承受极大的力量，同时下背部也要如钢铁般结实。
en: Doing pushups in this manner requires significant upper body strength and a lower back of steel in order to remain stable.

zh: 训练者就像一只蜥蜴在炽热的沙漠地面上交替抬脚，因此我将此动作命名为“蜥蜴俯卧撑”。
en: In this position, the athlete resembles a lizard lifting alternate feet from the baking desert floor, hence the name “gecko” pushups.

zh: 如果你已经具有了相当的力量，就可以将蜥蜴俯卧撑作为有趣的收尾练习。
en: Gecko pushups are a fun finishing exercise to include in your routine when you have the strength.

zh: 为了保持对称发展，要确保两侧的练习次数相等。
en: Be sure to do an equal number of reps on either side to keep development symmetrical.

zh: 蜥蜴桥是比标准桥难度更大的变式。
en: The gecko bridge is a slightly harder variation on the full bridge.

zh: 先做出标准桥式（见图90），然后抬起一侧的手臂及另一侧的腿，使它们与地面平行，并分别朝向正前方和正后方。
en: Simply get into the full bridge hold (fig.90), and lift one hand and the opposite foot from the floor, pointing these limbs out horizontally.

zh: 坚持该姿势片刻，然后用四肢支撑身体，再换用另一只手臂及其相对的腿练习。
en: Hold the position briefly, before supporting yourself with all your limbs again, and alternating the position with the other hand and foot.

zh: 与标准桥相比，该动作需要四肢更有力量，同时也会强化腰部肌肉，因为它们必须极度紧张以维持身体平衡。
en: This requires more limb strength than regular bridge holds, and also firms up the lumbar muscles which have to tense very strongly to maintain balance.

zh: 双脚并拢，双膝着地。
en: Kneel on the floor with your feet together, and your palms flat on the ground in front of you.

zh: 双臂伸直，与肩同宽。双手在胸部的正下方，两个手掌平放在地面上。
en: The arms should be straight, shoulder width apart, and in line with your chest.

zh: 脚踝搭在一起，大腿与上身及头部成一条直线，不要撅屁股或者塌腰。
en: Link one ankle around the other, and keep the hips straight and in alignment with the trunk and head.

zh: 这是膝盖俯卧撑的起始姿势（图5）。
en: This is the start position of the kneeling pushup (fig. 5).

zh: 体内的入侵者被巨噬细胞吞下并处理掉，巨噬细胞送出的化学信息（细胞活类素）吸引着别的白血球。
en: An invader into the body is ingested and processed by macrophages that send chemical messages (cytokines) that attract other white blood cells.

zh: （这种细胞分裂素有的时候会引起发烧、头疼和肌肉疼。
en: (The cytokines can sometimes also cause fever, headache; and muscle pain.)

zh: ）做出反应的白细胞紧贴着巨噬细胞以获取更多关于入侵细菌的信息，并生成一种特殊的防御机制——把T细胞和B细胞召集到被感染区。
en: Responding white cells attach to the macrophage so they can learn more about the invaders and develop specialized defense mechanisms—in the form of calling T cells and B cells to the area.

zh: 心脏就像人体房屋的总水管，提供人生存所需的营养成分。
en: Your heart, which is a lot like the water main of your anatomical house, provides the nutrients you need to live.

zh: 在“房屋”中，洁净的水能让你安全地饮用，还能冲走细菌。
en: In your house, clean water lets you drink safely and wash away germs.

zh: 在人体内，心脏将血液抽送到身体的各个“房间”一一送到大脑，让你可以思考；送到生殖器官，让你可以繁衍后代；送到消化系统，让你可以处理食物；送到肌肉，让你可以帮助邻居搬钢琴。
en: In your body, your heart pumps blood to every room in your body—to your brain so you can think, to your sex organs so you can procreate, to your digestive system so you can process food, to your muscles so you can help your neighbors move their piano.

zh: 很多入了狱又想维持手臂围度的健美者都会练习下沉臂屈伸。
en: Incline tiger bends are performed by a lot of bodybuilders who find themselves in prison and want to maintain their arm size.

zh: 尽管这是一个自身体重训练动作，但它比标准俯卧撑更像杠铃臂屈伸，因为该动作主要锻炼肱三头肌，而不锻炼胸肌或肩部。
en: Although it’s a bodyweight exercise, it’s more like a barbell triceps extension than a true pushup, because it works the triceps but not the pectorals or shoulders.

zh: 身体前倾45°，抓住你面前的固定物体。
