en: Lean forwards at a forty-five degree angle, grabbing a solid object in front of you.

zh: 在监狱里，洗漱台正好适合；但如果你在家锻炼，可以选用厨房操作台或写字台，甚至可以把手掌撑在墙上（与胸等高的位置）做该动作。
en: In prison, wash basins usually fit the bill, but if you are training at home you might want to use a kitchen counter or a work surface.You can even do the exercise with your palms flat on a wall, opposite your chest.

zh: 双肘始终朝向地面，肘部弯曲，肩部锁定。
en: Keeping the elbows pointing down, bend at the elbows but not at the shoulders.

zh: 尽力向前移动躯干，或直到其接触上臂，然后把自己推回到起始姿势。
en: Continue moving forwards as far as you can or until your upper arms meet your torso, then press yourself up.

zh: 下斜俯卧撑有时被误称为上斜俯卧撑。
en: Confusingly, decline pushups are sometimes wrongly called incline pushups.

zh: 做下斜俯卧撑时，你需要抬高双脚——放在比双手高的平面上。
en: They simply involve doing your pushups with the feet raised onto any surface higher than the hands.

zh: 在监狱里，许多家伙都会借助床铺来做这个动作，不过你可以使用更高的物体，如书桌或洗漱台。
en: In prison a lot of guys use their bunk, but you can go higher with a desk or basin.

zh: 有些人甚至会把双脚高高地蹬在墙上，但要保持这个姿势身体必须绷得特别紧。
en: Some men even wedge their feet high against the wall, but it requires a lot of body tension to retain this position.

zh: 双脚抬起时，双手就要承受更多的体重，这样难度便加大了。
en: Raising the feet makes the exercise harder by transferring a greater proportion of the bodyweight through the hands.

zh: 另外，由于身体与地面的角度变大，该动作将会比标准俯卧撑更强烈地作用于胸部的上半部分和肩部。
en: Because of the increased angle, this movement effects the shoulders and upper portions of the chest more intensely than the prone pushup.

zh: 我并不建议我的学生在下斜俯卧撑上花时间，因为倒立撑（见第十章）可以更集中地锻炼相应的肌肉。
en: I don’t advise my students to spend time on the decline pushup, because handstand pushups (see chapter 10) convey all the benefits of decline pushups in a more concentrated way.

zh: 如果你既做倒立撑，又做下斜俯卧撑，那就相当于双箭一雕（效率更低），而且还会有过度训练的危险。
en: If you are doing handstand pushups, you are simply covering the same ground (but less efficiently) if you do decline pushups too.You are also risking overtraining.

zh: 下斜仰卧起坐练习需要一块一端可以架高的板子或一个倾斜的平台。
en: Incline Sit-Ups require a board or platform you can elevate at one end.

zh: 把双脚固定在板子或平台上较高的地方，然后开始做仰卧起坐。
en: Hook your feet under the straps and do your sit-ups.

zh: 如果你觉得这样越来越轻松，那就逐渐抬高双脚，这会迫使身体中段在克服重力的过程中会更加用力。
en: As they get easier, lift the end of the board under your feet by a few degrees.This forces the midsection to work harder against gravity.

zh: 如果可以找到能够安全放置板子的更高的地方，那你可以持续抬高双脚，直到你的身体几乎与地面垂直。
en: If you have something high enough to secure the board on, you can keep going until you are almost vertical.

zh: 站在距墙壁大约一臂远的位置，如果把握不准，可以稍近一点儿，这样可以更安全地调整。
en: Stand approximately one arm’s length from a wall.If in doubt about your positioning, it’s better to stand closer to the wall than further from it—you can more safely adjust your position this way.

zh: 双脚与肩同宽，臀部向前挺，身体向后弯。
en: Your feet should be about shoulder width apart.Push the hips forwards and begin bending backwards.

zh: 抬起下巴，头尽量向后仰，以舒服为准。
en: Raise your chin, tilting your head back as far as is comfortable.

zh: 身体继续平缓地向后弯，直到可以看到身后的墙壁。
en: Continue smoothly bending back until you can see the wall behind you.

zh: 一旦能看见墙壁，便将双手举过头顶，手掌紧贴墙壁，手指朝下，与头部齐平。
en: As soon as you can see the wall, raise your hands, moving them over your shoulders and placing the palms flat on the wall, fingers pointing down, level with your head.

zh: 这是该动作的起始姿势（图95）。
en: This is the start position (fig. 95).

zh: 将一部分体重向后转移到手上，把一只手降低几厘米，再让其紧贴墙壁；然后再移动另一只手，使其降得更低。
en: Shift some of your bodyweight back through your hands, and lower one by a few inches, before placing it securely on the wall again.Now follow suit with your opposite hand, lowering it even further on the wall.

zh: 用手在墙壁上向下“行走”时，身体要一直向后弯曲（图96）。
en: Keep bending backwards as you “walk” down the wall with your hands (fig. 96).

zh: 手向下移动的同时，双脚也要一点点远离墙壁，以适应身体弯曲——只要感觉需要这样做就小步向前移动。
en: As you move downwards, you will need to move slightly away from the wall to accommodate your body bend.Do this by taking mini-steps forwards any time you feel the need.

zh: 双手继续交替下移，直到移至墙根为止。
en: Continue alternating this movement until you run out of wall.

zh: 之后双手手掌撑地，此时你其实是在墙根处做标准的桥式。
en: When this occurs, place your hands flat on the floor.At this stage you will be in a full bridge hold next to the wall.

zh: 这是该动作的最低点（图97）。
en: This is the bottom position (fig. 97).

zh: 然后让身体落到地板上，再站起来，回到起始姿势，重新开始下一轮动作。
en: From here, simply lower your backside to the floor, and stand up.Return to the start position, and walk back down again.

zh: 整个下行桥过程中要平缓呼吸。
en: Breathe regularly as you go the wall walking bridges (down).

zh: 注重LSD的教练认为，LSD可以积极改变骨骼肌细胞：主要发生在“线粒体生物合成”过程中，这个过程是身体合成更多的线粒体进入每一个肌肉细胞的过程。
en: Coaches who focus on LSD claim that LSD runs deliver positive changes in the skeletal muscle cells: This occurs chiefly as “mitochondrial biogenesis,” which is the process by which the body packs more mitochondria into each muscle cell.

zh: 这一过程对跑者非常重要，因为线粒体（许多生物教科书称之为“细胞的发电站”）是燃料转化成能量的场所。
en: This is important to runners because the mitochondria, nicknamed “the powerhouse of the cell”in innumerable biology textbooks, are where fuel is converted to energy.

zh: 简单来讲，细胞里的线粒体越多，细胞工作产生的能量就越多。
en: Simply put, the more mitochondria you have in a cell, the more energy that cell has available to produce work.

zh: 素食者是很长时间不吃肉的一类人，他们再吃肉时会产生排斥。
en: Vegetarians who haven't eaten meat in a long time don't like it if they try it again.

zh: 这是因为从他们的唾液腺到胃腺和小肠腺，都不再分泌与消化肉类相对应的一系列酶，人体无法顺利消化肉食。
en: That’s because they don't secrete the right mix of enzymes from the salivary glands to the stomach's digestive enzymes and small intestine to optimally digest meat.

zh: 素食者吃肉时，身体就会发生一种反应：肉食感觉很重，无法正常消化，因此感觉不舒服，对肉产生排斥。
en: That triggers a reaction when you do eat it: it feels heavy, you don't digest it as well, so you don't feel good and you don't enjoy it.

zh: 不同暴露组别在疾病发生率的绝对风险差异，可透过简单的减法计算获得。
en: Differences in disease rates between exposure groups expressed on an absolute basis can be obtained by simple subtraction of rates.

zh: 近来，暴露—疾病关系的估算更多是以相对风险( relative r is k )表示。
en: More frequently, estimates of the exposure-disease relationship are expressed as the relative risk.

zh: 相对风险可透过计算暴露因子各组别发生率对其参照组( referent category )发生率的率比( ratio )而得。
en: Relative risks are calculated as the ratio of the referent category to various exposure levels.

zh: 藉由将成绩标记出来(图 6.1)，你会发现高个子大致来说确实跳得比矮个子远。
en: By plotting the scores (figure 6.1), you can see that taller people generally do jump farther than shorter people.

zh: 但是请注意，这样的关联性并不是完美的。
en: But note that the relationship is not perfect.

zh: 如果是完美的关联，成绩应该会从图中的左下角开始，往斜对角方向出现一条笔直的线，直到右上端。
en: If it were, the scores would begin in the lower left-hand comer of the figure and proceed diagonally in a straight line toward the upper right-hand corner.

zh: 测量两个变项之间关联程度的一种方法是皮尔森积差相关系数(Pearson productmoment coefficient of correlation)(也称为 Pearson r、组间相关，或是简单相关)。
en: One measure of the degree of association between two variables is called the Pearson product moment coefficient of correlation (also known as Pearson r, interclass correlation, or simple correlation).

zh: 项目分析的目的便是要确定哪些测验题目是合适的。哪些题目是需要修改或舍弃的。
en: The purpose of item analysis is to determine which test items are suitable and which need to be rewritten or discarded.

zh: 项目分析的两个重要工作便是决定测验题目的难度以及对不同成就水准的鉴别能力。
en: Two important facets of item analysis are determining the difficulty of the test items and determining their power to discriminate among levels of achievement.

zh: 在古典测验理论中,项目难度是以全体回答的结果来测量。
en: In CTT, item difficulty is measured as a function of the total group.

zh: 而在试题反应理论中,项目难度是固定的,而且可以由对应的受试者能力水准来评量。
en: In IRT, item difficulty is fixed and can be assessed relative to an examinee’s ability level.

zh: 因此 ,特定能力的受试者能正确回答一个题目的机率,便可以数学的方式被描绘成一条试题特征曲线(item characteristic curve, Iconvict conditioning )。
en: Thus, the probability that an examinee with a particular ability level will make a correct response to an item can be mathematically described by an item characteristic curve (Iconvict conditioning).

zh: 对个别题目而言,试题特徵曲线是一条由左向右渐增的非线性迴归曲线,表示答对的机率随著能力或是潜在特质的提高而增加。
en: The Iconvict conditioning is a nonlinear regression for any item that increases from left to right, indicating an increase in the probability of a correct response with increased ability, or latent trait.

zh: 在海上，没有人不想要一个打足气的救生圈，同样，没有人不想拥有氧气充足的呼吸管道。
en: No one wants to be at sea without a fully inflated life ring, and no one wants to live without fully inflated airways.

zh: 以下介绍与衰老有关的主要健康问题，它们会损害我们赖以生存的呼吸系统，让管道漏气。
en: These are the important aging-related conditions that can deflate—or destroy the structures that help keep you alive.

zh: 睡眠呼吸暂停综合征和哮喘是两种最常见的肺部问题，因此我们会在本章中详细分析这两种疾病。
en: Sleep apnea and asthma are the most common lung abnormalities, so we discuss these two at length in this chapter.

zh: 约翰•弗洛耶爵士于1689年完成一部哮喘专著。
en: Sir John Floyer wrote an entire book devoted to asthma in 1698.

zh: 他的主要贡献是认识到支气管平滑肌的重要性：……在哮喘发作时，肺内支气管肌纤维收缩，多在呼气时产生哮鸣……。
en: His major contribution may have been the recognition of the importance of bronchial smooth muscle: .. .in the Asthmatic fit, the Muscular Fibres of the Bronchi... of the Lungs are contracted and that produces the Wheezing Noise, which is most observable in the Expiration.. .

zh: 公元2世纪，阿拉图斯观察到运动和哮喘的关系：“当进行体操或其他运动时，出现的呼吸困难，称为哮喘”。
en: The relationship between exercise and asthma was recognized at least as far back as the second century A.D., when Arateus the Cappadocian observed: 'If from gymnastics or other exercise the breathing become labored, it is called asthma'.

zh: 消防员冲刺跑是冲刺跑的高强度训练法，需要训练伙伴。
en: Fireman Sprint is an intense method of sprinting that requires a training partner.

zh: 在消防员冲刺跑中，弯腰并把肩膀抵在伙伴腰下，当他趴在你背上之后，站起来，顺势把他背离地面，他的头会在你的背上，双脚悬在你大腿的位置，用手钩住他的双腿以保持稳定。
en: Bend down and press your shoulder into your buddy’s waist.As he doubles over you, stand up straight, hoisting him clean off the ground.This will have his head down around your back, with his feet dangling around your thighs.Hook your nearest arm around his legs for stability.

zh: 这是经典的消防员抢救背负方式。
en: This is the classic fireman’s lift.

zh: 以这个姿势快速跑到大约100米处的固定目标那里，但要保证安全。
en: From this position, run as fast as you safely can to a fixed goal about a hundred yards away.

zh: 然后，把你的伙伴放下，再让他同样的动作把你背回来。
en: Then place your partner back on his feet, and have him carry you back.

zh: 双方交替重复这种折磨人的练习，只要吃得消，就尽量多次反复练习。
en: Repeat this torture on alternating sides for as many cycles as you can stomach.

zh: 消防员抢救背负是冲刺跑的高强度训练法，需要训练伙伴。
en: Fireman Sprint is an intense method of sprinting that requires a training partner.

zh: 在消防员冲刺跑中，弯腰并把肩膀抵在伙伴腰下，当他趴在你背上之后，站起来，顺势把他背离地面，他的头会在你的背上，双脚悬在你大腿的位置，用手钩住他的双腿以保持稳定。
en: Bend down and press your shoulder into your buddy’s waist.As he doubles over you, stand up straight, hoisting him clean off the ground.This will have his head down around your back, with his feet dangling around your thighs.Hook your nearest arm around his legs for stability.

zh: 这是经典的消防员抢救背负方式。
en: This is the classic fireman’s lift.

zh: 体育具备的超越与禁锢这一个核心悖论以及它所具有的惊人的寓意化能力，是名流文化场中最显著的，而且也许是最具有变革性的。
en: The paradox at the heart of sports, its simultaneously transcendent and imprisoning qualities and its astonishing capacity to allegorize, is most obvious and perhaps most transformative in the field of celebrity culture.

zh: 随着消费资本主义和后现代文化的来临，身体巳经越来越表现出可见的欲望轨迹。
en: With the advent of consumer capitalism and postmodern culture, the body has become an increasingly visible hcus of desire.

zh: 对外表的控制通过时尚符码、身体装饰、营养计算和身体条件等来改变我们的衣着、我们感受到的欲望、我们从事的锻炼和我们消费的图像。
en: The manipulation of appearance through fashion codes, bodily adornment, calculated nutrition, and physical conditioning has changed the clothes we wear, the desires we feel, the exercises we do, and the images we consume.

zh: 心脏就像人体房屋的总水管，提供人生存所需的营养成分。
en: Your heart, which is a lot like the water main of your anatomical house, provides the nutrients you need to live.

zh: 在“房屋”中，洁净的水能让你安全地饮用，还能冲走细菌。
en: In your house, clean water lets you drink safely and wash away germs.

zh: 在人体内，心脏将血液抽送到身体的各个“房间”——送到大脑，让你可以思考；送到生殖器官，让你可以繁衍后代；送到消化系统，让你可以处理食物；送到肌肉，让你可以帮助邻居搬钢琴。
en: In your body, your heart pumps blood to every room in your body—to your brain so you can think, to your sex organs so you can procreate, to your digestive system so you can process food, to your muscles so you can help your neighbors move their piano.

zh: 当受试者笔直站立，体重均匀分布在双脚并协助将短裤拉上时，测到的右腿的围度。
en: Perimeter of the right thigh which is measured when the subject stands erect, weight equally distributed on both feet, and assisting by holding clothing out of the way.

zh: 要求受试者双脚稍微分开，让卷尺通过。
en: Ask the subject to place the feet slightly apart, thus speading the legs to permit tape passage.

zh: 将卷尺拉开，穿过小腿，然后用右手送到前面握住末端，用左手接住，握紧卷尺末端。
en: Extend the tape and lay it across the calf, then reach with your right hand in front and grasp the stub end, cross over with your left hand and grasp the stub end of the tape.

zh: 现在，请把呼吸系统想象成一棵倒置的树（见图5.1)。
en: To start, think of your respiratory system as an upside-down tree (see Figure 5.1).

zh: 我们要追踪吸进的一口空气的旅行过程。先从口腔和鼻腔开始。
en: If we follow a breath of air well start with your mouth and nose.

zh: 空气进入体内，顺气管向下流动。
en: When air enters your body, it goes down your trachea.

zh: 这就是“树干”呼吸过程开始处的一道通风管。
en: That's your trunk—the one airway at the beginning of the process.

zh: 接着，气管分为两条支路，将空气分开输送到两边的肺中。
en: Then it quickly divides into two airways to feed into two lungs; those are your bronchial tubes.

zh: 输送是由支气管完成的。随后，这些通风管像树枝一样，由两条分为四条，再分为八条，最后是成千上万的小通风管通向肺部。
en: Then, like tree branches, those airways break off into four, then eight, then hundreds of thousands of little airways in each lung.

zh: 这些都被称为细支气管，在每条气管的末端是叫做肺泡的小液囊。
en: Those airways are your bronchi.At the end of each airway are tiny sacs called alveoli.

zh: 生活在小众媒体时代的一个结果是“名流”角色的地位降低了。
en: One result of living in an age of niche media has been the diminished status of the "celebrity" role.

zh: 即使在不到1%的美国家庭收看的各种秀中当过一阵子“明星”的人，也会出现在主流杂志的封面上。
en: Even people who "star" on shows viewed by less than 1 % of American households find themselves on the covers of major magazines.

zh: 媒体空间充斥着大多数公众对于伪名人无休无止的议论。
en: Much of the public is chattering away about pseudo-celebrities that clutter the media space.

zh: 萨普和豪伯斯特赖克（Sapp & Haubenstriker, 1978)发现，11-18岁年长一些的运动员（抽样调查人数为404人）不打算在来年继续参赛，重要理由中“有其他活动”的占64%,“有工作”的占44%。
en: Sapp and Haubenstricker (1978) found that older athletes (n = 404), ranging in age from 11 to 18 years, who indicated they did not plan to participate next year, cited other activities (64%) and working (44%) as important reasons for dropping out of sport.

zh: 古尔德等人(1982) 发现，10-18岁的退役游泳运动员中49%因“有其他事要做”而放弃游泳。
en: Gould et al. (1982) found that 49% of the former swimmers (n = 50) between the ages of 10 and 18 dropped out of swimming because they had other things to do'.

zh: 在本章前部分引用的研究中也报道了类似结果（Athletic Footwear Association, 1980; Robertson, 1981; Sefton & Fry, 1981)。
en: Similar results were reported also in several of the studies cited earlier in this chapter (Athletic Footwear Association, 1980; Robertson, 1981; Sefton & Fry, 1981).

zh: 器质性杂音一般的特点是很粗糙的，而不一定是强度很大（一个功能性杂音有可能达到m-VI级)。
en: Organic murmurs are generally characterized by their harshness rather than their intensity (a functional murmur may in fact be grade III—VI).

zh: 器质性杂音通常是不振动的，并且不受体位的明显影响。
en: Organic murmurs are generally not vibratory in nature and are not drastically affected by body position.

zh: 器质性杂音一方面可能代表非常轻微的心血管缺损（心房间隔缺损，atrial septal defect, 心室间隔缺损，ventricular septal defect), 另一方面可能代表更加复杂的心血管问题 (辨膜狭窄，stenotic valves，紫甜型心脏病 cyanotic heart disease)的一个部分。
en: Organic murmurs may represent very mild cardiovascular defects (atrial septal defect, ventricular septal defect) or may be part of a more complex cardiovascular problem (stenotic valves, cyanotic heart disease).

zh: 参与者退出指个体的退出这些人曾多年投身一项或多项活动，并可能从事各种层次的比赛（即娱乐性的、竞技性的或全 国性的比赛）。
en: The participant drop-out was an individual who had committed his or her time to one or more sports for a number of years and may have competed at various levels of competition (i.e.recreational, competitive or national).

zh: 对这类个体而言，当运动达不到自身要求时就可能退出。
en: For this individual, dropping out may have occurred when the sport no longer met his or her needs.

zh: 另一种情况是该运动员已经处于典型的心理耗竭 (burn-out)的状况，这是有别于自愿退出的一种现象（Smith, 1986)*。
en: Or, this athlete may have been experiencing a classic case of 'burn-out' — a phenomenon differentiated from voluntary withdraw (Smith, 1986).

zh: 参与者退出 后时常可能再度参加另一项运动，或者参加同一项目的其他层次运动，或者彻底退出运动（Klint & Weiss, 1986; Lindner, 1991）
en: * The participant dropout may, at times, return to another sport, return to the same sport at another level, or drop out completely from sport (Klint & Weiss, 1986; Lindner et al., 1991).

zh: 《开放》讲述的也是一个关于成年人的成功故事。
en: Open is also a story of successful adult development.

zh: 虽然阿加西和梅尔林格都没有明确提及生命历程理论，但是《开放》一书探究了从青年成年期到中年成年期的过渡，所采用的方式与艾瑞克• 埃里克森（Erik Erikson, 1959) 著名的心理社会发展模式形成了强烈的共鸣。
en: While neither Agassinor Moehringer referred to life-course theory explicitly, Open explores the transition from young adulthood to middle adulthood in ways that resonate strongly with Erik Erikson's (1959) well-known model of psychosocial development.

zh: 简而言之，埃里克森认为人生有八个阶段，第一个阶段是出生，最后一个阶段是死亡，通过这些阶段，一个健康的人会变得成熟。
en: In short, Erikson believed that there are eight phases of life, beginning at birth and ending at death, through which a healthy human matures.

zh: 在每个阶段里，人们都要经历不同的冲突或者挑战，这代表了成长的一个转折点——一个人成长或是失败的机会。
en: At each phase, people experience a distinct conflict or challenge that represents a turning point for development—an opportunity for personal growth or failure.

zh: 也许心前区暂停吸气综合征 (precordial catch syndrome)是儿童胸痛最常见的原因（Duster，1990)。这是在胸前靠近心尖部位的锐痛。
en: Perhaps the most common cause of chest pain in children is the precordial catch syndrome (Duster, 1990).These sharp pains are felt in the anterior chest, at or near the cardiac apex.

zh: 疼痛历时30秒到3分钟，常常在深吸气时加剧，而在浅吸气时缓解。
en: This pain lasts from 30 s to 3 mm and is often aggravated by deep breathing and relieved by shallow respirations.

zh: 这是良性的疼痛。
en: It is a benign condition.

zh: 瓣膜在心脏永不停止的血液循环活动中扮演的角色极普通又极关键：瓣膜是门卫，阻止血液回流进刚刚离开的心室。
en: The valves play a key and surprisingly basic role in the never-ending cycle of blood through the heart: They are doormen who keep the blood from retracing its journey, leaking backward into the chambers it has just left.

zh: 在心房与心室之间，在心室与离开心室的血管之间，都有瓣膜。
en: There are valves between each atrium and ventricle, and between each ventricle and the blood vessel that leaves it.

zh: 血液流过后，瓣膜就会合上，发出我们在电视上听到的心跳声。
en: As the blood swishes through, the valves slam shut, producing what we hear on TV as a heartbeat.

zh: 器质性杂音一般的特点是很粗糙的，而不一定是强度很大（一个功能性杂音有可能达到III-VI级)。
en: Organic murmurs are generally characterized by their harshness rather than their intensity (a functional murmur may in fact be grade III-VI).

zh: 器质性杂音通常是不振动的，并且不受体位的明显影响。
en: Organic murmurs are generally not vibratory in nature and are not drastically affected by body position.

zh: 器质性杂音一方面可能代表非常轻微的心血管缺损（心房间隔缺损，心室间隔缺损，ventricular septal defect), 另一方面可能代表更加复杂的心血管问题 (辨膜狭窄,紫甜型心脏病)的一个部分。
en: Organic murmurs may represent very mild cardiovascular defects (atrial septal defect, ventricular septal defect) or may be part of a more complex cardiovascular problem (stenotic valves, cyanotic heart disease).

zh: 叶酸（每日800微克）和每日补充符合“推荐日摄入量”（RDA)的维生素B,再加上每日3克omega-3脂肪酸和15毫克的锌，被证实能通过改善精子活性及子宫的卵子着床环境，增强生育能力。
en: Folate (800 micrograms a day) and the B vitamins in RDA amounts—as well as 3 daily grams of omega-3fatty acids and 15 milligrams of zinc—have been shown to help increase fertility as well by improving sperm mobility and by improving the hospitality of the uterus toward the implantation of the egg.

zh: 最后，优质的左旋维生素C也能增强精子活力，它可能会很有效。当然，这取决于你是否想再要孩子。
en: Finally, good ole vitamin C also will increase sperm motility, which might prove useful, depending on whether you want more kids in your life.

zh: 为了能让你理解营养是怎么回事，你得知道一点关于新陈代谢的知识和身体为你获取能量而消化食物的方式。
en: In order to understand nutrition, youll need to know a little abouf metabolism—and the way your body digests food for energy.

zh: 大多数减肥者吃的食物肯定是不够的，还会因此减慢新陈代谢的过程。由此他们就会进入一种“假饥饿”状态，在此状态下，他们体内燃烧热量的速度就会减慢，因为身体感觉到它们需要保存热量。
en: See, when most people diet, they don't eat enough—and they actually slow their metabolism; they go into a pseudo-starvation mode in which their bodies stop burning calories as fast becouse they sense they need to preserve them.

zh: 这就是为什么锻炼更重要。
en: That's why exercise is so important.

zh: 新同性恋恐惧症体现在有关这两个女人的叙事中的很多关键点上，特别体现在缺失的或是隐匿的部分。
en: Neo-homophobia was manifest in narratives about both women in several key ways, but especially in what was missing or concealed.

zh: 在波特兰的上升期，她的歧视在批判性的传媒叙事中是缺失的。更复杂的是在查特曼的坠落期，“正当程序”的故事情节和有关她被解雇的报道。
en: Missing from the narratives were critical coverage of Portland's discrimination early in her rise, and of a more comprehensive, "due-process" storyline and reporting around the dismissal of Chatman during her fall.

zh: 绝大多数时候，新自由主义理论也在报道中用于解释波特兰和查特曼的坠落。
en: Overwhelmingly, neoliberalist rationales were also used in coverage to explain the fall of both Portland and Chatman.

zh: 在讨论了大众传媒构建从神坛上跌落下来的运动员引人注目的叙事过程之后，本章现在来探索运动员怎样通过大众传播恢复他们各自的形象。
en: Having discussed the processes through which mass media construct dramatic narratives about athletes falling from grace, the chapter now examines how athletes attempt to restore their respective images through mass communication.

zh: 关于危机传播的文献有助于阐释个体及组织所运用和实现的这些过程。
en: Scholarly literature in crisis communication helps to elucidate these processes, which apply to both individuals and organizations.

zh: 危机,一般而言，就是创造一个“信息空洞”（ Coombs, 2007)，利益相关者必须尽快给事件下定义。
en: Crises, in general, create "information voids" (Coombs, 2007), and stakeholders must scramble to define events as quickly as possible.

zh: 骨骼的过度使用损伤（应力性骨折）已引起了医学界尤其是运动医学界的广泛注意。
en: The overuse injury of bone (stress fracture) has attracted particular attention in medicine and, specifically, athletic medicine.

zh: 1855年，德国军医布赖特豪普特 (Breithaupt)报道了在年轻新兵中发生的此类损伤，这是有关应力性骨折的第一篇医学文献（Breithaupt, 1855)。因为多发生在军事训练中，此种损伤随后被命名为“行军骨折”。
en: The first reportof a stress fracture in the medical literature was that of the German military surgeon Breithaupt in 1855 who noted the occurrence of theselesions in young military recruits (Breithaupt, 1855).These lesions were subsequently identified as 'march fractures' because of their propensityfor occurrence with military training.

zh: 在以后的文献中还有多种关于此类病症的命名，如疲劳性骨折、自发性骨折（spontaneous fracture)、伪性骨折 (pseudofracture)、机能不全性骨折 (insufficiency fracture) 。
en: This entity has been identified in subsequent literature by a variety of terms, including fatigue fracture, spontaneous fracture, pseudofracture and insufficiency fracture.

zh: 正如哈奇（Hatch,2006)所言，这个研究从修辞者的自身兴趣延伸到了辩解书的叙事，而不是考察传统的有关形象重塑的辩解话语，其中也包含了反辩解语言行为。
en: Like Hatch (2006), rather than examining the traditional, apologetic discourse of image restoration, this analysis expands from the rhetor's self-interest to apologia narratives, including the antapologia speech acts.

zh: 在有些例子中攻击性的话语指向了个体，但更多的不是关于一个特殊的种族群体、性别和性取向。
en: In some cases the offensive remarks were directed to a single person, but more often than not, they were about a particular ethnic group, gender, or sexual orientation.

zh: 因此，道歉同时也是旨在恢复修辞者的形象，并从违法行为中拯救社群。
en: As such, the apologies were simultaneously designed to restore the rhetor's image and heal the community from the transgressions.

zh: 在这一研究中，修辞辩解书的五种策略（Benoit,1995)都是显著的。
en: In this analysis, all five tactics of rhetorical apologia (Benoit, 1995) are evident.

zh: 边缘系统不是一种结构，而是联系了人脑深处的许多结构的一系列通路，比如海马状突起和杏仁核（图3.3)。
en: The limbic system isn't a structure but a series of pathways incorporating various structures deep inside the braint such as the hippocampus and the amygdala (Figure 3.3).

zh: 你是如何观察的？视觉和听觉接收到的信息从眼耳处直接传到人脑皮质，因此我们能够识别感知，有意识地考虑信息的意义。
en: Why should you care?Information gained by vision and hearing passes from the eyes and ears directly to the cortex, so we recognize the sensation and can consciously consider its meaning.

zh: 另一方面，嗅觉绕过脑皮质，直接影响杏仁核，于是，在我们还没有有意识地处理信息前，身体已经做出反应。
en: On the other hand, smell sensations bypass the cortex and influence the amygdala directly, so our body responds before we can consciously process the information.

zh: 杏仁核控制情感、情绪和与抑郁焦虑有关的其他功能，邻近的海马状突起则负责处理和储存短期记忆。
en: The amygdala is responsible for emotions, moods, and other functions related to depression and anxiety, and the nearby hippocampus is responsible for the processing and storage of short-term memory.

zh: 另一方面，女孩的无氧工作能力刚过青春期就停止增长了，随后保持在固定水平上或稍有下降。
en: In girls, on the other hand, anaerobic performance improves only until just after puberty and then remains constant or even slightly reduced.

zh: 一般而言，从上面提到的研究报告（Blimkie et al.，1988; Inbar, 1985; Inbar & Bar-Or, 1986; Saavedra et al., 1991)的实际功率输出数据看，9〜11 岁男孩和女孩之间大腿无氧功率或耐力的 绝对值没有显著性的差异。
en: On average, and based on the actual power output data reported in the above-mentioned original studies (Blimkie et al., 1988; Inbar, 1985; Inbar & Bar-Or, 1986; Saavedra et al., 1991), no meaningful differences are observed in absolute leg anaerobic power or endurance between girls and boys at 9—11 years of age.

zh: 但是，从13岁之后，性别之间就出现了显著差异。
en: However, significant differences appear between genders from 13 years of age on.

zh: 雄性精子速度固然较快，但雌性精子就像乌龟，它们一直慢慢地前进，可以耐心地等上几天。
en: While male sperm are faster, female sperm are like tortoises—they keep pushing ahead slowly, hanging out and waiting a few days.

zh: 为了生育男孩，在排卵期前后进行性交至关重要，不然女性一方就会获胜。
en: For boys, copulation around ovulation is critical, or the females will win.

zh: 顺便提一句，尽管精子由男性产生，女性对精子的接受程度则因人而异，正因为此，在决定后代性别上，两性都起到一定作用。
en: By the way, although the sperm is made by males, the receptiveness to sperm varies with females, which is why both genders have some role in determining the sex of the offspring.

zh: 有些情况下，心动图和胸部X线检查是很有用的。
en: In some instances, an ECG and chest radiogram are useful.

zh: 通常，在作出合适的推荐之前，运动耐力试验，24小时心电图和心脏导管检査，必要时血管造影都是很有必要的。
en: Often, an exercise tolerance test, 24 h ECG and cardiac catheterization, with or without angiography, is required before proper recommendations are made.

zh: 我们建议读者在作出先天性心脏病人参加运动的推荐意见之前参考上述文件。
en: The reader is referred to this paper before making recommendations for participation in individuals with congenital heart disease.

zh: 胸廊横径（transverse chest width)胸廓最外侧部分之间的距离。
en: Transverse chest width.Distance of the most lateral aspect of the thorax.

zh: 测试者靠近取笔直坐位、面向操作者的受试者。
en: Approach the subject who sits erect facing you.

zh: 从胸骨中点水平将夹子双臂向下与水平面约呈 30°，测量最宽的直径，要避开胸大肌和背阔肌的轮廓。
en: From the mesosternale level apply the branches at an angle of about 30° downward from the horizontal to encompass the widest diameter avoiding both the pectoral and latissim us dorsi muscle contours.

zh: 当定位正确时，将拇指从压紧的夹子双臂松开，将手轻微向外旋转，用两个食指沿着夹子双臂施加中等程度的压力。
en: When the site is approximated, remove your thumbs from the pinch grasp of the branches slightly rotating your hands outwards and applying moderate pressure along the branches with your index fingers.

zh: 在正常呼气的末期进行测量。
en: Make themeasurement at the end o f the normal expiratory excursion (end-tidal).

zh: 胸腺在你的免疫系统中发挥着关键作用，因为它是你的T细胞成熟的地方。
en: The thymus plays a crucial role in your immune system because this is where your T cells mature.

zh: T细胞是救助细胞，是前来为最初的紧急呼叫加强增援的。
en: T cells are those helper cells that come in and add reinforcements to the ini­tial emergency call.

zh: 一部分T细胞动员其他细胞进入战斗，并传播战斗的消息。
en: Some convince other cells to enter the fray and spread the news of battle.

zh: 雄性激素是蛋白质合成的重要调节因素。
en: Male hormones are important regulators of protein synthesis.

zh: 成年男子雄性激素的活性约是青春期前的儿童和成年女子的10倍。
en: Adult males have about 10 times the activity level of androgens, compared with prepubertal children or adult women.

zh: 假设所有其他因素都相等，也只能当雄性激素达到成年水平时，肌肉力量及其增长幅度才能达到最高值。
en: Assuming all other factors being equal, maximal strength and strength-gaining potential is not possible until adult levels of androgens are achieved.

zh: 由于迷走兴奋能增加安静时支气管活动张力，所以抗胆碱能药物像阿托品一样能使一些人的支气管扩张。
en: Since vagal input increases resting bronchomotor tone, anticholinergic agents like atropine may cause bronchodilatation in some people.

zh: 溴化异丙托品 (ipratropium bromide) (Atrovent)是阿托品的一种季铵衍生物，当用定量-剂量吸入器吸入时，吸收量很少，因此阿托品样副作用（口干，视觉问题等）减少了。
en: Ipratropium bromide (Atrovent) is a quartemary ammonium derivative of atropine, and when taken by metered-dose inhaler, is absorbed only poorly, thus reducing atropine-like side-effects (dry mouth, visual problems, etc.).

zh: 溴化异丙托品对某些患者有用，但预防运动性哮喘的作用稍差（Lemanske & Henke，1989) 。
en: Ipratropium bromide has become a useful agent for some patients, but has only moderate effectiveness in preventing EIA (Lemanske & H enke, 1989).

zh: 零食在儿童营养摄入和膳食方式中起着重要的作用（Thomas-Doberson,1989；Lucas 1993）。
en: Snacks may significantly contribute to the child's nutrient intake and eating style (Thomas-Doberson, 1989; Lucas 1993).

zh: 所吃零食的数量有可能决定摄入的营养需求是否达到要求。
en: The quality of snacks eaten may determine whether nutrient requirements are being met.

zh: 所以，吃零食的频率和零食的种类是要重点考虑的因素。
en: Therefore, the frequency of snacking and type of snacks are important considerations.

zh: 人们用来创造这种有连贯感的特定认知策略称为“自传式推理”或“思考过去并将其与自身联系起来的一个动态过程”。因此，通过自传式推理浮现出来的人生故事或是叙事认同揭示了随着时间推移的连续性，同时也显现出了所发生的变化。与叙事理论相一致的是，我们并不把阿加西的自传当作其生活的真实记录；相反，《开放》是一个传媒文本（同对其分析一样），过去本身就是“在回忆的时候，被传媒化的事实生产的”。
en: The specific, cognitive strategy people use to create this sense of coherence is termed autobiographical reasoning or "the dynamic process of thinking about the past to make links to the self. The life story or narrative identity that emerges through autobiographical reasoning thus reveals continuity over time while also manifesting change. Consistent with narrative theory, we do not approach Agassi's autobiography as a factual account of his life. Rather, Open is a media text (as is this analysis of it) and the past itself is "mediated, indeed produced, in the activity of remembering".

zh: 所谓叙述法或是连续记录法是指在进行观察记录时，根据欲被观察之事件发生的顺序，以连续性文字记录下他所观察到的所有事件，这是所有观察记录方法中，最慢也最没有效率的一种。
en: With the narrative method, or the method of continual-recording, researchers record in a series of sentences the occurrences that they observe as they happen.This method of recording is the slowest and least efficient.

zh: 由于无法将所有发生在某一个情境中的所有事件都记录下来，因此观察者必须具备能将重要讯息实时筛选与记录的能力。
en: The observer must be able to select the most important information to record because not everything that occurs in a given situation can be recorded.

zh: 这种技巧的最大优点可能就是，能帮助研究者去发展出更有效率的记录工具。
en: Probably the best use of this technique is in helping to develop more efficient recording instruments.

zh: 在做悬垂半举腿时，抓住高过头顶的横杆，身体成一条直线，双脚离地，双肩收紧。
en: In the hanging partial straight leg raise, hang from an overhead bar, with your body in a straight line and your feet off the floor.Tighten the shoulders.

zh: 双腿锁定，然后慢慢抬起，使之与地面之间的夹角成45°。
en: Lift the locked legs until they are at a forty-five degree angle, and hold.

zh: 这是该动作的起始姿势。膝关节保持锁定，然后平缓地抬起双腿，直到它们与地面平行。这是该动作的结束姿势。
en: Keeping your knees locked straight, smoothly raise your legs until they are parallel with the floor.

zh: 暂停一会，然后放下双腿，回到起始姿势，如此重复。
en: Pause for a moment, before lowering the legs back to a forty-five degree angle.Repeat.

zh: 举腿时呼气，下降时吸气，腹部保持收紧。
en: Exhale as your legs move up, inhale as they move down.Keep the abs tight.

zh: 在做悬垂屈举腿时，向上跳起，抓住高过头顶的横杆。身体成成一直线，双脚离地。
en: In the hanging bent leg raise, grab an overhead bar so that your body is in a straight line and your feet are clear of the ground.

zh: 双手大致与肩同宽，肩部收紧。
en: Your hands should be approximately shoulder width, and your shoulders kept nice and tight.

zh: 弯曲膝盖，直到膝关节大约成 135°，双脚置于身后几厘米。
en: Now bend at the knees until your knee joints are angled off straight by around forty-five degrees.This will put your feet a few inches behind the rest of your hanging body.

zh: 以髋部为轴，平缓地抬起双腿，直到双脚与骨盆在一个高度上。
en: Smoothly raise your legs at the hips until your feet are opposite your pelvis.

zh: 暂停一下，然后做反向动作，如此重复。
en: Pause and reverse the motion, before repeating.

zh: 整个运动过程中，只能移动髋部，屈膝弯度要保持锁定。
en: Only move at the hips; keep your knee angle “locked” into place.

zh: 举腿时呼气，下降时吸气，始终保持收腹。
en: Exhale as you raise your legs, inhale as you lower them.Keep the abs tense.

zh: 在做悬垂屈膝时，向上跳起，抓住高过头顶的横杆，双手与肩同宽。
en: In hanging knee raises, jump up and grab an overhead bar.Your hands should be about shoulder width apart.

zh: 横杆要够高，以使身体悬垂时双脚依然离地，即使离地仅有一厘米。
en: The bar needs to be high enough that your feet hang clear from the ground, even if only by an inch.

zh: 身体成一条直线，保持肩部收紧。
en: Your body should be in a straight line, and you must keep your shoulders “tight”.

zh: 平缓地抬起膝盖，直到双膝与骨盆处于同一高度，膝关节弯曲成90°，大腿与地面平行。
en: Bring your knees up smoothly until they are level with your pelvis and your knees are at a right angle.Your thighs will be parallel with the floor.

zh: 在以上运动过程中呼气，同时保持收腹。
en: Exhale during this motion, keeping your stomach pulled in.

zh: 暂停一下，然后反向运动，直到身体完全伸展。在此过程中吸气，然后重复练习。
en: Pause for a moment, then reverse the motion until your body is fully extended, inhaling as you go.Repeat.

zh: 悬垂蛙举腿的起始姿势与第七式悬垂屈举腿相同，就像做第七式一样，抬起双腿。
en: In hanging frog raises, assume a start position identical to Step 7, hanging bent leg raises, and raise your legs just as you would for that same exercise.

zh: 双脚与髋部在同一高度时，再将双脚伸向正前方，直至双腿完全伸直。
en: Once you reach the top position with your feet in line with your hips, extend your feet out in a line directly away from you, so that your legs are perfectly straight.

zh: 这时双腿与地面平行，即与上半身之间的夹角成90度。
en: This will put your locked legs level with the floor, and your upper and lower body at a right angle.

zh: 暂停一下，但不要反向运动。
en: Pause for a moment, but do not reverse the motion.

zh: 然后慢慢放下双腿，在此过程中双腿始终伸直。
en: Instead, lower your legs while keeping them locked out perfectly straight .

zh: 该动作完成时，身体完全伸展。然后回到起始姿势，重复练习。举腿时呼气，下降时吸气，腹部从始至终都要收紧。
en: Finish with your body fully extended before assuming the start position again and repeating for the desired number of reps. Exhale as the legs are going up, inhale as they are going down, and keep the stomach tucked in at all times.

zh: 现在你已经知道该怎么做悬垂直举腿了。
en: You know the hanging straight leg raise by now!

zh: 抓住头顶的横杆，要保证身体悬垂时双脚依然离地。
en: Take hold of an overhead bar which is high enough to leave your feet a short distance from the floor when your body is extended.

zh: 双手大致与肩同宽，双肩收紧。
en: Your hands should be approximately shoulder width apart.Ensure that the shoulders are tight.

zh: 这是该动作的起始姿势。
en: This is the start position.

zh: 平缓地举起双腿，直到它们与地面平行，此过程至少要持续2秒钟。
en: Smoothly— over the course of at least two seconds—raise your legs until they are parallel with the floor.

zh: 举腿时呼气，尽量将所有气体都呼出肺部，使腹部完全收紧。
en: Exhale as your legs rise, blowing all the air you can out of your lungs so that the abdomen is fully contracted.

zh: 这是该动作的结束姿势。
en: This is the finish position.

zh: 暂停一下，然后反向运动，回到起始姿势，这一过程至少也要持续2秒钟，在此过程中吸气。
en: Pause, before reversing the motion perfectly for at least another two seconds until you are back in the start position.Inhale as you go.

zh: 即使在起始姿势中腹部也要收紧，两腿始终锁定，整个运动过程中只用肌肉控制，不要用惯性。
en: Remain “flexed,” even in the start position.Your legs must stay locked at all times and you must use pure muscular control; no momentum allowed.

zh: 注意，心脏在运转正常时就像一台机器，工作效率高得令人惊讶。
en: See, when your heart is working right, it's an astoundingly efficient machine.

zh: 为人体肌肉输送养料的血管柔软地相互连通，像自行车的橡胶内胎一样，在需要时会伸展。
en: The blood vessels supplying the muscles in your body are open and supple like rubber bicycle inner tubes that expand as needed.

zh: 血管让人体心脏可以将血液抽至全身各处，不论人体需要多少血液。
en: The blood vessels leaving your heart shuttle blood throughout your body from one source to another, no matter how much you need.

zh: 血管问题：当脑部供血不足，缺血会导致轻度中风，损害记忆。
en: Vascular problems: When insufficient blood gets to the brain, the lack of blood flow can cause mini-strokes and impair memory.

zh: 阿兹海默病：在这种情况下，神经细胞互相纠结，无法正常工作。
en: Alzhemier's: Here, neurons tangle with other neurons, causing them to stop working properly.

zh: 丧失神经细胞：许多与衰老有关的健康问题都是由于神经细胞丧失或神经细胞功能丧失而引发的。若丧失了部分脑物质，就丧失了部分脑功能。
en: Neuron loss: Many age-related problems are caused by the loss of neurons or the loss of the function of those neurons; literally, you're losing part of your mind.

zh: 血管系统贯穿于整个消化系统之中，它负责输送源自食物的养料，将营养物质运到人体的主要器官。（我们从科学上证明了“要征服男人的心，先要征服他的胃”。
en: Throughout, you have vascular systems that transport nutrients from the food and deliver it to your body's major organs(which scientifically proves that a way to a man's heart is through his stomach).

zh: ）小肠决定了要保留哪些有益物质后，就将废物直接运至盲肠（盲肠是位于大肠起始处的水库，储存小肠排出的液体）。
en: After the samll intestine decides what to keep, it shuttles the waste along into the cecum, a reservoir at the beginning of the large intestine that folds fluid from the samll bowel.

zh: 应该避免食用高脂肪和高蛋白食物， 因为它们的消化时间长于碳水化合物食 品，如果在赛前食用会导致消化不良和恶心。
en: High fat and high protein foods should be avoided because they take longer to digest than carbohydrate foods and, if eaten for the pre-event meal can contribute to indigestion and nausea.

zh: 儿童在赛前还应避免进食单纯的碳水化合物，如蔗糖、糖果、蜂蜜或软 饮料，它们并不提供“快速能量”，而且有些运动员食用这些单纯的糖时比其他运动员更容易引起血糖水平的变化。
en: Children should also avoid eating simple carbohydrates such as sugar, sweets, honey or soft drinks before exercise.They do not provide 'quick energy', and some athletes are more sensitive than others to changes in blood glucose levels when simple sugars are eaten.

zh: 相反，在面包、谷类、面食、大米和其他淀粉类食物中的复合碳水化合物应包括在赛前的食谱之中。
en: Instead, complex carbohydrates which are found in breads, cereals, pasta, rice and other starchy foods should be included in the pre-event meal.

zh: 这些食物能被迅速消化，儿童的胃在赛前很快排空，血糖水平也能维持稳定。
en: These foods are digested relatively quickly, so that the child's stomach is empty and blood sugar level is stable before practice or competition.

zh: 我们应该每周吃三次鱼。
en: You should eat three portions of fish per week.

zh: 鱼类，尤其是脂肪鱼，如鲑鱼，或白鲑，如鳕鱼和鲈鱼，都富含欧米伽-3脂肪酸，好处多多。
en: Fish, especially fatty fish like salmon and whitefish like cod or bass, is high in those omega-3 fatty acids, which have several powerful benefits.

zh: 欧米伽-3脂肪酸能降低血液中的甘油三酸酯含量 (含量过高会造成动脉中血小板淤积）， 稳定心跳（减少心律不齐的发生），让血小板黏稠度下降（减少动脉阻塞的情况），也许还能降低血压。
en: They appear to reduce triglyceride levels in the blood (high levels cause plaque buildup in the arteries), stabilize the heartbeat (reducing irregular rhythms), make platelets less sticky (reducing clotting), and may bring down blood pressure as well.

zh: 这些巨大泡沫状细胞非常贪婪，人体供血渐渐无法赶上它们生长的速度。
en: Those big, foamy cells get so greedy they outgrow the blood supply.

zh: 这时，一些泡沫细胞会因缺血而饿死，临死的细胞变得“易怒”。像我们有时梳头会被静电打到一样，在这些细胞上也产生了电荷。
en: When that happens, some of them begin to starve from lack of blood, and as they die, they become "irritable"一they have an electrical charge to them, similar to the electric shock you get sometimes while combing your hair.

zh: 这种电荷吸引来更多“十六七岁的不速之客”即黏稠的血小板。它们喜欢成群活动，在动脉中形成血凝块。
en: That charge attracts even more of the Busch-drinking, sixteen-year-old party crashers: sticky blood platelets, which like to travel in crowds and form clots in your arteries.

zh: 大多数健美与力量训练计划都有“循环”或“周期”之类的概念。
en: Most bodybuilding and strength training programs contain the concepts of “cycling” or “periodization.”

zh: 其实就是在训练期中调节强度，这就意味着训练有时容易，有时适中，有时很难。
en: These are just ways of varying intensity throughout the training year—meaning that training is sometimes easy, sometimes moderate, sometimes hard.

zh: 在健美与力量举训练中通常需要这样做，因为重量训练会刺激关节，损耗人体的免疫系统，但正确的自身体重训练不会如此。
en: This is often necessary in bodybuilding and powerlifting, because weight-training irritates the joints and depletes the body’s hormonal-immune system in a way that proper bodyweight work does not.

zh: 为什么要通过训练计划进行循序渐进的锻炼，这有个极好的理由，就是“训练势头”。
en: There is a damn good reason why you should proceed slowly and methodically through any training program.The reason has to do with generating training momentum.

zh: 简单地说，这意味着如果你在训练中更慢地向前推进，你实际上会比急于求成者更快达到目标。
en: Basically put, this means that if you build a head of steam by moving forwards more slowly, you’ll actually reach your goals much faster than if you proceeded with haste.

zh: 听着像悖论，但这就是事实。
en: This sounds like a paradox, but it’s true.

zh: 如果你通过举腿和深蹲系列培养了一定的力量基础，那么练习桥系列的前三式应该问题不大。
en: If you have built a base of strength with your leg raises and squats, these exercises will not pose much of a problem.

zh: 即使这样也不要急于求成，要培养而不要破坏训练的势头。
en: But don’t be in a rush.Build on your training momentum, don’t destroy it.

zh: 你不妨在桥系列中多花些时间，毕竟我们的脊柱极为珍贵，值得善待。
en: Take your time with these exercises more than any other; your spine is precious.Be kind to it.

zh: 众所周知，牙齿的两大功能是处理食物和抵挡迎面飞来的冰球。
en: Everybody knows the two primory things teeth are used for—eating and stopping hockey pucks.

zh: 但是也许会令你感到惊奇的是，牙齿还有一个功能，是其他身体外部器官都不具备的，那就是牙齿可以成为身体健康的“晴雨表”。
en: But what may surprise you is that your teeth can provide clues into your health like virtually no other outward part of your body.

zh: 为什么呢？
en: Why?

zh: 牙齿长到最后最要注意的不是蛀牙而是牙周疾病，它能够使你的生理年龄老上3.7岁。
en: The biggest concern when it comes to aging and your teeth isn't the presence of cavities; it's the presence of periodontal disease, which can make you up to 3.7 years older.

zh: 牙龈疾病（牙龈炎）与许多健康问题相关，引起牙周炎的病菌同样也会引发人体免疫系统的反应，造成动脉血管发炎硬化。
en: Gum disease (gingivitis) has been linked to many other health problems, presumably because the same bacteria that cause periodontal disease can also trigger an immune response that causes inflammation and hardening of the arteries.

zh: 众所周知，牙齿的两大功能是处理食物和抵挡迎面飞来的冰球。
en: Everybody knows the two primory things teeth are used for—eating and stopping hockey pucks.

zh: 但是也许会令你感到惊奇的是，牙齿还有一个功能，是其他身体外部器官都不具备的，那就是牙齿可以成为身体健康的“晴雨表“。
en: But what may surprise you is that your teeth can provide clues into your health like virtually no other outward part of your body.

zh: 为什么呢？
en: Why?

zh: 牙齿长到最后最要注意的不是蛀牙而是牙周疾病，它能够使你的生理年龄老上3.7岁。
en: The biggest concern when it comes to aging and your teeth isn't the presence of cavities; it's the presence of periodontal disease, which can make you up to 3.7 years older.

zh: 那么学习这些动作需要多长时间呢?
en: How long will it take to learn the movements?

zh: 根据年龄、运动背景、灵活性、受伤史等问题,这个过程大约需要一个月,或者也许几个月。
en: Depending on age, athletic background, mobility issues, and injury history, among other factors,this may take just a month.Or it may take a number of months.

zh: 当你第一次尝试火箭推(一个单独的爆发力动作,组合了颈前深蹲和过顶推举)、过顶深蹲或者严格的引体向上(体操运动员标准的全身引体向上)动作时,你也许会觉得力不从心。
en: The first time you try a thruster (a taxing combination of a front squat and overhead press into a single, explosive movement), an overhead squat, or a kipping pull-up (pull-ups with a gymnast’s full-body kip move), you might think you’re in over your head.

zh: 反正我开始也是这么认为的。
en: That’s what I thought, anyway.

zh: 但是如果你保持谦虚、耐心和坚持的态度,你会惊喜地发现身体的改变。
en: But if you remain humble, patient, and consistent, you will be surprised at how well your body responds.

zh: 麦肯齐抛弃了原来高碳水化合物的饮食方式，选择了能帮助他减少身体炎症发生的饮食方案。
en: MacKenzie dumped his high-carbohydrate diet and played with diets that helped reduce the body’s inflammation levels rather than jack them up.

zh: 他几乎利用了能用到的所有技术手段，包括心率监测仪、脉搏血氧计、高海拔帐篷、代谢测试和血液乳酸分析仪。
en: He used all the technologies he could get his hands on, from heart rate monitors to pulse oximeters, high-altitude tents, metabolic testing, and blood lactate analyzers.

zh: 麦肯齐还开始测试不同的跑步训练方案。
en: MacKenzie also began testing out different models of run training.

zh: 文献分析是研究形式中的一种。
en: An analysis of the literature is a part of all types of research.

zh: 学者总是觉察到许多过去事件，以及它们如何影响目前的研究。但是，有时候文献回顾本身就是一个研究，其用以分析、评估与整合已发表的文献。
en: The scholar is always however, the literature review stands by itself as a research paper that analyzes, aware of past events and how they influence current research.Sometimes, evaluates, and integrates the published literature.

zh: 以一个专有名词来形容，它可称为研究整合。
en: A term used to describe this is research synthesis.

zh: 此练习由捷克科学家扬达发明，故有此名。
en: Janda sit-ups are named after the Czech scientist who invented them.

zh: 扬达仰卧起坐与普通仰卧起坐的不同在于：整个动作中双脚用力向下压，同时又要使臀部与腘绳肌尽量收紧。
en: They are identical to normal sit-ups, with the exception that you press down hard on the floor with the soles of your feet throughout the exercise, while clenching your glutes and hamstrings as tightly as you can.

zh: 这样做仰卧起坐的用意是使艘部屈肌不动，因为从结构上看，髋部屈肌的位置与臀部和腘绳肌相对，这一理论被称为“交互抑制” 。
en: The thinking behind this says that doing your sit-ups this way takes the hip flexors out of the movement because the hip flexors are anatomically opposite the glutes and hamstrings.The underlying theory is called reciprocal inhibition.

zh: 经典而简单的动作，它可以训练你的中段与臀部。
en: A classic yet simple exercise which works the entire midsection and hips.

zh: 平躺在地上，双脚钩住坚固的物体，以髋部为轴向上弯曲身体。
en: Lie on the floor, hook your feet under something sturdy and bend at the hips.

zh: 仰卧起坐一直以来总是被指责为对脊柱有害，其实如果膝盖弯曲的角度合适，就不会有问题。
en: The sit-up has got a bad rap as being dangerous or the spine, but if you bend well at the knees this is a total fallacy.

zh: 双手不要放头后，否则可能会拉伤颈部，而是应该握拳置于太阳穴处，然后拉起上身，直到肘部接触膝盖。
en: Don’t put your hands behind your head, or you can strain the ligaments in your neck.Instead, put your fists to your temples and come up until your elbows touch your knees.

zh: 很多人说仰卧起坐并不能真的锻炼腹肌，但这些人显然并不做仰卧起坐。
en: I’ve read a lot of garbage saying that sit-ups don’t work the abdomen, but whoever writes this junk obviously isn’t doing sit-ups.

zh: 如果你把这个美丽的动作做上几百次，那么第二天你就可以感受到美妙的酸痛——从胸骨一直到骨盆。
en: A few hundred reps of this beauty will make your abs deliciously sore the next day, from sternum down to pelvis.

zh: 腰痛是青少年运动员最常见的主诉之一。
en: Low back pain is one of the most common complaints in young athletes.

zh: 腰部过伸的动作是引起腰痛的主要原因。

en: Activities that result in hyperextension of the back have all been cited as common aggravating activities that precipitate this condition.

zh: 这样的动作包括橄榄球运动中的阻截、举重的推举塌腰（Military press)、撑竿跳、跳水、投掷、体操和网球发球等动作（Jackson, 1979)。
en: These activities include football blocking, military press in weight-lifting, pole vaulting, diving, pitching, gymnastics and serving in tennis (Jackson, 1979).

zh: 人体高效的消化系统能从食物中提取出最多的能量。
en: Our remarkably efficient digestive system extracts the most calories possible.

zh: 这一过程从口腔中的颞下颌关节幵始。在咀嚼食物时，颞卜颌关节会松开，让咬肌能更用力地挤压食物。
en: The process starts in the mouth with a temporomandibular jaw (TMJ) joint that purposely dislocates during chewing in order to allow the masseter muscle to compress food more forcefully.

zh: 牙齿像拼图积木一样紧紧相合，确保没有漏嚼食物，令消化充分。
en: The teeth fit together like puzzle pieces to ensure that no morsel is left unchewed and underdigested.

zh: 经常咬紧牙关或颌骨太紧，往往造成颞下颌关节疼痛和头痛。
en: Clenching teeth and having a tight jaw often cause TMJ pain and headaches.

zh: 药球投射：这项练习可帮助改善灵活性、协调性和持久度。
en: Wall Ball: This exercise is a metabolic firestorm that develops mobility, coordination, and stamina.

zh: 双手在下方拖住药球，使药球位于下巴下方、胸部上方。
en: Place your hands underneath a medicine ball and center it beneath your chin and against your chest.

zh: 像做颈前深蹲一样下蹲，腹股沟(髋部折痕)保持在膝盖水平面以下，然后用躯干发力起身，顺势推起药球。
en: Drop down as if performing a front squat, with your hip crease passing beneath the plane of your knees, then explode upward, powering the ball with the momentum generated by your trunk.

zh: 完全展开身体后，将药球推向空中，瞄准建筑或墙壁的标记位置，一般是离地面3米的高度。
en: After full extension, press the ball into the air, shooting for a mark on a building or wall, 10 feet above the ground.

zh: 接住回弹下落的药球，按照同样的路径回到深蹲的位置，这样视为完成一次动作。重复此动作。
en: Catch the ball on the rebound and retrace the same pathway back to the bottom of the squat for 1 rep. Repeat.

zh: 神经细胞利用化学信息彼此交流。
en: Neurons communicate with one another using chemical messages.

zh: 以抑郁症为例，一个神经细胞发送信息（前突触），将肾上腺皮质激素传递出去，另一个细胞“捉住”这种化学物质，将信息传播下去（后突触）。
en: In one model of depression, serotonin is passed from the cell sending a message (presynaptic) to a cell that can atchff the chemical and propagate the information (postsynaptic).

zh: 如果将肾上腺皮质激素击走（与棒球运动类似：接手接不住棒球，球就会被击球手击出去），人就会感到抑郁。
en: If something bats the serotonin away, you feel more depressed.

zh: 如果能增加肾上腺皮质激素分泌接收，那么就会刺激更多的后突触神经细胞，人的抑郁感就会减少。许多治疗抑郁症的药物都是依据这种原理研制成功的。
en: If something increases the serotonin that is released and received, then more postsynaptic cells are excited and the less depressed you (eel. Many medications work in this way).

zh: 叶黄素 是一种在玉米、菠菜和其他一些绿叶疏菜中发现的物质。人们发现这是一种对维持视力和加强眼部健康最有益的物质之一。
en: LUTEIN It's a substance that's found in corn, spinach, and other leafy green vegetables, and it's been found to be one of the substances most beneficial for main taining sight and improving the health of your eyes.

zh: 我们不确定有多少沖选择方法对于减慢衰老发挥作用，我们只知道 它们的确在起作用，叶黄素就是这类物质之一。
en: We're not sure how many choices work to slow or reverse aging, just that they do—and lutein is one of the things that falls into that category.

zh: 叶酸是维生素B族的一种。医生们经常给孕妇幵这沖药，因为它对于胎儿的大脑和脊髓的正常发育是十分重要的。
en: Folate or folic acid, which is part of the B complex of vitamins, is often prescribed for pregnant women because it's essential for the normal development of the brain and spinal cord of the fetus.

zh: 但是如果母亲开始摄入叶酸以防止胎儿脊柱裂 (一种先天性缺陷），研究发现这样做也降低了儿童时期的癌症发病率60%。
en: But when mothers started taking folate to prevent spina bifida (a specific birth defect), we also saw a 60 percent reduction in childhood cancers.

zh: 人体所有动脉受到一种称为一氧化氮的气体作用，血管会扩张，这种气体滞留在人体内的时间很短。
en: All of your arteries are dilated by a short-lived gas called nitric oxide.

zh: 一旦一氧化氮消解，人体又迅速地制造出新的一氧化氮。但动脉硬化会减缓这一进程。
en: You continue to make this gas as quickly as it dissolves—unless the hardening of your arteries slows the process.

zh: 人体缺乏足量的一氧化氮，动脉无法张开，在人行走或运动时无法给心脏或腿部提供足够的能量。
en: Without enough nitric oxide, your arteries are unable to open up and feed more energy to your heart or your legs when you walk or exercise.

zh: 糖尿病不是一个病，而是有多种不同原因的一个综合征。
en: Diabetes mellitus is not a disease, but a syndrome with a number of different causes.

zh: 高血糖症和糖尿是临床上的特点。
en: Clinically, it is characterized by hyperglycaemia and glycosuria.

zh: 如果不经过治疗，会发展为酸中毒和酮中毒（酮症），脱水，昏迷和死亡。
en: If untreated, it may progress to acidosis and ketosis, dehydration, coma and death.

zh: 少年糖尿病是胰腺β-细胞内源性胰岛素供应不足引起的，所以要用胰岛素进行治疗。
en: Diabetes of juvenile onset is usually due to a deficiency in the endogenous supply of insulin by the pancreatic (β-cells and should therefore be treated by the administration of insulin.

zh: 胰岛素依赖型糖尿病(insulin -dependent diabetes mellitus，HDDM)现在称为I型糖尿病。
en: Insulin-dependent diabetes mellitus (IDDM) is now called type I diabetes.

zh: β-细胞的完全衰竭要经过数年的时间。
en: Total exhaustion of the (β-cells, however, may take several years.

zh: 膜岛素浓度较高时，除胰岛素自身因素外，有其他因素介入到体力活动时增强葡萄糖耐量的调节中去：1.血流动力学改变（Garratt ef al.， 1972； Hespel et al., 1995)。2.
en: At higher insulin concentrations, other factors than insulin itself were implicated in the increased glucose tolerance during physical activity:1 Haemodynamic changes (Garratt et al., 1972; Hespel et al., 1995).2

zh: 除胰岛素以外的体液因子的活性，如胰岛素样生长因子-1 (IGF-1 (Couturier ei al.，1971)。3.
en: Activity of humoral factors other than insulin such as insulin-like growth factor-i (IGF-i) (Couturier el al., 1971).3

zh: 激肽（kinins)和前列腺素 (prostaglandins)的参与（Dietze, 1982)。4.
en: Involvement of kinins and prostaglandins (Dietze, 1982).4

zh: 胰岛素受体的敏感性和数量的改变（Soman ei al.，1979; Pedersen et al.， 1980; Bonen et al.，1985)。
en: Modifications of the sensitivity and number of insulin receptors (Somanet al., 1979; Pedersen et al., 1980; Bonen et al., 1985).5

zh: 5.骨豁肌葡萄糖载体（glucose transporters, GLUT4)的激活（Bonadonna et al.，1993)。
en: Activation of skeletal muscle glucose transporters (GLUT4) (Bonadonna et al., 1993).

zh: 糖尿病不是一个病，而是有多种不同原因的一个综合征。
en: Diabetes mellitus is not a disease, but a syndrome with a number of different causes.

zh: 高血糖症和糖尿是临床上的特点。
en: Clinically, it is characterized by hyperglycaemia and glycosuria.

zh: 如果不经过治疗，会发展为酸中毒和酮中毒（酮症），脱水，昏迷和死亡。
en: If untreated, it may progress to acidosis and ketosis, dehydration, coma and death.

zh: 少年糖尿病是胰腺β-细胞内源性胰岛素供应不足引起的，所以要用胰岛素进行治疗。
en: Diabetes of juvenile onset is usually due to a deficiency in the endogenous supply of insulin by the pancreatic (β-cells and should therefore be treated by the administration of insulin.

zh: 胰岛素依赖型糖尿病(insulin -dependent diabetes mellitus，HDDM)现在称为I型糖尿病。
en: Insulin-dependent diabetes mellitus (IDDM) is now called type I diabetes.

zh: β-细胞的完全衰竭要经过数年的时间。
en: Total exhaustion of the (β-cells, however, may take several years.

zh: 如果儿童不能下咽糖，家庭成员或学校职工应予肌肉注射或皮下注射胰高血糖素 (glucagon), 10岁以下儿童的剂量为0.5 mg, 10岁以上给全剂量1mg。
en: If the child is unable to swallow sugar, a member of the family or school staff should inject glucagon i.m .or s.c.( < 10 years of age: 0.5 mg; > 10 years of age: 1 mg = full dose).

zh: 注射后，神志在5-10分钟内恢复，但胰高血糖素可引起头痛和恶心。
en: Consciousness returns within 5-10 min but glucagon may provoke headache and nausea.

zh: 现有一种新的胰高血糖素，经鼻给药法。
en: A new device is being produced for nasal administration of glucagon.

zh: 如果用胰高血糖素无效，必须静脉注入高渗葡萄糖溶液。
en: If glucagonis ineffective, hypertonic glucose solution must be given i.v .

zh: 已经制定了年龄和性别特有的标准，可以将家长身高的遗传因素与其他影响儿童线性生长的因素（如营养不良和疾病）区别开来。
en: Age- and sex-specific standards have been developed to separate the genetic contribution of parental stature from other factors that affect a child's linear growth, such as malnutrition or disease.

zh: 一个儿童的实际身高可用其家长身高的平均值加以校正。
en: A child's actual height can be adjusted with a factor derived from the average of each parent's height.

zh: 这个方法是用 来评估按年龄要求的身高低于第5百分位的儿童（Garm & Rohmann, 1966; Himes et al., 1985)。
en: This method is recommended for evaluating children whose height for age is less that the 5th percentile (Garm & Rohmann, 1966; Himes et al., 1985).

zh: 大多数女孩看医生只是为了放心。
en: Most girls will require only reassurance.

zh: 如果需要治疗，通常是用促性腺性类固醇激素治疗，每天5-20μg，治疗几个月。最常用的是每天0.3-0.6mg符合雌性激素或乙基雌二醇。
en: If therapy is needed, it is usually with gonadal steroid hormones, often 0.3—0.6mg daily conjugated equine oestrogens or ethinyl oestradiol, 5—20 μg daily for several months.

zh: 已知组间差异法(known group difference method) 有时会被用来建立构念效度。
en: The known group difference method is sometimes used in establishing construct validity.

zh: 例如无氧运动能力测验的构念效度可以藉由比较短跑与跳远选手和长跑选手的测验得分来证明。
en: For example, construct validity of a test of anaerobic power could be demonstrated by comparing the test scores of sprinters and jumpers with those of distance runners.

zh: 短跑与跳远比长跑要求更高的无氧运动能力。
en: Sprinting and jumping require greater anaerobic power than distance running does.

zh: 因此 ,施测者可以了解此测验是否可以区分两种不同运动类型选手的表现。
en: Therefore, the tester could determine whether the test differentiates between the two kinds of track performers.

zh: 如果短跑与跳远选手的得分显著的高于长跑选手,则可以某程度的证明此测验的确测量到无氧运动能力。
en: If the sprinters and jumpers score significantly better than the distance runners do, this finding would provide some evidence that the test measures anaerobic power.

zh: 我们以基本概念做为我们所要涵盖介绍的铳计方法之开端，例如测量集中趋势、变异性和常态分布等。
en: We began our coverage of statistical techniques with basic concepts such as measures of central tendency, variability, and normal distribution.

zh: 请记得统计分析能做的两件事：建立显著性以及评估其意义。
en: Remember that statistics can do two things: establish significance and assess meaningfulness.

zh: 显著性是指一个关联或差异是可信的一当同一研究被重复执待时，你可以预期同样的关联或差异再次发生。
en: Significance means that a relationship or difference is reliable— that you could expect it to happen again if the study were repeated.

zh: 而意义性则是关于结果的重要性。
en: Meaningfulness refers to the importance of the results.

zh: 我们大多知道阴茎和阴道的关系——阴茎是停在阴道车库里的汽车。
en: Most of us know the relationship between the penis and vagina—the penis is the car that parks in the vaginal garage.

zh: 然而汽车一旦在车道上熄火，你是没法把它开到车库里的；如果车库大门紧闭，也一样毫无办法开进去。
en: But if the car breaks down in the driveway, you can't pull it into the garage.Ditto if the garage door is jammed shut.

zh: 我们需要圆满实现两性结合的力量，就男性和女性而言（尤其是男性），没有高质量的血流状况，一切都是空谈。当然魅力是实现这一目标的第一步。
en: You need power to consummate the relationship.In the case of both men and women (especially men), nothing works without high-quality blood flow, and that starts with attraction.

zh: 这些变化是为了让子宮一次次地做好卵子与精子结合的准备。子宫通过收缩，脱去多余的子宮组织，雌性激素和孕激素共同控制调节这个过程，这就是月经。
en: Those changes direct the process that prepares the uterus for the next circle, when an egg will be available, bu sloughing excess uterine tissue through contrations of the uterus.

zh: 它会引起阴道流血和人体激素含量的变化，影响女性处理生活压力的态度。
en: That's the process of menstruation, which causes vaginal bleeding, as well as harmonal changes that affect the way women deal with life and stress.

zh: 子宫或阴道异常一般是畸形综合征的一个部分，包括骨骼和肾脏系统的异常——罗-库-豪综合征最为常见的。
en: Often uterus or vaginal anomalies are part of a syndrome of malformations including abnormalities of the skeletal and renal systems——the Rokitansky-Kuster-Hauser syndrome is the most common.

zh: 最简单的障碍是无孔处女膜阻止子宫黏液和内膜血液的流出。
en: The simplest single disorder is that of the imperforate hymen, which does not permit the outward passage of uterine mucous and endometrial blood.

zh: 这些液体积聚造成阴道积水或阴道子宫积水  并使处女膜膨出和（或）引起每月发作的腹部疼痛。
en: These accumulate in the vagina (hydrocolpos) or uterus (hydrometro-colpos) and produce a bulging hymen; and/or one may elicit a vague history of abdominal pain that may have monthly excerbations.

zh: 我们大多知道阴茎和阴道的关系——阴茎是停在阴道车库的汽车。
en: Most of us know the relationship between the penis and vagina—the penis is the car that parks in the vaginal garage.

zh: 然而汽车一旦在车道上熄火，你是没法把它开到车库里的;如果车库大门紧闭，也一样毫无办法开进去。
en: But if the car breaks down in the driveway, you can't pull it into the garage.Ditto if the garage door is jammed shut.

zh: 我们需要圆满实现两性结合的力量，就男性和女性而言（尤其是男性），没有高质量的血流状况，一切都是空谈。当然魅力是实现这一目标的第一步。
en: You need power to consummate the relationship.In the case of both men and women (especially men), nothing works without high-quality blood flow, and that starts with attraction.

zh: 不管你对自重训练的看法如何，有一点毋庸置疑，那就是引体向上很酷。
en: No matter what your opinion of bodyweight training, there’s no denying it—pullups are cool.

zh: 谁看到《洛奇2》里史泰龙在攀缘架上咬紧牙关练习偏重引体向上时不会热血沸腾呢？
en: Who wasn’t inspired watching Sylvester Stallone, jaw clenched, performing uneven pullups from that climbing frame in Rocky II?

zh: 也许我个人更喜欢《终结者2》里的一幕——干练的琳达·汉密尔顿（Linda·Hamilton）在立起的铁床上做了一个引体向上。
en: Perhaps my personal favorite example from the movies was the sight of a very lean and mean Linda Hamilton cranking out pullups from the legs of her upturned metal bunk in Terminator 2.

zh: 我还记得，我刚进监狱不久时，看见一个头发花白的黑人囚徒在囚室门上做单臂引体向上，我发誓也要学会这个看似不可思议的动作。
en: I can remember, years back when I was new to prison, seeing a grey-haired black veteran inmate doing one-arm pullups from the door of his cell, and vowing that one day I would learn how perform such a seemingly impossible technique.

zh: 印度摔跤手练习这个动作已有数百年的历史。
en: This is an exercise used by Indian wrestlers for centuries.

zh: 双腿分开，与肩同宽或略宽。下蹲，成蹲坐姿势，下蹲过程中抬起脚跟。
en: With your feet shoulder width apart or a little wider, drop down onto your haunches, raising your heels as you do so.

zh: 到最低点后，不要停顿，立即靠腿部发力，将自己推起，与此同时脚跟放下。
en: Immediately—with no pause—push yourself back up using leg power, rocking back on your heels as you go.

zh: 随着脚跟抬起和放下，身体重心会上下前后地移动，这种踩跷跷板一样的节奏使得该动作的速度和爆发力比普通深蹲中的大。
en: This rocking movement back and forwards on the heels generates a kind of see-saw type rhythm as your center of gravity shifts forwards and back, up and down.This rhythm in turn encourages greater speed, greater explosiveness than in usual squats.

zh: 与一般深蹲不同，弹震式动作其实是印度深蹲的核心。
en: Unlike regular squats, this ballistic performance is actually a core element of Hindu squats.

zh: 在印度深蹲过程中，随着动作轻轻挥动手臂，有助于产生和保持节奏。
en: Finding a way to gently swing your arms in tune with the movement will help cultivate and maintain the rhythm.

zh: 在该动作最高点和最低点都不要暂停——你需要连续做动作。
en: Don’t pause at the bottom or the top, you need constant movement.

zh: 第二种需引起注意的青少年运动员足部应力性骨折是第五跖骨部基底骨折。
en: The second site of difficult stress fracture in the foot in young athletes is that of the base of the 5th metatarsal.

zh: 同样，此类骨折也通常是在其完全发生后才能作出诊断。
en: Once again, these stressfractures are often detected late after they have become fully established.

zh: 此骨折也不易愈合，有时需要在第5跖骨近1 / 3处内固定才能获较好的愈合效果。青少年运动员长期训练而容易发生的应力性骨折的部位包括第二跖骨近端，以及较为熟知的跖骨干骨折。
en: This is a slow healing bone, sometimes requiring internal fixation to attain satisfactory union of the stress fractures in the proxim al third of the 5th metatarsal.Other special stress fractures have been encountered in young athletes undergoing repetitive training, including stress fractures of the proximal 2nd metatarsal, as well as the shaft of the metatarsal which is much better known.

zh: 在约束踏车转速、确保车座和车把设置标准化的情况下，测试-再测试的可靠性会进一步提高。
en: The test-retest reliability will be enhanced by stipulation of pedalling rate and ensuring standardization in regard to seat and handlebar settings.

zh: 表35.4列举 了在一些研究中的可靠性和推荐的踏车频率。
en: Table 35.4 shows few studies that have reported reliability or recommended pedalling frequencies.

zh: 对于跑台和功率车试验，确保10岁以下儿童的气阀和嘴罩的死腔小并不超出55ml就能提高有效性和可靠性。
en: For both treadmill and cycle ergometer testing, validity and reliability will be enhanced by ensuring the dead space of the valve and mouthpiece is small and does not exceed 55ml for children under 10 years of age.

zh: 在进行儿童有氧能力测试之前，必须先对“有氧功率”和“有氧能力”术语之间的区别有所了解。
en: Prior to considering the different methods for measuring aerobic performance in children, a distinction should be made between the terms 'aerobic power' and 'aerobic capacity'.

zh: 有氧功率是指以氧化代谢过程为主产生能量的最大速率。
en: Aerobic power refers to the maximal rate at which energy can be produced by predominantly oxidative processes.

zh: 因此，最大有氧功率是单位时间内能够消耗的最大的氧气量（Thoden，1991)。
en: Maximum aerobic power is, therefore, the maximum amount of oxygen that can be consumed per unit of time (Thoden, 1991).

zh: 心肺训练可以减脂，同时它还是用于提高有氧运动能力的最佳方法。有氧运动需要消耗氧气。
en: While cardio training is most often associated with fat loss, it is also the best way to improve aerobic capacity, which is the ability to use oxygen to fuel exercise activity.

zh: 在低中等强度的运动中，体能源自于氧气、碳水化合物基质和脂肪。
en: During low- to moderate-intensity exercise, muscles rely on energy from a combination of oxygen and the substrates of carbohydrates and fats.

zh: 运动量越大，消耗的氧气也越多。
en: The more oxygen that can be consumed, the more physical work an individual will be able to do.

zh: 鱼油和坚果能够有效减轻疼痛，对保持关节长期正常运作有效果。
en: Fish oil and nuts are a great way to reduce pain and to keep your joints functioning for the long term.

zh: 通过体育锻炼使骨骼周围或连接骨骼的肌肉和关节紧张，能达到强健骨骼的目的。
en: You strengthen your bones by doing exercises that stress the muscles and joints that surround them or connect them.

zh: 维生素D和钙质对两性同样重要。
en: Vitamin D and calcium are important as well for both men and women.

zh: 在决定该使用哪个预测变项(或预测变项集)时，标准统计学程序包提供了数个选项。
en: In deciding which predictors (or sets of predictors) to use, standard statistical packages offer several options.

zh: 表8.3包含最常见的选择法。
en: Table 8.3 includes the most common procedures.

zh: 其中一个选项是使用每一个预测变项；然而，如果能够用越少的变项来获得良好预测的话，那麽该预测方程式就越具效益且价值性。
en: One option is simply to use all the predictor variables.But the fewer that can be used while still obtaining a good prediction, the more economical and valuable the prediction equation is.

zh: 日常的体力活动是与一个人每天活动的数量有关，是以热量作为测量单位的。
en: Habitual physical activity concerns the amount of movement an individual engages in on a daily basis, measured in terms of caloric output.

zh: 而身体素质说明的是一个人在完成运动能力测试时的表现水平。
en: Physical fitness, on the other hand, indicates how well one performs on motor tasks.

zh: 其测量指标取决于涉及到的测试活动内容 (45m冲刺的时间，投掷垒球的距离，仰卧起坐的次数等）。
en: Its measurement depends on the activity involved (time on a 45-m sprint, distance throwing a baseball, number of sit-ups, etc.).

zh: 很可能二者对不同的 健康状况都是重要的（Rowland, 1990)。
en: Probably both are important to different health outcomes (Rowland, 1990).

zh: 预防肥胖显然是与热量的消耗（体力活动）有关。而慢性背部疾患可以通过加强肌肉张力和力量（身体素质）来治疗。
en: Prevention of obesity is clearly related to caloric expenditure (physical activity), while chronic back disease might be forestalled by good muscle tone and strength (physical fitness).

zh: 体育学、肌动学、运动科学与竞赛科学已有数千篇的研究在探讨研究方法上会导致研究缺乏效度的错误。
en: Physical education, kinesiology, exercise science, and sport science have produced thousands of studies in which the discussions centered on methodological faults that caused the research to lack validity.

zh: 值得再提的是，对于不适当的结果，事后归咎于方法学，是不可被接受的。
en: It is worth repeating that placing post hoc blame on the methodology for inadequate results is unacceptable.

zh: 每一个学位论文必须呈现预试实验(pilot work)，方能证明所有器材与步骤都能针对实验所预期的参与者类型产生作用。
en: Every thesis or dissertation proposal should present pilot work that verifies that all instruments and procedures will function as specified on the type of participants for which the research is intended.

zh: 体育运动员受伤，大多会成为媒体报道的头条新闻。女性运动员前卜字韧带撕裂的几率是男性运动员的8倍。女性膝部的生理结构较男性松散，女性的骨骼也从整体上比男性脆弱，这就对稳定性造成了负面影响， 致使女性的韧带更易于撕裂。
en: Athletes get all the headlines when they get injured, but women are up to eight times more likely than men to tear their ACL The looser construction of the female knee—ond overall weaker skeleton—can compromise stability and predispose women to ligament tears.

zh: 韧带受伤还与月经前后的雌性激素含量变化有一定联系，因此在高中、大学、娱乐界和职业的运动员中，女性韧带撕裂的情况远远多于男性。
en: The injuries are also linked to hormonal changes around the time of menstruation, so female high school, collegiate, recreational, and professional athletes end up suffering many more tears than men do.

zh: 毫无疑问，在已经来月经的妇女和动物模型中，过分限制食物的摄入量和过量的运动训练会影响促性腺释放激素（gonadotrophin-releasing hormone, GnRH)的脉冲性释放，从而进一步影响到促黄体生成激素（luteinizing hormone, LH)。
en: There is no doubt that suppressive food restriction and excessive exercise has an effect on the pulsatile release of gonadotrophin-releasing hormone (GnRH) and hence on luteinizing hormone (LH) in postmenarcheal women and animal models.

zh: 相反，身体脂肪和促性腺释放激素脉冲发生源之间可能存在联系的假设看起来还不足以说明如此巨大的影响 (Bronson & Manning, 1991)。
en: In contrast, the potential links between body fat and the GnRH pulse generator that have been postulated so far seem too subtle to account for such robust effects (Bronson & M anning, 1991).

zh: 因而，虽然女运动员比非运动员月经初潮发生得晚，但是运动训练“延缓”月经初潮产生的看 法仍然有待证实（Loucks oZ., 1992)。
en: Thus, although menarche occurs later in female athletes than in nonathletes, it has yet to be shown that training 'delays' menarche in anyone (Loucks et al.,19 9 2 ).

zh: 运动残疾是很难加以界定的，因为许多先天的和后天的损害都应该包含在内。
en: Motor disability is a difficult construct to define since many congenital and acquired impairments should be included.

zh: 此外，定义还必须包括急性和慢性的残疾。
en: In addition, the definition must include disabilities that are classified as acute or chronic.

zh: 本章讨论的是一系列的永久性残疾，它们如何影响儿童的运动能力以及残障儿童在什么水平上能够胜任运动。
en: It is the purpose of this discussion to examine a series of perm anent disabilities, how they affect a child's abilities to perform and the level at which he or she may perform in a sport environment.

zh: 因此，在本章中，我们将运动残疾视为因先天因素、慢性退行性疾病或创伤引起的运动能暂时性或永久性的减弱。
en: Hence, for the purpose of this chapter, we will consider a motor disability as temporary or permanent decrements in physical performance, motor capabilities and/or potential due to congenital factors, chronic degenerative disease or traumatic injury.

zh: 但是，再一次说明，生物发展的节奏并不与年代顺序时间密切配合。生物钟主要受遗传因素影响。
en: But, once again, the tempo of biological development is not closely attuned to chronological time.Here, the biological clock is set largely by genetic factors.

zh: 在儿童时期，这个过程的发展速度个体间会有非常巨大的差异。
en: The rate of this process during the course of the childhood years can vary dramatically among children.

zh: 因此，在任何特定的实足年龄，你可以看到在身材、结构、生理功能、运动技能、个性，以及积极性等方面的巨大差异。
en: Thus, at any given chronological age, you may witness wide differences in body size, composition, physiological function, motor skill, personality, and motivation.

zh: 如果一天当中训练的生理反应的变化是有节奏的，那么选择这些时间去追踪会是有益的吗？
en: If physiological responses to training vary rhythmically during the course of a day, would it be rewarding to select these times to head to the track?

zh: 如果教练认为高的划水频率在一个特定的游泳比赛中会更好，运动员就应该这样做吗？
en: If a coach thinks that a high stroke count leads to a better time in a particular swimming event, should the athlete go with it?

zh: 还是应该坚持直观感觉的更标准的节奏，即让大脑中的潜意识控制划水节奏？
en: Or is it better to stick to a cadence that feels intuitively more normal—one directed by a subconscious controller of stroke tempo in the brain?

zh: 事先说明，这些问题的答案不是很明显。
en: Be forewarned that the answers to such questions are not obvious.

zh: 或许这就是让体育如此辉煌的部分原因吧。
en: Perhaps that is part of what makes sports so glorious.

zh: 精确的身体运动控制器、运动员的经验和决策，所有的一切混杂在一起来决定运动员的成功。
en: The wisdom of the body’s motor controllers that tick to an intrinsic clock.The athlete’s experience and decision making.All of this coming together in a fascinating mélange that dictates athletic success.

zh: 这种选择有可能是由运动员本人、家长、教练员、有影响的其他人或由这些人共同决定的。
en: The selection may be made by the individual, parents, coach, influential others or some combination of these.

zh: 而且，提早发育本身就与生长有关，而二者又都与运动能力联系着的。
en: Further, earlier maturation is intrinsically related to growth in size and both are associated with performance.

zh: 最后，运动能力不仅受到生物本性的影响，还受很多其他因素的影响。
en: Finally, athletic performance is influenced by many factors other than those of a biological nature.

zh: 有时，为了追求运动能力而忽视健康的营养。
en: Sometimes, healthy nutritional practices are disregarded in the pursuit of athletic prowess.

zh: 人们的重点是放在将儿童培养成好运动员，而不是将他（她）培养成为快乐的、健康的人。
en: The emphasis may be on what will make the child a better athlete, rather than what will make him or her a happy, healthy human being.

zh: 这种情况的部分原因可能是因为家长和教练员没有充分了解儿童发育成熟的阶段、营养需求、情绪和身体能力的信息。
en: This may be in part because parents and coaches are not well informed about the child's stage of maturation, nutritional needs, emotions and/or physical ability.

zh: 呼吸道的热量丢失和空气过冷是运动性支气管痉挛的机制之一。
en: One of the mechanisms which explainexercise-induced bronchoconstriction involves respiratory heat loss and airway cooling.

zh: 当吸入空气是冷的时候，在儿童和成年人中发生支气管痉挛的机会就增加（Strauss et al., 1977）。
en: When the inspired air is cold, there is an increase in its prevalence among children and adults (Strauss et al., 1977).

zh: 因此，在冷环境中运动时应该尽可能用鼻子呼吸。
en: Thus, it is recommended when possible to breathe through the nose during exercise in the cold.

zh: 如果选择重复量数ANOVA(在我们看来,是最好的选择），请密切注意我们在第9章对于重复量数单因子与多因子议题的讨论。
en: If you choose a repeated-measures ANOVA for this design (in our opinion, the best choice), pay close attention to our discussion of univariate and multivariate issues in repeated measures in chapter 9.

zh: 另一个选择是简单ANCOVA，使用各组的前测数据(01与03)来调整后测数据（02与04)，要记得有些问题牵涉到使用前测作为共变量（请参阅第9章有关ANCOVA的讨论）。
en: Another choice is simple ANCOVA, using the pretest for each group (Ol and 03) to adjust the posttest (02 and 04).Recall that some problems are associated with using the pretest as a covariate (see the discussion of ANCOVA in chapter 9).

zh: 最后，实验者可以将每位研究对象的后测值减去前测值(称为差异分数，difference score或增加的分数，gain score)，然后进行简单ANOVA (或是只有两组的时候，使用独立样本，考验），将每位研究对象的差异分数作为自变项。
en: Finally, the experimenter could subtract each participant’s pretest value from the posttest value (called a difference, or gain score) and perform a simple ANOVA (or, with only two groups, an independent t test), using each participant’s difference score as the dependent variable.

zh: 这些技术都有各自的优点和缺点，但读者在文献中会看到三种都被使用过。
en: Each of these techniques has strengths and weaknesses, but you will find all three used in the literature.

zh: 找一面墙，双手手掌平放在距离墙根约15到25厘米的地面上，但双手（尤其是两个食指）要互相接触。
en: Locate a solid wall and place your hands on the ground six to ten inches out from it.Your hands—specifically the index fingers—should be touching.

zh: 蹬起成倒立姿势，双臂伸直，脚跟与墙壁接触，身体微微弯曲。
en: Kick up into a handstand with straight arms and a lightly curved body tapering back to where the heels make contact with the wall.

zh: 这是窄距倒立撑的起始姿势（图117）。
en: This is the start position of the close handstand pushup (fig. 117).

zh: 在窄距深蹲过程中，直立，双脚脚跟相碰，脚尖微微向外，双臂前伸。
en: In the close squats, stand up straight with your heels together, toes angled out very slightly.Your arms should be straight out in front of your chest.

zh: 弯曲膝盖和髋部，直到大腿后侧紧贴小腿，无法蹲得更低为止。
en: Bend at the knees and hips until your hamstrings are resting on your calves and you can go no further.

zh: 此时，你的胸部应该紧贴大腿。
en: Your chest will be pressed into your thighs .

zh: 注意，脚跟始终不要抬离地面。
en: Do not raise the heels.

zh: 为避免后倾，你得收缩胫骨肌肉使身体微微前倾。
en: To prevent yourself from tipping backwards, you may have to flex your shins to pull your toes up so that you ease forwards.

zh: 保持这一姿势，然后仅靠腿部发力将自己推回到起始姿势。
en: Return to the start position using leg power only.

zh: 向上跳起抓住横杆，采用正握姿势，双手尽量挨在一起——如果距离太近关节会感到不适，但最宽也不要超过10厘米。
en: Jump up and grab a bar with an overhand grip.Your hands should be next to each other—fourinches apart at the maximum, if a very close grip irritates your joints.

zh: 双膝弯曲，双脚脚踝交叠在一起并置于身后，以免腿部借力。
en: Bend at the knees with your ankles looped behind your vertical plane to keep them out of the motion.

zh: 肘部微微弯曲，双肩收紧。
en: Kink the elbows very slightly and keep your shoulders tight.

zh: 弯曲肘部，夹起肩部，平缓地将自己拉起来，直到下巴高过横杆。
en: Bend at the elbows and shoulders to raise your body, slowly levering yourself up until your chin passes the bar.

zh: 暂停一下，然后再慢慢放低身体，回到起始姿势。
en: Pause for a count of one, before slowly lowering yourself back down to the start position.

zh: 暂停，然后再重复。
en: Pause and repeat.

zh: 整个窄距引体向上过程中，腿部尽量保持不动。
en: In the process of the close pullups, try to minimize leg movement during the set.

zh: 胶原蛋白在骨骼内是被矿物化成很有秩序的两种类型的组织：骨皮质成分(cortical component)和骨小梁成分(trabucular component)。
en: The collagen in bone is m ineralized in an ordered fashion to form two types of skeletal tissue: cortical and trabecular.

zh: 骨皮质是致密的组织，形成所有骨骼的外表和长骨的轴心。
en: The cortical component is the densely' compacted tissue forming the outer surface of all bones and the shafts of the long bones.

zh: 在椎体、小骨和长骨的骨骺端，骨小梁在骨皮质内形成很薄的骨性小盘的网络或架子。
en: The trabecular component forms a mesh work of thin, bony plates or scaffolding found inside the cortical shell in the vertebral bodies, the small bones and the metaphyses of long bones.

zh: 本章利用英国媒体报道来理解“ 吐血门” 是如何发生的，又是如何被话语框架建构的，那些参与者以及目睹丑闻被层层揭露的其他人的反应如何。
en: This chapter uses British media reports to understand how Bloodgate could have occurred, was discursively framed, and was reacted to by those involved and others watching the scandal unfold.

zh: 利用《文明的历程》( Civilimg Process)和《掌控羞耻感》(Master Emotion of Shame) 中的过程概念(E lia s, 1978 ； Kilminster, 2 0 0 7 ) ，本章论证了媒体如何认定“ 吐血门” 的罪魁祸首是现代职业英式橄榄球的气质而不是某一个具体的个人本身。
en: Using figurational notions of the civilimg process and the master emotion of shame (Elias, 1978; Kilminster, 2007), the chapter demonstrates how the media identified the main culprit in the Bloodgate scandal as being the ethos of modern professional rugby rather than any specific individual per se.

zh: 本章同时也考量了英式橄榄球联盟的结构价值和侧重点迈向一种制度化欺骗和腐败的文化形态的历史变迁。
en: It also considers the historical shift in the value structures and emphases of rugby union towards a cultural form conducive to institutionalized cheating and corruption.

zh: 脚趾平放在地面上，弯腰，双手撑在身体前方的地面上，此时臀部大约成直角。
en: With your toes flat on the floor, place your palms on the ground at some point in front of you so that you are bent approximately ninety degrees at the hips.

zh: （这个变式被称为折刀俯卧撑，就是因为训练者的身体看上去像一把打开的小折刀。
en: (This angle is called the jackknife pushup, because your body resembles an opening pocket knife.)

zh: ）双手大约与肩同宽，上半身挺直，膝关节微微弯曲。
en: Your hands should be about shoulder width apart, and despite the angle at the hips, your torso should be straight.

zh: 弯曲手臂，肩部下沉，放低身体，直到下巴轻触双手之间的地面。
en: Retain a gentle bend at the knee.Bending at the arms and shoulders, lower your chin until it kisses the floor at a point between your hands.

zh: 然后，髋部慢慢下降划过地面，下巴继续向前划出一条弧线，直到双臂和双腿伸直，此时肩部高于髋部。
en: Now continue moving your chin in an upwards arc, as your hips drop to brush the ground.You should finish the movement with your arms and legs straight, your shoulders high and your hips low.

zh: 双臂保持伸直的状态，臀部向后撅起回到起始姿势，重复练习。
en: Keeping your arms straight, push your butt out and back until you are in the starting position again,and repeat.

zh: 尽管这个变式中的弯曲和伸展动作可以练出强大、柔韧的髋部，但对上身肌肉来说，该练习比标准俯卧撑更容易。
en: This exercise is easier on the upper body muscles than regular pushups, although the jackknife bending and straightening motion builds strong, flexible hips.

zh: 因此，它在武术家和摔跤运动员中十分流行。
en: For this reason, the exercise is popular with martial artists and wrestlers.

zh: 该练习有时也被称为猫式俯卧撑。
en: Sometimes this exercise is known as a cat pushup.

zh: 站在一个稳固的物体前，此物体的高度大约与你的膝盖等高，至少也要达到胫骨上部，小咖啡桌、椅子、床铺都是不错的选择。
en: Stand in front of a sturdy object which comes up to your knees, or at least the tops of your shins.A small coffee table, chair or a bunk are good choices.

zh: 双腿分开，与肩同宽或略宽。
en: Your legs should be shoulder width apart, or a little wider.

zh: 双腿伸直，弯腰俯身，直到双手与面前的物体接触。
en: Keeping your legs fairly straight, bend at your hips until your palms are in contact with the object.

zh: 身体前倾，使一部分体重落在双手上。
en: Tilt forwards slightly so that you can take some of your body’s weight through your hands.

zh: 上半身尽量与地面平行，弯曲膝关节和髋部，直到大腿后侧紧贴小腿，无法蹲得更低为止。
en: Now, with your torso remaining as parallel to the floor as possible, bend at the knees and hips until your hamstrings reach your calves and you cannot go any further.

zh: 下蹲过程中你还需要弯曲双臂，在下降到最低点后腿部与手臂要同时发力，将身体推回到起始姿势。
en: This will require that you bend your arms, also.Using combined leg and arm power, push yourself up to the start position.

zh: 在整个折刀深蹲过程中，脚跟始终不能抬离地面。
en: Do not raise the heels at any point during the jackknife squat.

zh: 换句话说，如果测量没有一致性——如果连续的测验不能得到相同的结果——那么这个测验就不可信赖。
en: In other words, if the test is not consistent—if you cannot depend on successive trials to yield the same results—then the test cannot be trusted.

zh: 当然，测验有可能有信度却没有效度，但绝不可能有效度而没有信度。
en: Of course, scores from a test can be reliable yet not valid, but it can never be valid if it is not reliable.

zh: 例如，以一台损坏的体重器重复测量你的体重，就可能得到有信度却没有效度的结果。
en: For example, weighing yourself repeatedly on a broken scale would give reliable results but not valid ones.

zh: 测验信度在讨论时会以观察分数(observedscore)、眞实分数(truescore)、及误差分数（errorscore)这些名词来进行。
en: Test reliability is sometimes discussed in terms of observed score, true score, and error score.

zh: 在实验类的研究中，我们会在样本中进行分组。
en: In experimental research, groups are formed within the sample.

zh: 这里所处理的问题并不是如何选取样本，而是如何在样本中形成不同组别。
en: The issue here is not how the sample is selected but how the groups are formed within the sample.

zh: 在第十八章中，我们将讨论实验类型研究和真实验设计。
en: Chapter 18 discusses experimental research and true experimental designs.

zh: 所有的真实验设计都要求样本中的组别是随机分派的。
en: All true designs require that the groups within the sample be randomly assigned or randomized.

zh: 尽管这个必要条件与选取样本无关，但进行随机分派的程序是相同的。
en: Although this requirement has nothing to do with selecting the sample, the procedures used for random assignment are the same.

zh: 室上性心动过速是阵发性房性心动过速。
en: Supraventricular tachycardia is also known as paroxysmal atrial tachycardia.

zh: 室上性心动过速是心房的冲动异常快速地向心室传导的结果。
en: This dysrhythmia results from an abnormally rapid conduction of an atrial impulse into the ventricle.

zh: 室上性心动过速是短暂的和阵发的。
en: Supraventricular tachycardia is typically episodic and occurs in paroxysms.

zh: 关于振荡器神经元的发射速度。
en: The following is about the firing rate of the pacemaker neuron.

zh: CPG的主要作用是无意识地、自动地、精确地激活中枢神经系统中的单个神经纤维。
en: You will remember that the principal actor in the CPG is the spontaneous, automatic, regular-like-clockwork electrical firing of single nerve cells within the central nervous system.

zh: 这些神经元的自动化，是通过电解质（钠、钾、钙）移动穿过细胞膜发生的。
en: The automaticity of these neurons occurs from movement of electrolytes (sodium, potassium, calcium) across the cell membrane.

zh: 尽管，像心脏的窦房结起搏器一样，这些神经元具有一种内在的发射频率，但自动发射频率（和因此产生的脉冲频率）显然受许多外部因素的影响。
en: Although, like the sinus node pacemaker of the heart, these neurons possess an intrinsic firing the rate of spontaneous firing (and therefore the rate of impulse generation) is clearly influenced by a number of external factors.

zh: 人体测量中，质量是“精确性”和 “正确度”的专业术语。
en: In anthropometry, quality is a generic term for 'precision' and 'accuracy'.

zh: 二者并非同义语。
en: The terms are not synonymous.

zh: 正确度（accuracy)是从真实对象所获取的测量结果，是正确的或符合实际的。
en: Accuracy is the exactness or conformity of an obtained measure to the true score.

zh: 精确度（precision)是指数据的一致性(consistency),可以通过简单的重复测试过程来检验。
en: Precision is the consistency of data that can be determined by a simple replication procedure.

zh: 直立，双脚分开，与肩同宽或略宽。
